content:
みぐるしい〔見苦しい〕
〈形〉Unsightly (building); indecent, unbecoming, unbeseeming, unseemly (conduct or behaviour); ignominious, ignoble. disgraceful, dishonourable (death or defect); disreputable, unpresentable (appearance); shabby (dress)

content.content: 見苦しい振る舞い
unbecoming behaviour―unseemly behaviour
見苦しい振る舞いをするな
Do not behave unbecomingly!―behave unseemly!
青年が人を冷笑するのは見苦しい
It does not become a young man to sneer at people―It is unbecoming in a young man to sneer at people.
寡婦が急いで再婚したのは見苦しい
The widow married again with indecent haste.
彼は見苦しい身なりをしている
He is shabbily dressed.
見苦しからぬ身なりをしている
He is decently dressed―respectably dressed.
この見苦しい形{なり}では人前へ出られぬ
I am unpresentable―not fit to be seen.
彼は見苦しい死に方をした、見苦しい最後を遂げた
He died an ignominious death―died an ignoble death.
見苦しい負け方をした
He suffered an ignominious defeat.
敵に後を見せるとは見苦しい
It is disgraceful of him to turn his back to his enemy.
取り散らして甚だ見苦しうございますが
The room is in such unsightly disorder.
学問を見せびらかすのは見苦しい
It is bad form to parade one's learning.
夫婦が人前でいちゃつくのは見苦しい
It is bad form for man and wife to indulge in affectionate familiarities in company.
見苦しきあばら屋へようこそ御入来
You are welcome to my humble abode.
見苦しくとも住めば都
“Home is home, be it ever so homely.”

content:
みけつ〔未決〕
〈形〉Undecided (matter); unsettled (matter); pending (case); open (question); moot (point); unconvicted (prisoner); (a matter) in abeyance

content.content: 未決問題
an open question―a pending question―a moot point
その問題は未決だ
The question is still open to discussion.
そのことは未決になっている
The matter is in abeyance.
未決事件
a pending case
未決囚
an unconvicted prisoner
彼は未決で監獄に入っている
He is in prison pending his trial.

みけつかん〔未決監〕
〈名〉A house of detention

みけねこ〔三毛猫〕
〈名〉A tortoise-shell cat

content:
みけん〔眉間〕
〈名〉The space between the eyebrows

content.content: 眉間に傷跡がある
He has a scar between his eyebrows.
眉間を割る
to give one a cut between the eyes

content:
みこ〔三股〕
〈接続詞〉Three-ply; three-strand

content.content: 三股糸
a three-ply thread
三股縄
a three-strand rope

みこ〔巫女〕
〈名〉
1. (=市子)a medium
2. (=神子)a sort of vestal virgin

content:
みこし〔見越し〕
〈名〉
1. (=越して見ること)looking over (a fence, etc.)

content.content: 見越しの松
a pine-tree appearing over a wall

content: 2. (=予想)anticipation; expectation:(=の) anticipatory

content.content: 見越輸入
anticipatory importation
見越相場
anticipatory quotations
見越売買
sale on contingent―sale depending on chance
見越買い
buying in expectation―speculation
見越買いする
to buy on spec(=speculation)

content:
みこし〔御輿〕
〈名〉A portable shrine, a portable tabernacle (carried at festivals)

content.content: 樽御輿
a wine-cask carried by boys at festivals
御輿を担ぐ
to carry about a portable shrine―(人をもてはやすの意味なら)―make much of a man―make a hero of a man―make a lion of a man
御輿を据える
to sit down
彼らは御輿を据えて飲み始めた
They sat down to a carousal.
あの人は御輿を据えて話し込むので困る
He Will sit down for a long talk.

content:
みごしらえ〔身拵え〕
〈名〉Dress; equipment; outfit; get-up:(=する) to dress oneself; to get dressed; to get oneself up; to equip oneself (for an expedition); to fit oneself out (for a journey)

content.content: 彼はもう身ごしらえができている
He is dressed already.
急いで身ごしらえをした
I dressed myself―got dressed―in haste.
彼は身ごしらえをそこそこに出ていった
He went out after dressing himself in haste.
皆甲斐甲斐しい身ごしらえだ
They are all gallantly equipped.
旅の身ごしらえ
a travelling outfit
長い旅行に行くについて身ごしらえをしなければならぬ
I must fit myself out for a long journey.

content:
みこす〔見越す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=越して見る)to look over (a fence); to look across (a field)
2. (=予想する)to anticipate (a war); to expect (a rise, etc.)

content.content: 騰貴を見越してたくさん買い込んだ
He laid in a large stock in expectation of a rise―in anticipation of a rise.

content:
みこと〔尊〕
〈名〉(Archaic for) a prince

content.content: 日本武尊
Prince Yamatodake.

content:
みごと〔見事〕
〈名〉A sight to see, a beauty:(=な) beautiful; admirable:(=に) beautifully; admirably; fairly

content.content: 花は見事だ
The blossoms are a sight to see.
実にお見事なものです
It is quite a beauty.
装飾は見事にできている
The decorations are beautifully done.
見事なお手際だ
It is a beautiful performance.
見事な飛行ぶりだ
It is a beautiful flight.
彼はあっぱれ見事に成功した
He has succeeded to admiration.
あっぱれ見事に及第した
He has come off with flying colours.
あっぱれ見事にやってのけた
He has acquitted himself to his credit.
君の評は見事に的中している
You have fairly hit the nail on the head.
あの相撲は見事に相手を投げた
He has fairly flung his antagonist.
彼は見事に相手を真二つに斬った
He fairly cleft his adversary in twain.
彼は見事に負けた
He is fairly beaten.
また見事に失敗した
He has managed to fail again.
敵の計画は見事に破られた
The enemy's plans are fairly defeated.
お見事、お見事 (!)
Well done!―Bravo!

みことのり〔詔〕
〈名〉An Imperial mandate, edict or decree:(=する) to decree

content:
みこみ〔見込〕
〈名〉
1. (=望み)hopes, chances, probabilities, possibilities(は打消、成句のほかは複数); odds(はいつも複数); likelihood, promise(はいつも単数)

content.content: 彼は成功の見込があるか
Are there any hopes of his success?―any chances of his success?
彼は成功の見込が多少ある

There are some hopes of his success―There are some chances of his success―The chances are in favour of his success―He stands a chance of success―He is likely to succeed―He bids fair to succeed―He is in a fair way to succeed.
彼は成功の見込無し

There is no hope of his success―There is no chance of his success―The chances are against his success―He stands no chance of success―He is unlikely to succeed―There is no likelihood of his succeeding.
ドイツの勝てる見込が無かった
There was no hope of Germany winning―no chance of Germany winning―no probability of Germany winning―no possibility of Germany winning―The chances were against Germany's winning.
病人は全快の見込があるか
Are there any hopes of his recovery?
全快の見込が無い
There is no hope of his recovery.
まだ見込がある
There is yet hope (of his recovery).
医者は全快の見込があると言う
The doctor holds out hopes of his recovery.
全然全快の見込無し(万事休す)
He is beyond all hope of recovery―past all hope―He is a hopeless case―a gone case―It is all over with him―It is all up with him.
見込の無い患者
a hopeless case―a gone case
治療の見込無し
He is past cure.
見込はどうか
How are the chances?―What are the possibilities?―What are the probabilities?
見込が立つ
The chances are in my favour.
見込が立たぬ
The chances are against me.
見込が立つか
Do you stand a chance of success?
見込が立った
Success is in sight.
七分三分の見込がある
The odds are 7 to 3.
種々の見込がある
There are several possibilities―various probabilities.
こんな所にいては末の見込が無い
If I remain here, I shall have no chance of getting on―My present position offers no prospect of advancement.
この事業は成功の見込がある
The project is likely to be a success―It promises to be a success.
今年は良作の見込がある
This year promises a good harvest.
この商売はだいぶ儲かる見込がある
The business promises large returns.
この商売は将来の見込があるか
Has the business a future?
先の見込は充分ある
It has a bright future before it.
末の見込が無い
It gives no promise for the future.
あれはたいそう見込のある男だ
He is a man of great promise―He is a promising man―He has a bright future before him.
彼には勝てる見込が充分ある
I stand a good chance against him.
君には勝てる見込が無い
I stand no chance against you.
勝てる見込の無い勝負だ
It is a losing game.
追いつく見込の無い追撃である
It is a losing chase.
彼は改心の見込が無い
There is no hope of his reforming―He is irreclaimable―irredeemable―incorrigible―past praying for.
彼は挽回の見込無し
He is past retrieve.

content: 2. (=予想)expectation; prospect; outlook; calculation; estimate; forecast

content.content: 見込はどうか
How are the prospects?
見込が好い
The prospects are bright―The outlook is good.
見込が悪い
The prospects are dark―The outlook is bad.
成功の見込があるか
Is there any prospect of success?
成功の見込がある、見込が無い
There is a prospect of success―no prospect of success.
当分物価の下がる見込が無い
There is no prospect of the prices falling for the present.
物価は今年中に下落する見込だ
The prices are expected to fall in the course of the year.
本年の米作は平年以上の見込
This year's rice-crop is estimated to be above the average.
一カ月で全快の見込
He is expected to be well in a month.
建築費は一万円の見込
The cost of building is estimated at 10,000 yen.
相場が上がる見込で品物を買い入れた
I bought in the goods in expectation of a rise.
成績は見込通りにいった
The result has come up to my expectations.
見込以上だ
The result is beyond my expectations.
見込通りにいかない
The result has fallen short of my expectations.
見込がはずれた、見込が違った
I am disappointed of my expectations―I have miscalculated.
見込違い
miscalcuIation
見込ががらりとはずれた
Things have gone contrary to my expectations―My calculations are upset―My hopes are shattered―My hopes are dashed to the ground.
君の見込は必ず当たる
Your forecast never fails.
僕の見込はいつもはずれる
My forecast always fails.
見込を立てる
to form an estimate
見込買い
a purchase on spec(= speculation)―a speculative purchase
先の見込
a future―an outlook―prospects
この事業は先の見込があるか
Has the enterprise a future?
先の見込が充分ある
It has a bright future before it.
先の見込が無い
It has no future.

content: 3. (=意見)an opinion; a judgment

content.content: 見込をつける
to form an opinion―form a judgment―of a person or a thing
彼を泥棒と見込をつけた
I have spotted him as the thief.
僕が見込をつけたら決してはずれぬ
My judgment never errs.
(病人は治りますか)お見込はどうですか
What is your opinion?
私の見込では治ります
In my opinion, he will recover―I am of the opinion that he will recover.
他にも犯罪のある見込
Hi is suspected to be guilty of other crimes.
ほかにも党類のある見込
Hi is suspected to have accomplices.
(試験をせずに与える)見込点
credit marks―arbitrary marks

みこみちがい〔見込違い〕
〈名〉Miscalculation:(=する) to miscalculate

content:
みこむ〔見込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=予期する)to expect; to anticipate

content.content: 騰貴を見込む
to expect a rise―anticipate a rise
騰貴を見込んでたくさん買い込んだ
I laid in a large stock in expectation of a rise―in anticipation of a rise.

content: 2. (=当て込む)to count upon, reckon upon, calculate upon (anything)

content.content: 君の助力を見込んで仕事を引受けたのだ
I undertook the work, counting upon your assistance.
儲けを見込んだのが間違いだった
I made a mistake in counting upon the gains.

content: 3. (=見詰める、目星を打つ)to fix one's eyes upon(anything); to fix one's choice upon(a person); to fix upon(a person); to fasten upon(one's victim); to spot(a man as the culprit); to mark(a man for one's victim); to fascinate (a sparrow)

content.content: 彼は社長に見込まれて令嬢の婿になったのだ
His president fixed upon him as his daughter's husband.
すりに見込まれた
A pickpocket fastened upon me as his victim―marked me for an easy prey.
彼は刑事に犯人と見込まれた
A detective spotted him as the culprit.
あの男に見込まれたら最後だ
Woe to you if he marks you for his victim!
僕に見込まれたのがお前の因果だ
It was your misfortune to be marked for my victim.
不運の神に見込まれた
Misfortune marked me for her own.
蛇に見込まれた雀のよう
He is a sparrow fascinated by a snake.
あの人にかかったら蝮蛇に見込まれたも同然だ
He grips like a vice.
僕は彼の過ちの無い所を見込んで選んだのだ
I chose him with an eye to his prudence.
彼は彼女の学問を見込んで貰ったのだ
He married her for the sake of her learning.
男と見込んで頼む
I appeal to you as man to man.

content: 4. (=差し引く)to allow for (accidents)

content.content: 破損を見込む
to allow for damages
破損を見込んでも十個は残る
Allowing for breakage, we shall have ten left.
(卵を百抱かせて)間違いを見込んでも八十羽は孵る
Allowing for accidents, we shall have 80 chickens.

content:
みごろ〔見頃〕
〈形〉(To be) at its best

content.content: 花は見頃だ
The blossoms are at their best.
次の日曜は見頃だ
They will be at their best―in their glory―next Sunday.

content:
みころし〔見殺し〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: みごろし〔見殺し〕

content:
みごろし〔見殺し〕
〈名〉Having (a person) die under one's eyes (without making any attempt to save him); leaving (one) to one's fate

content.content: 彼を見殺しにした
He died under my very eye.
病人を医者にかけずに見殺しにした
They had the invalid die under their very nose, without even medical attendance.
こういう場合に人が海へ落ちるようなものなら見殺しにするよりほかは無い
If a man should fall overboard on such occasions, we should have to see him drown without any attempt to save him.
たとい乞食でも見殺しにはできない
You can not leave even a beggar to fate.

content:
みこん〔未墾〕
〈形〉Uncultivated; uncleared

content.content: 未墾の地
uncultivated land―uncleared land―waste land―virgin soil

content:
みこん〔未婚〕
〈形〉Unmarried; single

content.content: 未婚者
an unmarried person―(男なら)―a single gentleman―a bachelor―(女なら)―a single lady―a spinster―a maiden.

みさい〔未済〕
〈形〉Unpaid (bill); unsettled (account); outstanding (debt or loan)

content:
みさお〔操〕
〈名〉
1. (=男の節操)constancy; fidelity; honour; principles

content.content: 政治家の操
fidelity to one's political principles
操を守る
to remain faithful to one's cause―adhere to one's principles―stick to one's colours
操を売る
to sell one's honour for money―prostitute one's honour

content: 2. (=女の貞操)chastity; (female) honour; (feminine) virtue; (a girl's) virginity, maidenhead:(男に対する操)constancy:(夫に対する操)fidelity

content.content: 操を守
to preserve one's chastity―remain constant―remain faithful
男に操を立てる
to remain constant to―remain faithful to―be true to―a man
若後家が亡人に対して操を立て通した
The young widow remained faithful to the memory of her husband.
女は男に操を立てなかった
She was false to him.
操を破る
to lose one's chastity―stray from the path of virtue
女は一度操を破ると一生のキズもの
If a woman once loses her chastity, she is ruined for life.
あの女は操を汚している
She has lost her chastity―She has strayed from the path of virtue―She has a spot on her honour.
男が女の操を躙蹂する(汚す、弄ぶ)
A man dishonours a woman―seduces a woman―ruins a girl―betrays a girl―plucks a flower.
女が男に操を捧げる
A woman surrenders her chastity to a man―gives herself to a man.
操を売る
to sell one's chastity―prostitute oneself
操正しき婦人だ
She is a chaste woman―a virtuous lady.
操を正しくする
to live a chaste life
操の高い婦人だ
She is the soul of honour.
操の鑑だ
She is a paragon of virtue―a pattern of female honour.
操の鏡曇り無き婦人だ
She has not a spot on her honour.
操の無い女だ
She is an unchaste woman―a frail woman―a profligate woman.

content:
みさかい〔見境〕
〈名〉Distinction; discrimination

content.content: 見さかいなく
without distinction―without discrimination―indiscriminately
彼の誰彼の見さかいが無い
He makes no distinction of persons.
酔うと誰彼の見さかいがなくなる
He loses all distinction of persons when he is drunk.
誰彼の見さかいなく当たり散らす
He falls foul of everybody without distinction of persons.
彼は善し悪しの見さかいなく人を賞める
He praises without discrimination―He is an indiscriminate admirer.
畜生のあさましさ、親兄弟の見さかいも無い
Being but dumb beasts, they wallow in promiscuous intercourse.

content:
みさき〔岬〕
〈名〉A cape; a promontory; a headland; a land's end; a point

content.content: 岬を廻る
to double a cape

content:
みさげる〔見下げる〕
〈他動〉To look down upon (a man); to despise (a man); to regard (a man) with contempt; to hold (a man) in contempt; to think ill of (a man)

content.content: 皆彼を食客のように見下げている
Everybody looks down upon him as a sort of dependant.
身なりが賤しいとて人を見下げるものじゃない
You should not think the worse of a man because hi is meanly dressed.
見下げ果てた奴だ
What a contemptible fellow!―What a despicable fellow!

みささぎ〔陵〕
〈名〉An Imperial mausoleum

content:
みさだめる〔見定める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=確かめる)To ascertain, to make sure of (the fact); to assure oneself of (the fact)

content.content: 成功を見定めてから取りかかるがよい
You ought to set work after making sure of success.
いよいよこの人と見定めないうちは惚れない
She falls in love only when she has assured herself of her man.

content: 2. (=ところを見定める)to locate

content.content: 敵陣を見定める
to locate the enemy's position

content:
みざめ〔見醒め〕
〈名〉Growing tired of looking

content.content: 下手な絵は見ざめがする
One grows tired of looking at poor paintings.
この景色は見ざめがしない
You never tire of looking at this view.

content:
みじかい〔短い〕
〈形〉Short:(手短か)brief:(不愛想に短い)curt

content.content: 竿が三尺短い
The pole is three feet too short―too short by three feet.
冬は日が短い
The days are short in winter.
秋は日が短くなる
The days grow shorter―The night gains upon the day―in autumn.
長い月日に短い命
Time is long, and life is short.
太く短く
“A short life and a merry one”
江戸っ子は気が短い
The Edokko is short-tempered―quick-tempered.
この商売をする者は寿命が短い
Those who engage in their business are short-lived.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 髪を短く刈る
to cut one's hair close―crop one's hair close
日本人は髪を短く刈っている
The Japanese wear their hair close-cropped.
彼は老い先の短い身だ
He has not long to live―He is not long for this world.
帯に短し襷{たすき}に長し
I can find no suitable one―None of them suit me.
長い短いを言わずに金をだせ
Down with your money without any more palaver!

みじかよ〔短か夜〕
〈名〉A short (summer) night

content:
みじく〔未熟〕
〈形〉
1. (=熟さぬ)unripe, immature (fruit); green (apples, etc.)
2. (=円熟せぬ)immature (ideas); green (workman); raw (youth); crude (effort); inexperienced (young man, etc.)

content.content: 未熟な青年
a green youth―a raw youth
未熟な作
a crude effort
未熟な思想
immature ideas
僕の英語は未熟だ
My English is far from perfect.
未熟なために不覚をとった
I failed through want of experience.
未熟者
a green hand―a greenhorn―a novice―a tiro

content:
みじたく〔身仕度〕
〈名〉Dress; equipment; outfit; get-up; preparations:(=する) to dress oneself; to equip oneself; to fit oneself out

content.content: 旅行の身仕度をする
to fit oneself out for a journey―make preparations for a journey
旅行の身仕度
a travelling outfit
彼は旅行の身仕度をして東京駅に待ち合わしていた
He was waiting at Tokyo Station equipped for the road.
彼は散歩の身仕度をして出て来た
He came out equipped for a walk.

content:
みじまい〔身仕舞〕
〈名〉Dressing; toilet:(=する) to dress oneself; to make one's toilet

content.content: 婦人は身じまいをしている
She is making her toilet―at her toilet.

content:
ミシミシ
〈擬音詞〉Creaking

content.content: 廊下を歩くとミシミシいう
The verandah creaks beneath your feet.

content:
みじめ
〈形〉Wretched; miserable; pitiful; piteous; pitiable

content.content: 貧民はみじめな暮らしをする
The poor live a wretched life―lead a miserable existence―drag out a miserable existence.
みじめな光景であった
It was a piteous spectacle.
あの女はみじめな境遇だ
Hers is a pitiable lot.
こう雨続きでは労働者はみじめなものだ
The labourers are to be pitied in this long rain.

content:
みじゅく〔未熟〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: みじく〔未熟〕

content:
みしょう〔実生〕
〈名〉A plant raised from the seed; a seedling

content.content: 実生の菊
a seedling chrysanthemum―a maiden chrysanthemum

content:
みしょう〔未詳〕
〈名〉Unknown; uncertain

content.content: その人は住所姓名未詳なり
His name and address are unknown―The man is not yet identified.
被害高は未詳
The extent of damage is uncertain―not yet ascertained.

content:

content:

〈名〉(英国にては)a shop:(米国にては) a store:(俗に)an emporium:(大商人の店は)an office:(一般に)a house; an establishment; one's place of business:(商売の意味なら)one's business:(商会の意味なら)a firm:(露店は)a stall; a booth

content.content: 店を張る
to keep shop―keep store
彼は店を張っている商人だ
He is a tradesman and keeps shop.
銀座に店を張っている
He keeps a shop on the Ginza.
店を開く、店を出す
to open a shop―start a store―(開業するの意味なら)―set up in business―start a business
彼は呉服屋の店を出した
He has opened a dry-goods shop.
呉服屋の店を出している
He keeps a dry-goods shop.
女にタバコ屋の店を開かせた
He has set her up as a tobacconist.
大道に店を出す
to keep a stall―keep a booth―in the street
店を閉じる、店をしまう
(閉店の意味なら)to shut up shop―close business―give up one's business―retire from business―close one's doors―(夜に入ってなら)―shut up for the night
今晩は店をしまいました
We have shut up for the night.
店じまいにつき大安売
We offer great bargains as we are retiring from business―Great bargains offered at final riddance sale.
店を畳む
to wind up one's business
彼は店のことは息子に任せきりだ
He commits his business to his son's care.
債権者に店を明け渡した
He has turned over his business to his creditors.
私が店を引受けましたからどうぞお引立を願います
I have taken over the business, and I hope you will patronize me.
繁昌な店だ
It is a flourishing business―a going concern.
店で買う

あの店は高い、 あの店は安い
They sell dear at that house―sell cheap at that house.
あの店はなかなか勉強する

to tend the shop―mind the store

不足を満たす
to supply a deficiency―make up a deficit

content: 2. (=満足せしむ)to satisfy (one's appetite); to gratify (one's desire); to appease (one's hunger); to supply (the demand); to meet (the need)

content.content: 情慾を充たす
to gratify one's passion―pander to the passions
食慾を充たす
to satisfy one's appetite―appease one's hunger
慾望を充たす
to gratify one's desire
好奇心を充たす
to gratify one's curiosity
虚栄心を充たす
to gratify one's vanity―tickle one's vanity―pander to one's vanity
需要を充たす
to supply the demand―meet the demand
要求を充たす
to satisfy one's demands
必要を充たす
to meet the need―fill a need―minister to one's needs

content:
みたす〔満たす、充たす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=充満せしむ)to fill (a purse with money); to stop (a gap); to supply (a deficiency)

content.content: 盃に酒を満たす
to fill a cup with wine
明きを満たす
to fill a vacancy―stop a gap―supply a blank
不足を満たす
to supply a deficiency―make up a deficit

content: 2. (=満足せしむ)to satisfy (one's appetite); to gratify (one's desire); to appease (one's hunger); to supply (the demand); to meet (the need)

content.content: 情慾を充たす
to gratify one's passion―pander to the passions
食慾を充たす
to satisfy one's appetite―appease one's hunger
慾望を充たす
to gratify one's desire
好奇心を充たす
to gratify one's curiosity
虚栄心を充たす
to gratify one's vanity―tickle one's vanity―pander to one's vanity
需要を充たす
to supply the demand―meet the demand
要求を充たす
to satisfy one's demands
必要を充たす
to meet the need―fill a need―minister to one's needs

content:
みだす〔乱す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=混乱せしむ)to throw (anything) into disorder; to throw (anything) into confusion; to disarrange (a bed); to derange (one's plans); to ruffle, rumple, tousle, disorder (one's hair)

content.content: 列を乱す
to break the ranks
砲が破裂して列を乱した
A bursting shell threw the ranks into confusion―threw the ranks into disorder.
戦争のためにすっかり計画を乱された
The war has deranged all my plans―upset all my plans.
一人の女が髪を乱して駈けて来た
A woman came running with her hair disordered―with dishevelled hair.
歩調を乱す
to break step―(態度の意味なら)―waver in attitude
当員が歩調を乱した
The party-men wavered in attitude.

content: 2. (=擾乱する)to disturb (order); to agitate (a country, etc.)

content.content: 秩序を乱す
to disturb order―throw anything into disorder―derange anything
社会の秩序を乱す
to disturb public order
安寧を乱す
to disturb the public peace
国を乱す
to disturb the country―agitate the country
世を乱す
to put the times out of joint―throw the times out of gear

content: 3. (=壊乱する)to corrupt (morals); to destroy (public morals); to demoralize (the people)

content.content: 風儀を乱す
to corrupt public morals―be destructive to public morals―demoralize the people
風紀を乱す
to destroy discipline

content: 4. (=錯乱せしむ)to derange; to distract

content.content: 心を乱す
to derange the mind―distract the mind―drive one to distraction―drive one distracted―drive one mad

content:
みたて〔見立て〕
〈名〉
1. (=選択)choice; selection:(=る) to choose; to select; to make one's choice; to take one's choice

content.content: お見立てなさい
You may make your choice―take your choice.
好いのを見立てて上げましょう
I will choose a good one for you.
お見立てがお上手です
You have made a good choice―You have good taste―I admire your taste.
あんな者を選ぶようでは彼は見立てが下手だ
His choice shows that he has bad taste.
彼は見立てに背かぬ
He has justified my choice―justified my confidence―proved himself worthy of confidence.

content: 2. (=判断、 鑑定)judgment; opinion:(=る) to judge of (a person); to form an opinion of (a person); to pronounce (an article genuine or false)

content.content: あの人を善い人と見立てた
I have a good opinion of him―I think well of him.
僕の見立てたところでは立派な学者だ
In my opinion, he is a fine scholar.
お見立てはどうですか
What is your opinion?
誰の作とお見立てですか
Whose work do you pronounce it to be?
正宗と見立てます
I pronounce it to be a Masamune.
鑑定家がこの品を本物と見立てました
A connoisseur has pronounced the article genuine.
見立て違い
misjudgment
人を見立て違いする
to misjudge a character

content: 3. (=診断)a medical opinion; diagnosis:(=る) to diagnose (a case as consumption); to pronounce (one's illness serious or slight)

content.content: 肺結核と見立てます
I have diagnosed the case as pulmonary tuberculosis.
医者は僕の病気を軽症と見立てた
The doctor has pronounced my illness to be a slight one.
医者の見立てでは僕の病気は軽い
In the doctor's opinion, my illness is a slight one.

content: 4. (=譬え)comparison:(=る) to compare, likens (one thing to another)

content.content: 彼の生活を時計に見立てたのは面白い
It is a good idea to compare his life to a clock―liken his life to a clock.

content: 5. (=る)(=見送る)to see (one) off

みたま〔御霊〕
〈名〉
1. (=死者の霊)a departed soul
2. (=聖霊)the Holy Ghost

content:
みたまま〔見た儘〕
〈名〉An eye-witness's account

content.content: 見たまま(聞いたまま)を話そう
I will tell you what I saw (and heard).

みたまや〔御霊屋〕
〈名〉A mausoleum

content:
みたよう〔見た様〕
〈形〉Like:(動詞に訳せば) to look like (something)

content.content: あの人は役者見たようだ
He looks like an actor.
殿様見たような顔をしている
He has a face like a lord's.
あの人の伝を書いたら小説見たようだろう
His life would read like a romance.

content:
みだら〔猥ら〕
〈形〉Wanton; lewd; licentious; lascivious; indelicate; immodest; immoral; improper; impure; indecent; obscene; ribald; bawdy; dirty; foul; filthy; smutty; loose

content.content: 猥らな振舞
wanton behaviour―(女なら)―light behaviour―free behaviour
猥らな振舞をする
to wanton with a man or a woman
猥らな女
a wanton girl―a loose woman
猥らな風儀
loose morals
猥らな話
obscene talk―ribald talk―bawdy talk―dirty talk―foul talk―filthy talk―smut―ribaldry
猥らな話は止せ
Don't talk bawdy!
女に対して猥らな挙動に及ぶ
to take liberties with a woman―attempt familiarities with a woman

みたらし〔御手洗〕
〈名〉Holy water (for washing the hands before worshipping)

content:
みだり〔猥り〕
〈形〉Wanton; gratuitous; unwarranted; wilful

content.content: みだりな殺生をするな
Abstain from wanton waste of life―gratuitous slaughter―unwarranted slaughter.
みだりの損傷は弁償を要す
Wilful damage must be compensated for.

みだりがわしい〔猥りがわしい〕
〈形〉Wanton, indelicate, immodest, indecent, improper (talk or behaviour)

content:
みたりきいたり〔見たり聞いたり〕
〈名〉Seeing and hearing:(=する) to see and hear

content.content: 子どもは見たり聞いたりして覚える
A child learns form its surroundings.

content:
みだりに〔猥りに〕
〈副〉
1. (=許可無く)without permission; without authority

content.content: みだりに入るべからず
No entrance without permission―No admittance except on business.
彼はみだりに官金を使用したのだ
He has appropriated public money without authority.

content: 2. (=故無く)without cause; without reason; without provocation; wantonly; gratuitously; unwarrantedly; wilfully; arbitrarily

content.content: みだりに妻を離縁するものでない
One should not put away one's wife without cause.
みだりに欠席すべからず
No one shall absent himself without reason.
みだりに人を打つものでない
You should not strike a man without provocation.
みだりに殺生をするものでない
You should not waste life wantonly―You should refrain from wanton waste of life.
みだりに校物を毀損する者はこれを弁償せしむべし
Those who damage school property wilfully, shall be made to compensate for it.
みだりに干渉しては有害無益だ
Arbitrary interference will do more harm than good.
みだりに人を非難するものでない
You should not indulge in gratuitous censure―indulge in unwarranted censure.

content: 3. (=目的無く)at random; at hazard; at haphazard

content.content: みだりに言を吐くな
Do not speak at random!
兵は暗闇でみだりに発砲した
The men fired at random in the dark.
みだりに人を入れてはいかん
You must not admit people at hazard.

content: 4. (=必要無く)unnecessarily; uselessly; in vain

content.content: みだりに兵を犠牲にする大将は無い
No general will unnecessarily sacrifice his men―uselessly sacrifice his men.
みだりに神の御名を用いるなかれ
“Take not God's name in vain.”

みだれがみ〔乱れ髪〕
〈名〉Dishevelled hair; disordered hair; tousled hair; tousy hair; ruffled hair; shock

content:
みだれる〔乱れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=混乱する、紊乱する)to be disordered; to be in disorder; to be confused; to be in confusion; to be disarranged

content.content: 家庭が乱れている
His home is in disorder.
会計が乱れている
The accounts are in confusion―at sixes and sevens.
隊伍が乱れる
The ranks fall into confusion―The ranks are thrown into confusion―thrown into disorder.
砲弾が破裂して隊伍が乱れた
A shell bursting threw the ranks into disorder―threw the ranks into confusion.
歩調が乱れる
They are out of step―(意見の意味なら)―They waver in opinion.
当員の歩調が乱れた
The party-men wavered in attitude.
寝所が乱れている
The bed is disarranged.
髪が乱れている
Her hair is disordered―dishevelled―tousled―ruffled―rumpled.
一糸乱れず
to be in perfect order
少女不言
The maiden utters ne'er a word,
花不語
Nor doth the flower explain;
英雄心緒
The valiant hero's puzzled mind
乱如糸
Is like a tangled skein.

content: 2. (=擾乱する)to be disturbed; to be agitated; to be troubled; to be chaotic; to be anarchic

content.content: 国が乱れている
The country is disturbed―The country is agitated.
国が非常に乱れている
The country is in a chaotic state―Anarchy reigns over the land.
天下麻の如く乱る
The land is torn by factions.
乱れた世
troubled times―troublous times
国乱れて忠臣現る
“Adversity brings out a man's virtues”―“Night brings out the stars.”

content: 3. (=壊乱する)to be corrupt; to be lax; to be loose

content.content: 風儀が乱れている
The public morals are corrupt―The public morals are lax.
規律が乱れている
Discipline is lax―Discipline is loose.

content: 4. (=錯乱する)to be deranged; to be distracted

content.content: 彼は心が乱れている
He is distracted―deranged in mind.
失望の結果心が乱れたのだ
Vexation has driven him to distraction―driven him mad.
乱れた心を鎮める
to collect one's scattered wits―collect oneself―compose oneself

content:
みち〔道、路〕
〈名〉
1. (=道路)a road:(公道)a highway:(人道)a path:(行く道)a way:(通路)a passage:(道筋)a route:(往還)a thoroughfare:(踏み慣らした路)a track:(通り)a street:(市街)the streets

content.content: (雨が降って)道が悪い
The roads are bad.
お話にならない道だ
The roads are execrable.
この道はどこへ行く道か
Where does this road lead to?
この道は停車場へ行く道だ
This road leads to the station―This is the way to the station.
この道を行けば停車場へ出ます
This road will take you to the station.
どの道を行けば停車場へ出ますか
Which road shall I take to get to the station?
右の方の道をお出でなさい
Take the road to the right!
この道を真っすぐに行けば停車場へ出ます
Follow this street, and you will find yourself at the station.
失敗は成功に到るの道
Failure is the way to success.
徳行は幸福に到るの道、不徳は不幸に到るの道
Virtue leads to happiness, vice to misery.
滅亡に到るの道は広し
“Broad is the path that leads to destruction.”
この前はこの道を来なかった
We did not come by this way.
どの道を来たか
By which way did you come?
道はどこを通るか
Where does the road run?
道は崖縁を通る
The road runs along the edge of a precipice.
道を通る
to pass along a road
道を歩く
to walk down a road―(上り坂に限って)―walk up a road―(市街なら)―walk the streets
この道を通ったことが無い
I never passed along this road―never went down this road.
婦人が子どもをぞろぞろ連れて道を歩いているのをよく見かける
I often see her walking the streets with her children at her heels.
路を拾って歩く
to pick one's steps through the mire
道に迷う
to lose one's way―go astray―stray
道に迷いそうだ
I am afraid I shall lose my way.
道に迷って山奥に入った
I strayed into the depths of the mountains.
道を間違える
to mistake the road―take the wrong road
道を聞く
to ask the way―inquire the way
停車場へ行く道を聞いた
I inquired the way to the station.
道を教える
to show one the way―tell one the way
誰かに道を教えてお貰い
Get some one to show you the way.
道を開く
to open a way―clear the track
道を明けろ
Clear the track!
群衆が道を開いて一行を通した
The crowd made way for the party.
後進のために道を開く
to make room for one's juniors―give place to one's juniors
彼は後進のために道を開く為に職を辞した
He resigned his post to make way for his juniors―in favour of his juniors.
(改革などの)道を開く
to pave the way for reform
(新鉱山などへ)道を付ける
to make a road―build a road―to a new mine
道をふさぐ
to bar the way―block the passage―stand in the way
馬車で道がふさがっている
The street is blocked with carriages.
道に当る
to lie in the way
郵便局は道だ
The Post Office lies in my way.
道を譲る
to give one the wall
道を譲らぬ
to take the wall of one
道が分れる
A road branches off―One comes to a parting of the ways.
道に捨てたるを拾わず
One should not pick up what one finds on the road.
踏み慣らした路
a beaten track
逃げ路
a way of escape―a way out (of the difficulty)

content: 2. (=途、途中)(on) the way; (on) the road

content.content: 途で尋ねた
I inquired on the way.
ここへ来る途で尋ねた
I inquired on my way here.
途で尋ねて家がわかった
I found the house by inquiring on the way―by inquiring on my way here.
学校へ行く途で逢った
I met him on my way to school.
うちへ帰る途で立寄った
I looked in on my way home.
道が遠いから途で暇をつぶす
I spend much time on the road.
君は途で逢ったらわからないほど変わった
I should not know you if I met you in the streets.
途から取って返す
to turn back―retrace one's steps―double on one's tracks

content: 3. (=路程)a way; a journey; the distance; ground

content.content: 路が遠い
The way is long―It is a long way off―The distances are long.
王子までは路が遠い
It is a long way to Oji.
路が遠いから途中で暇をつぶす
The distances are so long that I waste time on the road.
昔は十日の路であった
It used to be a ten days' journey.
今日は路がはかどった
We have done a good journey today.
幾里の路を越す
to go over (or cover) so much ground
十マイルの路を越す
to cover ten miles of ground
駿馬たちまち十マイルの路を越す
Ten miles are soon gone over on a swift horse.
君と僕は同じ路を踏んでいる
We have gone over the same ground.
半分路
half-way
名古屋は東京と京都の半分路だ
Nagoya lies half-way between Tokyo and Kyoto.
道の半分は歩いた
I walked one half of the distance―I did half the distance―on foot.

content: 4. (=里)a ri; a Japanese mile

content.content: そこまでは半道だ
It is only half a ri off.

content: 5. (=歩行)walking

content.content: 君は道に強いか
Are you a good walker?―a good pedestrian?
僕は道に弱い
I am a poor walker―a poor pedestrian.

content: 6. (=方法、方針)a way; a path; a course; an avenue; means

content.content: 道を探る
to adopt a course―take a course
どの道をとろうか
What course shall I adopt?
探るべき道はほかに無い
There is no other course―There is no alternative―This is the only course open to me.
時機を待つよりほかに道は無い
This is nothing for it but to wait―We have no choice but to wait.
安全な道を踏む
to tread a safe path―take a safe course
危険な道を踏む
to tread a dangerous path―take a dangerous course
出世の道
a way to advancement―an avenue for advancement
才子には出世の道がいくらもある
Careers are open to talent.
生活の道
means of livelihood
生活の道を立てる
to gain one's livelihood―get one's living
生活の道を立ててやる
I will put you in the way of getting your own living.
この金の使い道が無い
I do not know how to use this money―what to do with this money.

content: 7. (=教えの道)the path (of virtue or duty); virtue; right truth; (whose) teachings, doctrines, principles

content.content: 人たるの道
the path of duty―the whole duty of man
人たるの道を踏む
to walk the path of duty―walk with God
人たるの道を踏み迷う
to err from the path of duty
武士の道
the path of the samurai―chivalry
女の道
the path of virtue―female honour―good principles
彼女は女の道を心得ている
She has good principles.
女の道を踏み迷う
to stray from the path of virtue
道を修める
to cultivate virtue
道に従う
to follow the path of virtue―follow the path of right
道を学ぶ
to learn the path of virtue―learn the truth
朝に道を聞けば夕に死すとも可なり
If I hear the truth today, I shall be content to die tomorrow.
道を伝える
to preach the truth
道ならぬ事をする
to err from the path of right―do wrong
道ならぬ恋
illicit love―(女なら)―misplaced affections
道ならぬ商売
unlawful trade―iniquitous trade
孔孟の道
the teachings of Confucius and Mencius―Confucianism
孔孟の道を学ぶ
to study Confucianism
孔孟の道を説く
to expound the doctrines of Confucianism―preach Confucianism

content: 8. (=専門)a line of business; an art; a subjects; a trade; a profession; a specialty

content.content: その道に明るい
to be in the line―in the business―in the trade―versed in the subject―skilled in the art
その道に暗からず
He is skilled in the art.
商売は道によって賢し
“Every man to his trade.”
その道を極める
to master one's subject―make oneself master of one's business
彼はその道を極めている
He is master of his business―(女なら)―She is mistress of her business.
その道の極意を極める
to be initiated into the mysteries of the art
その道の為に尽くす
to devote oneself to one's art
その道の人
a specialist―a professional―an expert
その道の人に聞いてみた
I have consulted a specialist.
その道の大家だ
He is an authority on the subject―a master of his business―an adept in the art.
その道の連中
men in the line―(men of) the fancy

content:
9. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 恋の道
the lore of love
越すに越されぬ恋の道
One can not get over love.
蛇の道は蛇
“Set a thief to catch a thief”―“Like knows like.”
(女が)血の道を起こす
to be ill of fright

content:
みち〔道、路〕
〈名〉
1. (=道路)a road:(公道)a highway:(人道)a path:(行く道)a way:(通路)a passage:(道筋)a route:(往還)a thoroughfare:(踏み慣らした路)a track:(通り)a street:(市街)the streets

content.content: (雨が降って)道が悪い
The roads are bad.
お話にならない道だ
The roads are execrable.
この道はどこへ行く道か
Where does this road lead to?
この道は停車場へ行く道だ
This road leads to the station―This is the way to the station.
この道を行けば停車場へ出ます
This road will take you to the station.
どの道を行けば停車場へ出ますか
Which road shall I take to get to the station?
右の方の道をお出でなさい
Take the road to the right!
この道を真っすぐに行けば停車場へ出ます
Follow this street, and you will find yourself at the station.
失敗は成功に到るの道
Failure is the way to success.
徳行は幸福に到るの道、不徳は不幸に到るの道
Virtue leads to happiness, vice to misery.
滅亡に到るの道は広し
“Broad is the path that leads to destruction.”
この前はこの道を来なかった
We did not come by this way.
どの道を来たか
By which way did you come?
道はどこを通るか
Where does the road run?
道は崖縁を通る
The road runs along the edge of a precipice.
道を通る
to pass along a road
道を歩く
to walk down a road―(上り坂に限って)―walk up a road―(市街なら)―walk the streets
この道を通ったことが無い
I never passed along this road―never went down this road.
婦人が子どもをぞろぞろ連れて道を歩いているのをよく見かける
I often see her walking the streets with her children at her heels.
路を拾って歩く
to pick one's steps through the mire
道に迷う
to lose one's way―go astray―stray
道に迷いそうだ
I am afraid I shall lose my way.
道に迷って山奥に入った
I strayed into the depths of the mountains.
道を間違える
to mistake the road―take the wrong road
道を聞く
to ask the way―inquire the way
停車場へ行く道を聞いた
I inquired the way to the station.
道を教える
to show one the way―tell one the way
誰かに道を教えてお貰い
Get some one to show you the way.
道を開く
to open a way―clear the track
道を明けろ
Clear the track!
群衆が道を開いて一行を通した
The crowd made way for the party.
後進のために道を開く
to make room for one's juniors―give place to one's juniors
彼は後進のために道を開く為に職を辞した
He resigned his post to make way for his juniors―in favour of his juniors.
(改革などの)道を開く
to pave the way for reform
(新鉱山などへ)道を付ける
to make a road―build a road―to a new mine
道をふさぐ
to bar the way―block the passage―stand in the way
馬車で道がふさがっている
The street is blocked with carriages.
道に当る
to lie in the way
郵便局は道だ
The Post Office lies in my way.
道を譲る
to give one the wall
道を譲らぬ
to take the wall of one

One should not pick up what one finds on the road.

逃げ路
a way of escape―a way out (of the difficulty)

content: 2. (=途、途中)(on) the way; (on) the road

content.content: 途で尋ねた
I inquired on the way.
ここへ来る途で尋ねた
I inquired on my way here.
途で尋ねて家がわかった
I found the house by inquiring on the way―by inquiring on my way here.

I met him on my way to school.

I looked in on my way home.

content: 3. (=路程)a way; a journey; the distance; ground

content.content: 路が遠い
The way is long―It is a long way off―The distances are long.
王子までは路が遠い
It is a long way to Oji.
路が遠いから途中で暇をつぶす
The distances are so long that I waste time on the road.

今日は路がはかどった
We have done a good journey today.
幾里の路を越す

Ten miles are soon gone over on a swift horse.

We have gone over the same ground.
半分路

道の半分は歩いた
I walked one half of the distance―I did half the distance―on foot.

content: 4. (=里)a ri; a Japanese mile

content.content: そこまでは半道だ
It is only half a ri off.

content: 5. (=歩行)walking

content.content: 君は道に強いか

僕は道に弱い
I am a poor walker―a poor pedestrian.

content: 6. (=方法、方針)a way; a path; a course; an avenue; means

content.content: 道を探る
to adopt a course―take a course
どの道をとろうか

探るべき道はほかに無い

安全な道を踏む

to follow the path of virtue―follow the path of right
道を学ぶ
to learn the path of virtue―learn the truth

道を伝える

道ならぬ事をする

to expound the doctrines of Confucianism―preach Confucianism

〈名〉Secret information; betrayal:(=する) to inform against (one); to lay information against (one); to peach against (one); to peach on (one); to split on (one); to squeal on (one); to tell on (one); to betray (one); to denounce (one to the government); to turn the state's evidence

みっともない〔見っともない〕
〈形〉Unsightly (building); shabby (dress); indecent, unbecoming, unbeseeming, unseemly (behaviour); ignominious, ignoble, disgraceful, dishonourable (death or defect); disreputable, unpresentable (appearance, etc.)

content.content: 大きな娘がお母さんに甘えるのはみっともない
It does not look well for a big girl to be teasing her mother.
青年が人を冷評するのはみつともない
It does not become a young man to sneer at people.
みっともない真似をするな
Do not behave so unbecomingly!
後家さんが急いで再婚したのはみっともない
The widow married again with indecent haste.
彼はみっともない身なりをしている
He is shabbily dressed.
みっともないふう
disreputable―appearance
このみっともないないなりをしては人前へ出られぬ
I am unpresentable―not fit to be seen.
彼はみっともない死にざまをした
He died an ignominious death―died an ignoble death.
みっともない負け方をした
He suffered an ignominious defeat.
学問を見せびらかすのはみっともない
It is bad form to parade one's learning.
夫婦が人前でいちゃつくのはみっともない
It is bad form for man and wife to kiss and hug in company.
あの女の支度はみっともない
She dresses in bad taste.
着物が派手過ぎてみっともない
Her dress is too gaudy for good taste.
質問してはみっともない
I can not with any grace be asking questions.

content.content: 舵手は羅針盤を見つめている
The helmsman keeps his eyes upon the compass.
母は手術を行う外科医の一挙一動を見つめておった

content:

〈名〉An estimate; estimation; valuation; calculation

content.content: 見積りをする、見積りを立てる
to make an estimate
大工に見積もりをさしてみよう
I will have the carpenter make an estimate.
建築費は一万円の見積もり
The cost of building is estimated at 10,000 yen.
物品の価格は五千円の見積もり
The goods are valued at 5,000 yen.
来会者はざっと千人の見積もり
The attendance is roughly calculated at 1,000.
費用はどのくらいの見積もりですか
What is the estimated expense?
入費は見積もりを越えた
The expenses exceed the estimate.
見積もりがはずれた
I have miscalculated―I am out in my reckoning.
見積書
an estimate―a written estimate
見積額
the estimated amount
見積価格
the estimated cost
ざっとした見積
a rough estimate
見積勘定
pro forma account.

content:
みつもりがき〔見積り書〕
〈名〉A written estimate

content.content: 大工に見積書きを出させてみよう
I will have the carpenter make an estimate.

content:
みつもる〔見積る〕
〈他動〉To estimate (the cost at 10,000 yen); to value (the goods at 5,000 yen); to calculate (the number at 1,000); to put (the number at so many); to rate (anything high or low)

content.content: 建築費は一万円と見積ってある
The cost of building is estimated at 10,000 yen.
物品の価格は五千円と見積ってある
The goods are valued at 5,000 yen.
来会者はざつと千人と見積ってよかろう
The attendance may be roughly calculated at 1,000―put at 1,000.
ざっと見積る
To make a rough estimate.
入費はざっと見積って五百円
The expenses are roughly estimated at 5,000 yen.
高く見積もる、安く見積もる
to estimate the cost high or low―rate anything high or low―overestimate or underestimate
高く見積っても百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million at most.
いくら安く見積っても百万はあるだろう
He must be worth a million at least―at the very least.
内端{うちわ}に見積る
to make a moderate estimate―make a conservative estimate
内端に見積っても千円はかかる
The cost is moderately estimated at 1,000 yen―It will cost 1,000 yen at a moderate estimate―at the inside.
金に見積る
To estimate the loss in money.
金に見積れば百円の損害
Estimated in money, the loss is 1,000,000 yen.

1. (=見通す景色)a vista:(形容詞に訳せば)affording an unobstructed view; open to the eye

content.content: この家は四方見通しだ

Everything lies open to God.

content:
2. (=洞察)insight; penetration
3. (=先見)foresight

1. (=通して見る)to look through (a fence, etc.)

content.content: 通りを見通す

content:
2. (=洞察する)to see into (one's heart); to penetrate into (one's motive, etc.)
3. (=先見する)to foresee (the future); to forecast (the weather, etc.)

〈他動〉
1. (=咎める)to find fault with (a person or thing)
2. (=見つける)to discover; to observe; to perceive

content.content: 彼は見咎められずに入った
He come in unperceived.
見咎められずに出た
He went out unobserved.

content: 3. (=誰何する)to challenge

content.content: 巡査に見咎められないように裏町を行った
I took the by-streets to avoid being challenged by policemen.

content:
みどころ〔見所〕
〈名〉
1. (=見物する所)sights to see; places to visit; the lions of a place; the attractions of a place

content.content: 京都は見所が多い
There are many sights to see―many lions―in Kyoto.
ここはどこか見所があるか
Are there any sights to see―any places to visit―in this town?
この町の見所はどこか
What are the lions of this town?―the attractions of this town?
ここはあまり見所は無い
There is not much to see here.

content: 2. (=見込、長所)promise; good

content.content: どこか見所のある青年だ
There is some good in the youth―There is something in the youth.
大いに見所のある青年だ
He is a promising youth―a youth of great promise.
どこかに見所があるか
Do you see any good in him?―Do you see anything in him?
どこに見所があるか
What do you see in him?
見所が無い
I see no good in him―I see nothing in him.
この本は多少見所がある
There is some good in this book―There is something in this book.

content:
みとどける〔見届ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=しかと見る)to see (one home―that anything is done)

content.content: 婦人を家まで見届けて来た
I have seen her safe home―seen her to her door.
彼が屋敷内を出るまできっと見届ける
Mind you see him off the premises!
金が先方の手に渡ることを見届けます
I will see that he gets the money.
彼の行末を見届けます
I will see him through.

content: 2. (=確かめる)to ascertain, make sure of, assure oneself of, convince oneself of, satisfy oneself of (a fact)

content.content: 真偽を見届ける
to ascertain the truth―make sure of the truth―convince oneself of the truth
彼の改心を見届けた
I am sure of―am assured of―am convinced of―am satisfied of―his penitence.
化物の正体を見届ける
to unmask a ghost―expose an apparition

content:
みとめ〔認め〕
〈名〉(=認め印)A private seal; a signet

content.content: 認めを押す
to affix one's signet to a paper
認め付きの指環
a signet-ring

content:
みとめる〔認める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=承認する)to admit (a fact); to acknowledge (one's error, mistake, fault, defeat, inferiority―another's superiority―one as an authority); to recognize (one's worth or ability); to allow (one to be a great man)

content.content: 事実を認める(仰せごもっともと言う)
to admit a fact―I admit the fact
自分の誤りを認める(俺が間違っていたと言う)
to acknowledge one's error
自分の過失を認める(俺が悪かったと言って謝まる)
to acknowledge one's fault
世間では彼を大家と認めている
people acknowledge him as an authority
世間の認める大家
an acknowledged authority
彼の博学は万人の認めるところである
His erudition is acknowledged on all hands―recognized by everybody.
僕は彼を長者とは認めない
I do not acknowledge him as my superior.
彼の偉いことは何人も認めている
It is acknowledged on all hands that he is a great man―Everybody allows him to be a great man.
今海軍拡張中止の必要は万人の認むるところである
It is admitted by everybody―acknowledged on all hands―that a naval holiday is a necessity.

content: 2. (=認識する)to recognize (one as one's master); to identify (the corpse as some one)

content.content: 僕は彼を正当な主人とは認めぬ
do not recognize him as my lawful master
一国の独立を認める
to recognize the independence of a country
日本は過激政府を認めた
Japan has recognized the Bolshevik government.
彼はその死体を我が子と認めた
He identified the body as his son.

content: 3. (=真価を認める)to appreciate, do justice to, be sensible of (one's merits)

content.content: 彼の天才は時の人の認むるところとならなかった
His genius was not appreciated by his contemporaries.
世に認められない天才
an unappreciated genius
人の長所を認める
to be sensible of others' merits―see the good in others
彼の好意を認めざるを得ぬ
I can not but appreciate his kindness.
彼は君の好意を充分に認めている
He shows due appreciation of your kindness.
彼の価値は充分に認める
I will do full justice to his merit.
世に出ない人は往々認められずにしまう
Modest worth often goes unrewarded.

content: 4. (=断定する)to conclude; to declare

content.content: 法律は嫌疑のみをもって人を有罪と認めず
The law does not conclude a man guilty on mere suspicion.
上海はペスト流行地と認められた
Shanghai has been declared to be pest-stricken.

content: 5. (=考える)to consider

content.content: 証拠充分と認む
I consider the evidence to be conclusive.
目的を達したるものと認む
I consider the object as having been attained.

content: 6. (=見る)to see:(航海中なら) to sight (land, etc.)

content.content: 僕はその必要を認めぬ

市街に人影を認めず
Not a soul was to be seen in the streets.
正左舷に当たりて島影を認む
We sighted an island on the port beam.
天空一点に雲を認めず
There is not a cloud in the sky.
身体にはなんらの故障を認めず
The body shows no sign of trouble.

〈他動〉To gaze upon (one) in rapture; to be lost in admiration; to be rapt in wonder; to be enraptured, be captivated, be fascinated, be ravished (by beauty)

content.content: 皆恍惚としてその人に見惚れておった
Everybody gazed upon her in rapture.
この景色に見惚れておった
I have been lost in admiration of the scenery―rapt in wonder at the scenery.
見惚れるような美人
a fascinating beauty―a captivating beauty―a ravishing beauty.

content:
みな〔皆〕
〈代名詞、副詞〉All; one and all; every one (everybody, everything)

content.content: 兄弟は皆揃っている
All the brothers are alive―The brothers are all alive.
彼らを皆知っている
I know them all―all of them.
これで皆ですか
(数なら)All these all?―(量なら)―Is this all?
皆で
in all―all told
皆でいくつあるのか
How many are there in all?
皆で十
Ten in all.
皆で十冊あるのだから一冊足りない
There ought to be ten volumes in all, so there is one wanting.
一行は皆で十二人
There are twelve of us, all told.
皆でいくらになるか
What is the sum total?
皆で品物を買ってしまおうじゃないか
Let us buy up the goods among us all.
そのことは皆聞いた、皆知っている
I have heard all about it―I know everything about the matter.
皆そう言っている
Everybody, says so―The story is in everybody's mouth.
この本は皆持っている
Everybody has the book―The book is in everybody's hands.
あの人達を皆知っている
I know all those men―every one of them.
皆さんによろしく
Remember me kindly to all!
行った者は皆死んだ
They were all killed―killed to a man.
皆僕に反対した
The were all against me―They were against me to a man.
皆嘘だ
It is all false―It is a lie out of the whole cloth.
彼は皆と握手した
He shook hands all around.
酒は皆になった
The wine is all gone.
これこれ皆しかり
So it is with every one of them.
皆の話によればそうらしい
According to all accounts; it seems to be so.
皆さんお乗りなさい
All aboard!
皆々そうでない
They are not all so.
烏だって皆々黒くない
Not all crows are black―Crows are not always black.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 皆いない人が悪いんだ
The absent party alone is to blame.
彼は僕の話を皆まで聞かずに中止した
He cut me short.
僕の言うことを皆聞いてくれ
Hear me out!

みなかみ〔水上〕
〈名〉
1. (=水源)the source, the head, the fountain-head (of a river)
2. (=上流)the upper courses, the upper reaches (of a river)

content:
みなぎる〔漲る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=満ち溢る)to overflow; to brim; to swell

content.content: 河がみなぎっている
The river has swollen―the river is overflowing.
湖水がみなぎっている
The lake is brimming.
黒雲天にみなぎる
Dark clouds cover the sky.

content: 2. (=満ち渡る)to pervade; to permeate; to fill

content.content: 民主主義が世界にみなぎっている
Democracy pervades the whole world.
彼は新思想がみなぎっている
He is permeated with new ideas―filled with new idea.
青年は血気がみなぎっている
Young men are filled with hot blood―full of hot blood.

みなくち〔水口〕
〈名〉The inlet of water (to a rice-field)

content:
みなげ〔身投げ〕
〈名〉Drowning oneself; suicide by drowning:(=する) to drown oneself; to throw oneself into a river; to commit suicide by drowning

content.content: 女は隅田川へ身投げした
She drowned herself in the Sumida―threw herself into the Sumida.
昨夜吾妻橋に身投げがあった
There was a suicide at Azumabashi last night.
一人の船客が身投げをした
A passenger threw himself overboard.

content:
みなごろし〔鏖〕
〈名〉Wholesale slaughter; wholesale massacre; extermination; annihilation

content.content: 皆殺しにする
to slaughter―massacre―exterminate―annihilate―cut up―cut to pieces
敵を皆殺しにする
to annihilate the enemy―slaughter the enemy―cut up the enemy
決死隊は皆殺しになった
The forlorn hope was cut to pieces.

みなさん〔皆さん〕
〈呼掛名詞〉Gentlemen!; Ladies and gentlemen!

content:
みなしご〔孤児〕
〈名〉An orphan

content.content: 孤児になる
to be left an orphan―be orphaned

content:
みなす〔見做す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=何を何と思う)to regard (one as something); to look upon (one as something); to consider (one as something); to take (one for something); to view (anything in the light of something)

content.content: 僕は彼を友人と見なしている
I regard him as a friend―look upon him as a friend.
僕は敵を恩人と見なす
I regard my enemy as a benefactor.
僕は英語を外国語とは見なさぬ
I do not regard English as a foreign language―view English in the light of a foreign language.
君は彼を正直な人間と見なしたのが失錯だ
You committed a blunder in taking him for an honest man.
彼は証拠不充分と見なして放免された
He was set at liberty, the evidence being considered inconclusive.
僕はあいつらと同一に見なされては困る
I object to being classed with such men―I object to being mentioned in the same breath with such men.

content: 2. (=仮定する)to suppose; to assume; to take (something) for granted

content.content: 君を死んだものと見なしておった
We supposed you to be dead.
君を紳士と見なしてのことさ
I am assuming you to be a gentleman.
君の言うことを本当と見なしたところでどうしてそれが答弁になるか
Granting what you say to be true, how does it answer my argument?

みなそこ〔水底〕
〈名〉The bottom of the sea; the bottom of a river

みなづき〔水無月〕
〈名〉The sixth month (of the lunar calendar)

content:
みなと〔港〕
〈名〉(海港市)a port:(海港の碇泊所)a harbour:(防波堤無き碇泊所)(open) roads:(文学にては)a haven

content.content: 船が港に着く
A ship arrives in port―reaches port―makes port―fetches the harbour.
港に入る
A ship puts into port.
港に寄る
A ship puts in at a port―touches at a port―stops at a port―calls at a port.
港に碇泊する
A ship casts anchor in the harbour.
港に碇泊している
The ship is lying in the harbour―The ship is in port.
港には幾百艘という船がいつも碇泊している
Hundreds of ships are always at anchor in the harbour.
港には船舶が輻輳{ふくそう}している
The harbour is crowded with shipping.
港を出る
A ship leaves port―puts to sea.
港を封鎖する
to blockade a port

content:
みなみ〔南〕
〈名〉The south:(=の) south; southern; southerly

content.content: インドはアジアの南に在り
India is in the south of Asia.
満洲はシベリアの南に在り
Manchuria lies on the south of Siberia.
横浜は東京の南に在る
Yokohama lies (to the) south of Tokyo.
南に当たる
to lie to the south―(海上では)―bear south
満洲は南は支那に境す
On the south, Manchuria borders on China.
南は海に面す
to face the sea on the south
南側に
on the south side of the street
南の方
southward
南の方へ行く
to go south
南の方へ行けば行くほど温かになる
The farther south you go, the warmer it becomes.
はるか南の方に島がある
There is an island far to the southward.→『みなみむき〔南向き〕』
南風
the south wind―a southerly wind
南半球
the Southern Hemisphere

content:
みなみな〔皆々〕
〈副〉(Not) all

content.content: 皆々そうでもあるまい
They can not all be so.
光る物は皆々金ではない
“All that glitters is not gold.”
烏だって皆々黒くはない
Not all crows are black―Crows are not always black.

content:
みなみむき〔南向き〕
〈名〉A southern aspect:(=の) with a southern aspect; looking toward the south

content.content: 南向きの家
a house with a southern aspect―a house looking toward the south
座敷は南向きがよい
A room should look toward the south.

content:
みなもと〔源〕
〈名〉
1. (=水源)the source, the head, the fountain-head (of a river)

content.content: 淀川はその源を琵琶湖に発す
The river Yodo flows from Lake Biwa―rises from Lake Biwa―takes its rise in Lake Biwa.
河の源を探る
to trace a river to its source
源清ければ流れ清し
If the fountain is clear, so is the stream.

content: 2. (=本源)the origin; the source; the rise; the root; the beginning

content.content: 神道の源は神代にある
The Shinto cult takes its origin in the Age of Gods.
寺子屋の源は寺にある
The private school has its origin in the Buddhist temple.
日本の習慣の多くの源を探ると仏教から起こっている
Many of our customs are to be traced to Buddhism―traceable to Buddhism―of Buddhistic origin.
その源を探ると仏教から起こっている
Its origin can be traced back to Buddhism.
大和民族の源は不明に属す
The origin of the Yamato race is veiled in obscurity.

content:
みならい〔見習い〕
〈名〉(事)probation; apprenticeship:(人)a probationer; an apprentice; a cadet; an improver

content.content: 彼は見習い中だ
He is on probation.
見習いとして勤める
to serve on probation
子どもを職人の家へ見習いにやる
to apprentice a boy to an artisan
男の子は店へ見習いに出したものだ
The boys were apprenticed to various shops.
見習いをする
to serve an apprenticeship―serve as an apprentice
彼は五年間機械師の見習いをした
He has served a five years' apprenticeship under a mechanist.
見習い士官
a cadet
見習い生
an apprentice-student―a probationer
見習い書記
an articled clerk
職人の見習い
an improver

content:
みならう〔見習う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=見学する)to learn (by observation)

content.content: 行儀を見習う
to learn good manners―catch good manners
女の子は行儀見習いに良家へ奉公する
Girls take service in good families to learn their manners.
親を見習う子
“As the old cock crows, the young one learns.”
役所の事務を見習う
to learn the business routine of an office―get the run of office-business
当分部内の事務を見習わせよう
I will train him to the business routine of the service for the present.

content: 2. (=倣う)to follow one's example; to copy one's example; to be influenced by one's example; to follow suit; to take a leaf out of one's book; to take the cue from (some one)

content.content: 皆が君を見習うから注意してくれ給え
The others follow your example―The others copy your example―Your conduct has influence on the others.
僕に見習え
Follow my example!―Take a leaf out of my book!―Take the cue from me!
僕を見習うことは無い
Let not my example influence you!
彼は誰かを見習ったに違い無い
He must have been influenced by some example.
五年生が同盟休校をやると他はこれを見習った
When the fifth year students went on strike, the rest followed suit.
上を見習う下
“Like master, like may”―“As is the master, so is the man.”

content:
みなり〔身形〕
〈名〉Dress; attire; get-up; appearance

content.content: 彼は身形が好い、身なりが悪い
He is well dressed―ill dressed.
彼は身なりにかまわない
He is careless about his dress.
身なりがやかましい
He is particular about his dress.
上品な身なりをしている
(男なら)He is elegantly dressed―(女なら)―She is elegantly got up.
賤しい身なりだ
He is meanly dressed.
人の身なりが賤しいからとて見下げるものでない
You should not think the worse of a man because he is meanly dressed.
僕は身なりが見すぼらしいものだから俥屋までがあやしんですぐ乗せてくれなかった
I was so shabbily dressed that the very rickshaman looked twice at me before taking me.
彼は掻き乱した身なりをしておった
He was in dishevelled dress―in tousled dress.
彼はあさましい身なりをして親友を訪ねまわる
He comes round to his old friends in outrageous attire.
こんな身なりじゃ人前へ出られない
I am not fit to be seen―unpresentable.
身なりをくずす
to run to seed
身なりをくずさぬ
to keep up a good appearance
身なりを直す
to improve one's appearance

content:
みなれる〔見慣れる〕
〈他動〉
1. To get used to seeing (anything); to get used to the sight of (anything); to become familiarized with (anything)

content.content: 彼の筆蹟は見慣れないと読めない
His handwriting is illegible to one―not used to it.
彼は戦争へ行って血を見慣れている
He has been in the war, and is used to the sight of bloodshed.
鬼も見慣れた鬼が好し
One will come to like what one is used to.
見慣れた顔、見慣れない顔
a familiar face―a strange face
この筆蹟は見慣れた筆蹟だ、見慣れない筆蹟だ
The handwriting is familiar to me―strange to me.
見慣れた光景だ
The sight is familiar to me―It is a familiar sight.
見慣れない光景だ
The sight is strange to me―new to me―It is a strange sight―a new sight.
あれは見慣れない人だ
He is a stranger to me.
彼は見慣れない犬にからかってかまれた
He teased a strange dog, and got bitten.
目を明けてみると自分は見慣れない処に寝ておった
I opened my eyes to find myself lying in a strange place.

みなわ〔水泡〕
〈名〉A bubble; foam

content:
みにくい〔見悪い〕
〈形〉
1. (=不明)indistinct (print); obscure (photograph); illegible (handwriting); undecipherable (inscription, etc.)

content.content: 彼は見にくい字を書く
He writes an illegible hand.
印刷が見にくい
The print is indistinct.
碑銘が磨滅して見にくい
The epitaph is worn away and not to be deciphered.

content: 2. (=見苦しい)indecent, unbecoming, unbeseeming, unseemly (conduct or behaviour); ignominious, ignoble, disgraceful, dishonourable (death or defeat); disreputable, unpresentable (appearance); shabby (dress)

content.content: みにくい振る舞い
unbecoming behaviour―unseemly behaviour
みにくい振る舞いをするな
Do not behave unbecomingly!
青年が人を冷評するのはみにくい
It is unbecoming in a young man to sneer at people―It does not become a young man to sneer at people.
寡婦が急いで再婚したのはみにくかった
The window married again with indecent haste.
彼はみにくい身なりをしている
He is shabbily dressed.
みにくからぬ身なりをしている
He is decently dressed―respectably dressed.
このみにくい形{なり}では人前へ出られぬ
I am unpresentable―not fit to be seen.
彼はみにくい死に方をした、みにくい最後を遂げた
He died an ignominious death―died an ignoble death.
みにくい負け方をした
He suffered an ignominious defeat.
学問を見せびらかすのはみにくい
It is bad form to parade one's learning.
夫婦が人前でいちゃつくのはみにくい
It is bad form for man and wife to indulge in affectionate familiarities in company.

content:
みにくい〔醜い〕
〈形〉Ugly (face); plain (features); homely (girl); ill-favoured (woman); unsightly (building, etc.)

content.content: 醜い顔
an ugly face
醜い女だ
She is a homely woman―a plain woman―an ill-favoured woman―a fright.
醜い男だ
He is an ugly man.

content:
みにつまされる〔身につまされる〕
〈自動〉To be appealed to

content.content: あの唄を聞くと身につまされる
That song appeals to my heart.

content:
みぬく〔見抜く〕
〈他動〉To see through (one's design); to see into (one's heart); to have an insight into (character); to penetrate into, pierce into (one's motive)

content.content: 心を見抜く
to see through one's heart―see into one's heart
僕は彼の腹を見抜いている
I see through him.
彼は人を見抜く
He has an insight into character―He looks people through and through.
彼の人物を見抜いた
I have seen into his character―I have taken his measure―I have his measure to an inch―know him every inch.
一見して彼の精神を見抜いた
I penetrated into his motive―pierced into his motive―at a glance.
彼の弱点を見抜いている(から扱いやすい)
I know the length of his foot―I have the measure of his foot.

content:
みぬふり〔見ぬ振り〕
〈名〉Connivance:(=する) to connive at (an offence); to wink at (a fault); to shut one's eyes to (one's faults); to pretend not to see; to look through one's fingers; to take no notice of (a person)

content.content: 彼は僕を見ぬふりをして通り過ぎた
He passed by me without taking notice of me.
些細な過失は見て見ぬふりがよい
It is best to wink at petty faults.
当局者は犯則を見ぬふりをしている
The authorities connive at the offence.
彼の欠点を見ぬふりをして使っている
I employ him shutting my eyes to his faults.
人の顔を見ぬふりして見る
to cast furtive glances on one

content:
みね〔峯〕
〈名〉
1. (=山頂)the summit (of a mountain)
2. (=高山)a peak; a high mountain
3. (=刀の背)the back (of a sword)

content.content: 峯打ちにする
to strike one with the back of one's sword

content:
みの〔蓑〕
〈名〉A straw rain-coat

content.content: 蓑着で火事場へ行く
to court danger
蓑になり笠になり人を守る
to watch over a man in every possible way

content:
みのう〔未納〕
〈名〉Default of payment:(=の) unpaid; in arrears

content.content: 未納金
arrears
未納額
the amount in arrears
未納税
unpaid taxes
未納者
a defaulter
未納処分
execution in default of payment
会費未納の諸君は至急納付ありたし
Those who have not paid in their monthly dues are requested to do so without delay.

content:
みのうえ〔身の上〕
〈名〉
1. (=境遇)(one's) welfare, condition, lot, circumstances, personal affairs

content.content: 僕は君の身の上を案じている
I am anxious for your welfare.
彼は安楽な身の上だ
He is in easy circumstances―well off.
困難な身の上だ
He is in straitened circumstances―badly off.
あの寡婦は気の毒な身の上だ
The widow is in a sad condition―in a pitiful predicament―in a sorry plight―in a bad way.
あの娘は哀れな身の上だ
Hers is a sad lot.
僕は辛い身の上だ
Mine is a bitter lot.
今の身の上では家は持てない
In my present circumstances, I can not afford keep house.
彼は身の上を相談に来た
He came to consult with me about his personal affairs.
今日は人の身の上明日は我が身の上
Mutable are human affairs!

content: 2. (=運勢)one's fortunes

content.content: 身の上を判断する
to tell fortunes―tell one's fortune―cast a horoscope―cast a nativity
身の上判断
fortune-telling
陰陽師身の上知らず
“The fortune-teller can not tell his own fortune.”

content: 3. (=経歴)(one's) life, career, history

content.content: 身の上話
the story of one's life
身の上話をする
to tell one's story―relate one's history
身の上話もまた一興
The story of your life must be interesting.
身の上を話し合う
to compare notes
彼と身の上を話し合ってみるといずれも同じようなことをしておった
On comparing notes with him, I found that we had gone over much the same ground.
僕の身の上には種々のことがあった
Various things have happened to me.

content:
みのがす〔見遁す〕
〈他動〉To overlook (a fault); to pass over (a matter in silence); to pass by (a matter unnoticed); to let (it) pass; to let (it) go

content.content: 今度だけ見のがしておこう
I will overlook your fault for this once.
これは見のがすことができない
I can not pass over the matter in silence―pass by the matter unnoticed.
これは間違いには違いないがまあ見のがしておく
It is a mistake, to be sure, but let it go―let it pass.

みのがめ〔蓑亀〕
〈名〉An old tortoise with its shell overgrown with water-plants

content:
みのけ〔身の毛〕
〈名〉One's hair

content.content: 身の毛がよだつ
One's hair stands on end.
身の毛のよだつような話だ
The story will make your hair stand on end.

content:
みのこし〔見残し〕
〈名〉Anything left unseen

content.content: まだ見残しがたくさんある
I have left many things unseen.

content:
みのこす〔見残す〕
〈他動〉To leave (anything) unseen

content.content: たくさん見残したものがある
I have left many things unseen.
一幕見残した
I left the last act unseen―did not see the last act―left the house without seeing the last act.

content:
みのしろきん〔身の代金〕
〈名〉
1. (=身受金)ransom

content.content: 彼は身の代金を出して女郎を身受けした
He ransomed the prostitute.

content: 2. (=身売金)the price of one's freedom

content.content: 娘を売った身の代金をばくちで取られてしまった
He gambled away the price of his daughter's freedom.

content:
みのたけ〔身の丈〕
〈名〉Stature; height

content.content: 君は身の丈はどのくらいあるか
How many feet do you stand?―What is your stature?
身の丈六尺
I stand six feet.
身の丈六尺に余る大男だ
He is a big fellow over six feet in height.
彼は身の丈が高い
He is tall.
身の丈が低い
He is short of stature―of short stature.
身の丈が延びる
to increase in stature―grow taller

content:
みのつまり〔身の詰まり〕
〈名〉Ruin

content.content: あんなぜいたくをすりゃ身の詰まりとなるよりほかは無い
Such extravagance can but end in ruin.
惚れられたのが身の詰まり
He was beloved to his ruin.
ちょいとなめたが身の詰まり
A single taste of pleasure was my ruin.

content:
みのふりかた〔身の振方〕
〈名〉What to do with oneself; how to dispose of oneself

content.content: 身の振り方をつける
to dispose of oneself
女は身の振り方に困っている
She does not know what to do with herself.

content:
みのほど〔身の程〕
〈名〉One's station in life; one's place

content.content: 身の程を知れ
Know your station!―Know your place!―Know yourself!
身の程を忘れるな
Do not forget your station!―Do not forget your place!
身の程を知らぬ奴だ
He should know his station―He should know his place―He should know himself.

content:
みのまわり〔身の廻り〕
〈名〉
1. (=身、身形)one's person; appearance; dress

content.content: 彼は身のまわりにかまわない
He is careless about his appearance.
身のまわりを綺麗にしておくことが好きだ
He likes to keep himself near.

content: 2. (=持ち物)personal effects

content.content: 身のまわりをすっかり取られた
I have been robbed of all my effects.

みのむし〔蓑虫〕
〈名〉The bag-worm; the basket-worm

content:
みのる〔実る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=実が生る)to bear fruit; to bring forth fruit; to fructify
2. (=実が入る)to fill

content.content: 今年は五穀の実りが好い
The cereals have filled well this year.
五穀実らず
The harvests are bad―The crops are light.
実るほど頭を垂るる稲穂かな
“The boughs that bear most hang lowest.”

content: 3. (=熟す)to ripen; to come to perfection

content.content: 秋は果物が実る
Fruits grow ripe in autumn.

content:
みば〔見場〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: みばえ〔見栄え〕

content:
みばえ〔見栄え〕
〈名〉Appearance; show; effect

content.content: この太物は価にしては見栄えがする、見栄えがしない
The cloth makes a good show for its price―does not make a show for its price.
見栄えは無いが持ちが好い
It does not make a show, but wears well.
見栄えの好い支度
a showy dress
婦人は見栄えの好い支度をしている
She is showily dressed.
二頭立ては見栄えが好い
A carriage-and-pair makes a good appearance.
色の配合が見栄えがする
The composition of colours is calculated for effect.

content:
みはからい〔見計い〕
〈名〉Discretion; judgment; choice

content.content: 買物は見はからいでするがよい
You may buy anything at your discretion―You may buy whatever you think fit―I give you carte blanche for making purchases.
万事見はからいでやっておくれ
You may use your discretion in everything―You may act at your discretion in everything―I leave everything to your discretion―I leave everything to your judgment.
料理は見はからいでよろしい
I leave the choice of dishes to you―You may order the dishes yourself.

content:
みはからう〔見計らう〕
〈自動〉To use one's discretion; to act at one's discretion; to think fit; to judge best

content.content: 買物は見はからってしてくれ
You may buy anything at your discretion―You may buy whatever you think fit―You may buy whatever you judge best―I give you carte blanche for making purchases.
万事見はからってくれ
You may use your discretion in everything―You may act at your discretion in everything―I leave everything to your discretion―I leave everything to your judgment.
お料理は見はからっておきましょうか
Will you leave the choice of the dishes to me?―Shall I order the dishes myself?
頃合を見はからう
to time anything
頃合を見はからって来給え
You must time your coming―time your arrival.

content:
みはつに〔未発に〕
〈副〉Before anything breaks out

content.content: 禍を未発に防ぐ
to nip an evil in the bud―destroy an evil in the egg
学校騒動は未発に防ぐべし
School-riots should be nipped in the bud.
陰謀を未発に防ぐ
to stifle a plot in the cradle―stifle a plot in its birth
病や災難を未発に防ぐ
to prevent a disease―prevent a calamity
病は未発に防ぐにしかず
“Prevention is better than cure.”

content:
みはなす〔見放す〕
〈他動〉To give up (a case); to give over (a patient); to throw over (a lover); to desert (one's wife); to abandon (a girl); to forsake (a friend); to turn one's back upon (an unfortunate man)

content.content: 医者が患者を見放す
A doctor gives up a case―gives over a patient.
彼は医者に見放された
He was given over by his doctor―given up by his doctor.
女が男に見放された
She was given over by her lover―thrown over by her lover―abandoned by her lover.
妻が夫に見放された
She was deserted by her husband.
彼は困っている友人を見放すような人ではない
He is not the man to turn his back upon a friend in trouble.
神に見放される
to be forsaken by God―reprobated by God
彼は神から見放されたならず者だ
He is a reprobate―past praying for.

みはば〔身幅〕
〈名〉The width of a garment

content:
みはらい〔未払い〕
〈形〉Unpaid; outstanding; overdue

content.content: 未払高
an unpaid amount―an outstanding amount―arrears―arrearage
未払勘定
an unpaid account―an outstanding account―an account payable
未払株金
unpaid share―unpaid stock
未払利子
overdue interest―interest in arrears
未払配当金
dividend unclaimed

content:
みはらし〔見晴し〕
〈名〉A view; a prospect; an outlook

content.content: あの家は見晴らしが好い
The house commands a fine view―has a fine prospect.
あの山の上の見晴らしは格別だ
The prospect from that hill is particularly fine.
僕の室は海の見晴らしが好い
My room has a fine outlook upon the sea―a fine sea-view.
その旅館は湖水の見晴らしが好い
The hotel has a fine outlook across the lake.

content:
みはらす〔見晴す〕
〈他動〉To command a view of (Mt. Fuji); to look out upon (the sea); to look out across (a lake or a river)

content.content: その家は筑波山を見晴らして眺望が好い
The house commands a fine view of Mt. Tsukuba.
海を見晴らす座敷が欲しい
I want a room that looks out upon the sea―I want a room with an outlook on the sea―I want a room with a sea-view.
湖水を見晴らす座敷は無いか
Is there a room that looks out across the lake?―Is there no room with an outlook across the lake?―Is there a room with a view of the lake?

content:
みはり〔見張り〕
〈名〉(事)watch; lookout; observation:(人)a watch; a watchman; a lookout; a picket:(=する) to keep watch (on one's movement); to keep observation (on one's movements); to watch for, be on the watch for (a thief); to look out for, be on the lookout for (pickpockets); to be on the alert for (the enemy)

content.content: 厳重に見張りせよ
Keep strict watch―Keep watch and ward―(泥棒をなら)―Keep a good watch for a thief―(スリをなら)―Keep a sharp lookout for pickpockets.
見張りを置く
to set a watch―set a lookout―set a picket
見張所
a lookout―(軍艦のマスト上のは)―a crow's nest
見張船
a lookout ship

content:
みはりばん〔見張番〕
〈名〉A watch; a watchman; a lookout; a picket

content.content: 見張番を置く
to set a watch―set a lookout―set a picket
店の見張番
a shopwalker

content:
みはる〔見張る〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=警戒する)to keep watch (on one's movements); to keep observation (on one's movements); to watch for, be on the watch for (a thief); to look out for, be on the lookout for (pickpockets); to be on the alert for (the enemy)

content.content: 厳重に見張る
to keep strict watch―keep watch and ward
スリを厳重に見張れ
Keep a good watch for pickpockets!―Keep a sharp lookout for pickpockets!

content: 2. (=目を見張る)to open one's eyes wide; to dilate one's eyes; to strain one's eyes

content.content: 驚きの目を見張る
to open one's eyes in wonder―stare in wonder
しきりに目を見張って敵を見失うまいとした
I strained my eyes to keep sight of my enemy.

content:
みふたつ〔身二つ〕
〈名〉Parturition; childbirth

content.content: 身二つになる
to give birth to a child―be delivered of a child

content:
みぶり〔身振り〕
〈名〉A gesture; gesticulation; action; motion

content.content: 身ぶりをする
to gesticulate―gesture―make gestures
南欧人は話しをするに身ぶりをして話す
The romance peoples talk with gestures―gesticulate when talking.
身ぶりをして言葉に力を添える
to emphasize one's words by action―reinforce one's words with action
身ぶりまじりに話す
to suit the action to the word
彼の演説は身ぶりが多い
His speech is full of action.
身ぶりが好い、身ぶりが悪い
He has good action―bad action.
身ぶりをして指図する
to motion to one―sign to one―sign to one to do something―motion one to do something
彼は僕に身ぶりで坐れという合図をした
He motioned me to a seat―signed to me to be seated.
身ぶりで人を招く
to motion a person towards one―beckon to a person
身ぶりで去れと言う
to motion one away
(役者のような)気どった身ぶりをする
to strike an attitude―attitudinize

content:
みぶるい〔身震い〕
〈名〉
1. Shivering:(一回なら)a shiver; trembling:(一回なら)a tremble; quaking:(一回なら)a quake; quivering:(一回なら)a quiver; thrilling:(一回なら)a thrill; shaking:(一回なら)a shake; shuddering:(一回なら)a shudder; a tremor:(=する) to shiver (with cold); to tremble (for fear); to quake (with cold―for fear); to quiver, thrill (with emotion); to shake (with weakness); to shudder (with horror)

content.content: 寒くて身ぶるいする
to shiver with cold―quake with cold
怖くて身ぶるいする
to tremble for fear―quake for fear
怖くて全身身ぶるいした
I was all of a tremble―trembling like an aspen―shaking in my shoes.
想像したばかりでも身ぶるいする
I shudder at the bare idea―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The bare idea makes me shudder.
嬉しくて全身身ぶるいした
A thrill of joy ran through me.
鳥が身ぶるいする
A bird ruffles its feathers―ruffles itself.

content:
みぶん〔身分〕
〈名〉Status; state; social standing; social station; social position; social scale; station in life; situation in life; sphere; birth; means

content.content: いずれ身分のある人だろう
He must be a person of standing.
身分の高い人
a man of high standing
身分の低い人
a man of low birth
身分の卑しい人
a man of humble birth
彼は身分が卑しい
He is in a humble station of life.
彼は身分の卑しい妻を持っている
He has a wife beneath him in birth.
彼は身分の卑しい女と結婚した
He had the imprudence to marry beneath him―contract a m?salliance.
彼は身分に相当な生活をしている
He lives in a style befitting his state.
身分に相当の尊敬を払わねばならぬ
We must do him the honour due to his position.
それが身分に相当だ
That befits your station.
身分相応の暮らしをする
to live within one's means―“cut one's coat according to one's cloth”
彼は身分に不相当のぜいたくをしている
He lives above his means.
彼のぜいたくは身分に不相当だ
His extravagance is out of all proportion to his means.
どんな身分にもそれぞれ苦労がある
Every situation in life has its trails.
君は馬車くらいは抱えられる身分だ
You are rich enough to keep a carriage.
けっこうなご身分です
Yours is an enviable position.
そんなことをなすってはご身分にかかわります
It would be beneath your station to do such a thing.
あなたと私とは身分が違う
We move in different spheres―You move in another sphere.

content:
みぶんそうおう〔身分相応〕
〈形〉Befitting one's station

content.content: それが身分相応だ
That befits your station.
彼は身分相応な暮らしをしている
(身分の高い人なら)He lives in a style befitting his state―(身分の低い人なら)―He lives within his means.
身分相応に暮らす
to conform oneself to one's fortunes―“cut one's coat according to one's cloth”
彼は身分相応な教育を受けている
He has had an education befitting his state―proper for a gentleman―worthy of a gentleman.
おのおの身分相応に金を出した
Each gave according to his means―gave in proportion to his wealth―gave his mite.

content:
みぶんふそうおう〔身分不相応〕
〈形〉Not befitting one's station; out of proportion to one's means; above one's means

content.content: 彼のぜいたくは身分不相応だ
His extravagance is out of all proportion to his means.
身分不相応なぜいたくをしている
He lives above his means.
こんな立派な家は身分不相応だ
The house is above my station.

みぼうじん〔未亡人〕
〈名〉A widow; a relict

みほれる〔見惚れる〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: みとれる〔見惚れる〕

content:
みほん〔見本〕
〈名〉(商品の見本)a sample

content.content: 商品見本
sample of goods
品物は見本通り
The goods are up to sample―The goods come up to the sample―The goods correspond with the sample.
品物は見本と違う
The goods do not correspond with the sample.
品物は見本より落ちる
The goods are below the sample―not up to sample.
見本売買
sale by sample
見本張
a sample book―sample sheets
見本室
a sample-room

content:
みまい〔見舞〕
〈名〉
1. A visit; a call; an inquiry

content.content: 病気見舞い
an inquiry after one's health―a visit of inquiry
病気見舞いをする
to inquire after one's health
病気見舞いに行った
I went to inquire after his health―on a visit of inquiry―on a mission of inquiry.
病気見舞いの手紙を出した
I wrote to inquire after his health.
火事見舞い
an inquiry on the occasion of a fire
火事見舞いに行った
I called to inquire after him in the late fire.
近火御見舞を謝す
We beg to thank those who kindly inquired after us in the late fire.
暑中見舞
a call of inquiry in the hot season―a season call
暑中御見舞(贈物に書けば)
With the compliments of the season.
留守見舞いをする
to call on one's family during one's absence
震災見舞いの電報を打った
I wired a message of inquiry about the seismic disaster.
お見舞いに預かり奉万謝候
Many thanks for your kind inquiry!
見舞状
a letter of inquiry―a letter of sympathy
見舞金
a consolatory present of money (to a sufferer)―a solatium
見舞品
a consolatory present (to a sufferer)
御見舞の印までに呈上仕候
I beg you will accept a present in token of my sympathy.
見舞客
a visitor―a caller―an inquirer
拳骨のお見舞いをする
to deal one a blow with one's fist
拳骨のお見舞いを受ける
to receive a blow

content:
みまう〔見舞う〕
〈他動〉To visit

content.content: 病人を見舞う
to visit the sick―inquire after one's health
日本は毎年台風に見舞われる
Japan is visited by typhoons every year.

みまかる〔身罷る〕
〈自動〉To die; to pass away

content:
みまさりする〔見勝りする〕
〈自動〉(=人を主格にすれば)to look to better advantage:(物を主格にすれば)to set off (a person) to advantage

content.content: 離れて見ると見勝りする顔だ
She looks to better advantage at a distance.
色の白い人は黒い着物を着ると見勝りする
A dark colour sets off a white complexion to advantage.
これはあれと比べると見勝りする
This compares favourably with that.

content:
みまま〔身儘〕
〈形〉Free to do what one likes

content.content: 身ままになりたい
I wish to be free to do what I like―I should like to have my own way.
身まま気ままになるならばお前といっしょに暮らしたい
If I had my way, I Would live with you as man and wife.

content:
みまもる〔身守る〕
〈他動〉To watch (intently); to gaze at (anything)

content.content: 女が男の顔を見守った
She gazed in his face.

content:
みまわす〔見廻す〕
〈自他動〉To look around (one)［注意］“To look round”(=to turn round)は「振り返る」「振り向く」。 “to look about one”は「回りに目を配ばる」「うかうかせぬ」。

content.content: 何事かと思ってあたりを見回した
I looked around me to see what was the matter.
一座を見回したが知った顔が無い
I looked around the company, but saw no face I knew.
彼はキョロキョロあたりを見回した
He stared around him.

みまわり〔見廻り〕
〈名〉A tour of inspection

content:
みまわる〔見廻る〕
〈他動〉To make one's rounds; to go one's rounds; to go round (a place); to make a tour of inspection; to inspect; to patrol

content.content: 監督が工事を見回る
The superintendent inspects the works.
巡査が持ち場を見回る
A policeman patrols his beat―goes his rounds.
視学官が学校を見回る
A school inspector makes a tour of inspection―goes round the schools.
お留守中は時々お宅を見回ります
I shall come round to your place from time to time during your absence.
いつも寝る前に家の中を見回ります
Before I go to bed, I walk round to see that all is right.

content:
みまん〔未満〕
〈前置詞相当〉Under; below; less than:(副詞に訳せば)and downwards

content.content: 五歳未満の小児は無賃
Children under five years of age―Children of five and downwards―are not charged.
十円未満の金額
a sum under ten yen―less than ten yen―not exceeding ten yen
丁年未満だ
He is under age―a minor.
平均点未満
below the average marks

content:
みみ〔耳〕
〈名〉
1. The ear

content.content: 耳ある者は聞け
“He who hath ears to hear, let him hear.”
そんなことは聞く耳持たぬ
I have no ear to hear such things―I will not listen to such things.
壁に耳あり
“Wall have ears.”
右の耳から入って左の耳から出てしまう
“Come in at one ear, go out at the other.”
大名は大耳
He who would rule over men, must see and be blind, hear and be deaf.
盲人は耳で音楽を奏する(楽譜を用いぬ)
A blind man plays by the ear.
英語を耳で学ぶ(耳学問)
to learn English by the ear

content: 《a》(耳が)

content.content: 耳が聞こえる
I can hear.
彼は耳が聞こえない
He can not hear―He is deaf.
君は音楽の耳があるか
Have you an ear for music?
音楽の耳が無い
I have no ear (for music).
君が耳が肥えている
You have a good ear for music.
彼は耳が発達している
He has a nice ear for music.
耳が早い
to be quick-eared―quick of hearing
子どもは耳が早い
Children are quick of hearing―“Little pitchers have long ears.”
老人は耳が遠い
The old man is hard of hearing―dull of hearing.
耳が鳴る
My ears ring―I have a ringing in my ears―My ears sing―I have a singing in my ears.
そう言われると耳が痛い
Your remark tingles in my ears―It is a home truth.
耳がかゆい
My ears itch.
風が寒くて耳が千切れそうだ
The wind is cold enough to freeze my ears off.
この犬は耳が垂れている
The dog is lop-eared.

content: 《b》(耳に)

content.content: 耳に入る
to reach one's ears―come to one's ears―come to one's knowledge
この事は親父の耳に入れたくない
The affair must not come to my father's ears.
人の耳に入れる
to tell one something―inform one of something―bring anything to one's knowledge
お耳に入れておきたいことがあります
I wish to bring something to your knowledge.
これはいちおうお耳に入れておきます
You ought to be duly informed of that.
このことは彼の耳に入れておく必要がある
He must know it.
彼は人が何を言っても耳にも入れぬ
He gives no heed to advice or warning.
彼は人の歎願を耳にも入れぬ
He turns a deaf ear to entreaties―He is deaf to entreaty.
人がそう言うのを耳にする
I hear people say so.
彼の声が耳に残っている、耳に付いている
His voice rings in my ears.
耳にたこができるほど言う
to din in one's ears―keep dinning in one's ears
そんなことは耳にたこの寄るほど聞いた
I have head enough of it.
あの人の声は耳にさわる
His voice jars upon the ear―grates on the ear.
耳にペンをはさむ
to stick a pen behind one's ear
彼は何か耳にはさんだのだろう
He must have happened to hear something.
馬の耳に念仏だ
It is praying to deaf ears―preaching to dear ears.
あの男は何を言っても馬の耳に念仏だ
Advice slides off him as water off a duck's back.
忠言耳に逆う
Good words sound harsh to the ear―Truth is disagreeable.

content: 《c》(耳の)

content.content: 耳の穴
the cavity of the ear
耳の穴を掘って聴け
Listen with attention!
耳の痛いことだ
It is a home truth.
耳の痛い悪口だ
It is a home hit.
耳の痛いことを言う
to tell one a home truth―touch one on the raw―touch one on a sore place
耳の痛いことを言ってやる
I will be round with him.
耳の痛いことを聞かしてやった
I sent him away with a flea in his ear.
それは耳のご馳走だ
That is a treat to the ear.
耳の垂れた犬
a lop-eared dog

content: 《d》(耳を)

content.content: 耳を掻く
to pick one's ears
耳を傾ける、耳を傾けて聴く
to listen to one
氏は僕の言うことに耳を傾けて下さった
He was pleased to listen to me―I had the good fortune to have his ear―gain his ear―win his ear.
耳を貸す
to give ear to―lend an ear to―anything
そんなつまらぬ話に耳を貸すものじゃない
You should not give ear to such idle tales.
人の歎願には耳を貸すものだ
You should lend an ear to entreaties.
彼は人の歎願に耳を貸さぬ
He turns a deaf ear to entreaties―He is deaf to entreaty.
ちょっとお耳を拝借
A word in your ear!―A word with you in private!
耳を澄ます
to strain one's ears―listen
耳を澄まして彼の足音のするのを待った
I listened for his footsteps.
馬が耳を立てる
A horse pricks up his ears.
馬が耳を立てている
The horse has his ears erect.
金の話しをすると人が耳を立てる、耳を欹{そばだて}る
When there is talk of money, people prick up their ears.
耳をふさぐ
to stop one's ears―place one's hands over one's ears
耳を劈{つんざ}くような悲鳴が聞こえた
I heard a piercing shriek.
英語に耳を慣らす
to practise hearing English
耳を掩うて鈴を盗む
“The cat shuts her eyes while she steals the cream.”

content: 2. (=物の端)the edge (of a book); the selvedge, list, loop (of cloth)

content.content: 本の耳を折る
to dog's-ear a volume―double over a leaf
耳を折った本
a dog's-eared volume
十円から耳が出る
It is over ten yen.
耳を揃えて金を払う
to pay in full
耳を揃えて百両だせ
Pay down one hundred ryo!―One hundred ryo in a lump!

content:
みみあたらしい〔耳新しい〕
〈形〉New (to one)

content.content: それは耳新しい話だ
That is new to me―news to me.

みみうち〔耳打ち〕
〈名〉Whispering in one's ear:(=する) to whisper in one's ear

content:
みみうるさい〔耳うるさい〕
〈形〉Buzzing about one's ears

content.content: 耳うるさく言う
to din in one's ears―keep dinning in one's ears

みみおおい〔耳覆い〕
〈名〉(=帽子の耳覆い)Ear-tabs

content:
みもち〔身持〕
〈名〉
1. (=品行)conduct; life; morals

content.content: 彼は身持が好い
