content.content: この子は身寄り頼りも無い哀れな身です
The child is a poor orphan, without kith or kin.

content:
みらい〔未来〕
〈名〉
1. The future; time to come:(=の) future; coming; prospective

content.content: 未来に
in the future
未来にいかなる運が我らを待つかわからぬ
We do not know what fortune awaits us in the future―We know not what the future has in store for us.
あの人は未来があるか
Has he a future before him?
彼は科学者として大いに未来がある
He has a great future―a bright future―as a scientist.
米国人は皆未来の大統領をもって任じている
Every American thinks himself a future president―a prospective president.
未来の出来事を先見する
He foresees future events―coming events.
未来の世の人
coming generations
未来の利益を図る
He has an eye to future gain―prospective gain.
彼は彼女を未来の妻と決めた
He fixed upon her as his future wife―his prospective wife.
あれが君の未来の妻か
Is she your intended?―your fianc?e?
あれが君の未来の夫か
Is he your intended?―your fianc??
未来永劫
for ever and a day―for ever and over―for aye―eternally―to all eternity―world without end―time without end
二人は未来永劫変るまじと誓った
They vowed eternal love.

content: 2. (=来世)the future life; the future existence; the future state; the life to come

content.content: 君は未来を信ずるか
Do you believe in the life to come?
未来の幸福を円る
to consult one's spiritual welfare

content: 3. (=動詞の未来)the future tense

content.content: 未来完了
the future perfect tense

content:
ミリミリ
〈擬音詞〉Creaking

content.content: ミリミリ言う
to creak
家がミリミリ鳴り出した
The house began to creak.

content:
みりょく〔魅力〕
〈名〉Charm; fascination; captivation; glamour; witchery

content.content: 魅力ある笑い顔
a fascinating smile―a captivating smile―a bewitching smile
彼女は目で男を引きつける魅力がある
She has fascinating eyes.
女が魅力をもって男の魂を奪う
A girl casts a glamour over a boy.
女の魅力のために男が魂を奪われる
A man is captivated by a woman.
彼は聴衆を酔わしむる魅力がある
He has the power of fascinating his audience.

みりん〔味醂〕
〈名〉A sweet kind of sake

みる〔海松〕
〈名〉A kind of codium

content:
みる〔見る〕
〈自動〉(=目で見る)to look; to see

content.content: あれ見ろ
Look there!
これ見ろ
Look here!
見ても見えぬ
I look, but do not see.
誰か見ていないか
Isn't anybody looking?
誰も見ていない
Nobody is looking―The coast is clear.
見ておれ(今にわかる)
You shall see.
今に見ろ(ひどい目に逢わしてやる)
You shall smart for it.
それ見たことか
Didn't I say so!

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=目で見る)to look at (the moon); to see (the flowers); to view (the cherry-blossoms); to behold (anything in wonder); to watch (the boys at play); to observe (the barometer fall); to witness (a scene); to perceive (no difference); to set eyes upon (one for the first time)

content.content: 何を見ているか
What are you looking at?
月を見ている
I am looking at the moon.
花を見たか
Have you seen the blossoms?
その家を一つ見て来よう
I will go and have a look at the house.
その光景を眼前に見ているようだ
(I fancy) I see the scene before my eyes.
人が何かするのを見る
to see a man do something
君のするところを見るといかにもやさしそうだ
To see you do it, one would think it easy.
僕はあの先生の授業を見た
I have seen him teach.
何か為されるのを見る
to see anything done
紙を製すのを見たいものだ
I should like to see paper made.
鯨を捕るところを見たことがあるか
Did you ever see a whale caught?
インド人を初めて見た
He is the first Indian I ever set eyes upon.
あのような人を見たことが無い
I never set eyes upon his like―I never clapped eyes upon the like of him.
人の顔を見る
to look in one's face―look one in the face
僕の顔を見ろ
Look me in the face!
演説をする時は聴衆の顔を見るものだ
When you speak in public, you should look your audience in the face.
鏡を見る
to look in the glass
自分の姿を鏡で見る
to look at oneself in the glass
眼鏡をかけて見る
to look through spectacles
君は色眼鏡で見る
You look through coloured spectacles―You are prejudiced.
眼鏡越しにみる
to look over one's spectacles
垣根越しに見る
to look over the fence
望遠鏡で見る
to look through a telescope
顕微鏡で見る
to look through a microscope
世間を見る
to see the world
彼はなかなか世間を見ている
He has seen much of life.
見なけりゃ信じられぬ
I must see for myself.
見るほど確かなことは無い
“Seeing is believing.”
あの人は人の長所を見る
He sees the good in others.
子どもがお母さんを見て悦んだ
The child rejoiced to see mamma―at the sight of mamma.
群衆は軍隊を見て散ってしまった
The crowd dispersed at the sight of the troops.
その光景を見て面白かった
I enjoyed seeing the sight―I enjoyed the sight.
芝居を見た
I have seen the play.
芝居を見て面白かった
I enjoyed the play.
我が船は大島を西に見て南を指して走る
We are running south with Oshima seen to the west.
法律から見れば人は皆同等だ
All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
あの人の目から見れば我々は赤児だ
We are babies in his eyes.
誰か来たようだから行って見ろ
There is some one at the door. Go and see who it is.
何事だか見て来い
Go and see what is the matter.
この景色はいつ見ても好い
I never tire of looking at this view.
見れば見るほど美しい
The more I look at it, the more beautiful it looks.
その光景は見るも恐ろしい
The scene is fearful to behold.
その光景はふた目と見られぬ
The sight is too dreadful to be seen twice.
あの人は見るもいやだ
I can not bear the sight of that man.
その惨状は見るに忍びなかった
I could not bear to see the pitiful sight.
見たばかりでいやになる
The mere sight will disgust you.
彼は僕の見ている前で細君を打った
He beat his wife in my sight―in my presence.
彼は主人の見ている前ではよく働く
He is an eye-servant.
日本人の見たる米国
America as seen by a Japanese.
吉原より見たる富士
Mt. Fuji as seen from Yosiwara.
逢いたい見たい顔見たい
I am dying to see her.
その芝居が見たかった
I should like to have seen the play.
彼はその芝居が見たかったろう
He would have liked to have seen the play.
僕は芝居へ行ってしまいまで見ておられぬ
I can not sit out a play.
彼は何でも見たがる
He is curious to see everything.
怖いもの見たし
Fear is curious―“Forbidden fruit is sweet.”
見られぬというほど見たくなる
Secrecy excites curiosity.
見ると聞くとは大きな違い
The reality falls short of the fame.
聞いて極楽見て地獄
It is a Paradise to hear of, a Hell to see.
上を見れば限り無し
Greatness is comparative.
人を見て法を説け
“Be all things to all men.”
見ぬ物清し
What is not seen, is supposed to be clean.
心ここにあらざれば見れども見えず
When the mind is absent, the eye is blind.
十目の見る処(十指の指す処)
Everybody points to him as the culprit―Everything points to his guilt.
人の善悪はその交わる友を見て知れ
“A man is known by the company he keeps.”
彼の正直なことは顔を見ればわかる
You can see by his face that he is honest.
見るは放楽
The mere sight is a pleasure.
暫く見ないでいるうちにたいそう大きくなったね
How you have grown during my short absence!
見ない化物を怖がる
He is afraid of his own shadow.
見ずに買う
to “by a pig in the poke”
彼は息子の出世を見て死んだ
He lived to see his son a great man.
木戸大久保に今日の日本が見せたかった
I wish they could have lived to see Japan as she is.
この子を見ると死んだ太郎を思い出す
The boy makes me think of my Taro―reminds me of my Taro.
煙を見れば火という念が浮かぶ
When I see smoke the idea of fire occurs to my mind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke suggests the idea of fire to my mind.
その人をよく見た
I had a good look at him.
手紙をざっと見た
I ran my eyes over the letter―glanced over the letter.
ひと目見る
to have a look at anything―catch a glimpse of anything
今一目見て死にたい
O for another glimpse of her before I die!
宵にちらりと見たばかり
I only caught a glimpse of her in the evening.
人の顔をじろじろ見るのは失礼だ
It is bad manners to stare at people.
こそこそ人の顔を見る
to cast furtive glances on one
穴の明くほど人の顔を見る
to scrutinize one's face
頭から足の先まで人を見る
to look one up and down
人の答案などをこっそり見る
to steal a look at a neighbour's paper
人をじっと見る
to look hard at one
彼は女などは振り向いても見ない
He will not look at a woman.
彼はどう見ても紳士だ
He is a gentleman, every inch of him.
彼はどう見ても死んでいる
He is, to all appearance, dead.
こういうとちょいと見るとおかしいようだが
It may sound strange at first sight―at first blush―but...
彼の話はちょっとみても嘘らしい
His story is false on the face of it.
あの人はちょっと見たところでは丈夫そうだ
He looks strong at first sight.
彼は見たところでは若そうだ
To look at him, one would think him young―He looks young.
見たところでは学生ふうの人だ
He looks like a student.
彼は役者見たようだ
He looks like an actor.
彼女は見たところでは三十とは見えぬ
She does not look thirty.
見たまま
an eye-witness's account
見たままを話そう
I will tell you what I saw.
見る影も無い
He is the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was.
見る影も無くやつれている
He is the shadow of his former self.

content: 3. (=察する)to observe

content.content: 天下の雲行を見る
to observe the course of events―watch the signs of the times
天気模様を見る
to mark the signs of the weather
機を見る
to seize the opportunity―seize the moment
その場の気合を見る
to grasp the situation―see the whole story
旗色を見る、日和を見る
to sit on the fence―ride on tow horses―see which way the cat jumps―see which way the wind blows
足もとを見る
to take advantage of one's need
人を甘く見る
to presume on one's good nature
是をもって之を見れば我が国は前途有望なりと言うべし
In view of this fact,―In this view,―Japan may be said to have a bright future before her.

content: 4. (=経験する)to experience

content.content: 辛い目を見た
I had a bitter experience―I had a hard time of it.
だまされて行って馬鹿を見た
I went on a fool's errand.
この刀は血を見たことがあるか
Has this blade tasted blood?
血を見なけりゃ治まらぬ
The matter can not be settled without bloodshed.
夢を見る
to dream
妙な夢を見た
I had a curious dream.
夢にでも見たのだろう
You must have dreamed it.
ざまあ見ろ
Serve you right!

content: 5. (=見物する)to see the sights of (Kyoto); to visit (a place); to do (a place)

content.content: 日光を見た
I have seen the sights of Nikko―done Nikko.
日光を見るのに一日かかった
It took me a whole day to see over Nikko.
ここは見る物がありますか
Are there any sights to see here?
見る物はたんとありません
There is not much to see.
当所で見るべきものは公園です
The park is one of the sights of the place.
君はあそこの博物館を見たか
Have you visited the museum there?
花を見に行った
I went to see the blossoms.
今日は花を見に行って来た
I have been to see the blossoms today.

content: 6. (=読む)to read

content.content: 電灯で本を見ておった
I was reading by the electric-light.
毎朝新聞を見る
I read the newspapers every morning.
手紙を見たら焼き捨てろ
Commit the letter to the flames after reading it.

content: 7. (=何々して見る、試みる)to try; to see (if):(試みた結果は) to find

content.content: やってみよう
I will try.
一つやってみよう
I will have a try at it―have a go at it.
僕にできるかどうかやってみよう
I will see if I can.
君やってみ給え
Suppose you try!
やってみたいような気がする
I feel like trying―I feel inclined to make a trial―I have a mind to try.
この菓子を食ってみ給え
Try this cake!
この酒を飲んでみ給え
Try this wine!
この上衣を着てみ給え
Try on this coat!
馬に乗ってみ給え
Try this horse!
馬には乗ってみよ人には添ってみよ
“The proof of the pudding is in the eating.”
当ててみろ
Guess!
雑誌を書いてみようと思う
I am going to try my hand at a magazine.
英語を数えてみようかと思う
I think of trying my hand at teaching English.
彼に英語を数えさしてみ給え
Try him at teaching English.
僕を使ってみて下さい
Try me!―Give me a trial!―Give me a fair trial!―Give me a fair chance!
君はいつ来てみても勉強している
I always find you at your books.
目を明けてみると見慣れぬ処に寝ておった
I opened my eyes to find myself lying in a strange place.
目を覚ましてみると誰か枕元に泣いていた
I awoke to find somebody crying by my bedside.
行ってみるとその人は死んでおった
I found him dead.
この本を読んでみたがなかなか面白い
I find the book quite interesting.
やってみるとわけの無いことだ
I find it quite easy.
付合ってみると面白い人だ
I find him good company.
英語を数えてみるとほねが折れる
I find it hard work to teach English.
財布を改めてみると空
I found the purse empty.
探してみたが無い
I have looked for it, but in vain.
君の考えを言ってみ給え
Tell me what you think.
借金を払ってみると一文無し
When I had paid my debts, I found myself penniless―The payment of my debts left me penniless.
来てみればさほどにもなし富士の山
I find it below my expectations.
味を見る
to taste anything
人気を見る
to fly a kite
その人に会ってみたいものだ
I am curious to see the man.
打てるなら打ってみろ
I defy you to strike me―I dare you to strike me.

content: 8. (=判断する、鑑定する)to judge (swords); to read (character)

content.content: 人を見る
to read character
彼は人を見ることが上手だ
He is a good reader of character.
刀剣を見る
to judge swords
彼は絵を 見ることが上手だ
He is a good judge of paintings―a connoisseur of paintings.
僕はこの太刀を正宗と見た
I judge this sword to be a Masamune.
玉屋が金剛石を本物と見た
The jeweller has judged the diamond to be genuine―pronounced the diamond to be genuine.
子を見ること親に如かず
The father is the best judge of the child.
人相を見る
to read character by physiognomy―tell fortunes by physiognomy
運勢を見る、身の上を見る
to tell one's fortune―tell fortunes
芸を見る人は少ない
Few people appreciate art.
彼は美を見る目がある
He has an eye for the picturesque.
評判で見ると彼は偉い人らしい
Judging from reports, he seems to be a great man.
彼の書き物で見ると学者らしい
Judging from his writings, he seems to be a scholar.

content: 9. (=何を何と思う)to regard (one as something); to look upon (one as something); to view (anything in the light of something); to set down (one as something); to take (one for something); to see (something in some) one

content.content: 彼を善人と見た
I regard him as a good man―look upon him as a good man.
ばか者と見た
I regard him as a fool―set him down as a fool.
僕を四十と見たのか、大違いだ
Do you take me for forty? You are wide of the mark.
西洋人さえ見れば偉い者だと思っている
They see a great man in every foreigner.
僕は今度のことを不幸とは見ない
I do not regard the matter as a misfortune―I do not view the matter in the light of a misfortune.
僕の見るところは違う
I do not view the matter in that light.
僕の見るところではかえって幸だ
In my opinion, it is rather a piece of good fortune.
それは見る人次第だ
It is a matter of opinion.
人々の見る処が違う
Men have different views.
大体から見れば事は成功している
Taken altogether, the thing is a success.
教育上から見ればこの学科は価値が無い
The subject has no value from the educational point of view―from the educational standpoint―The subject is of no educational value.

content: 10. (=改めて見る、調べる)to look over (accounts); to examine (the goods); to consult (a dictionary); to refer to (the calendar)

content.content: 試験の答案を見る
to look over examination papers
どうぞ作文を見て下さい
Will you please look over my composition?
品物を一々手に取って見たわけではない
I did not look over the good one by one.
時計を見る
to consult one's watch―refer to one's watch―look at one's watch
字書を見る
to consult the dictionary―refer to the dictionary
暦を見る
to consult the calendar―refer to the calendar
帳面を見る
to refer to one's notes
医者が病人を見る
A doctor examines a patient.
脈を見る
to feel the purse
医者に見て貰い給え
You ought to consult the doctor―see the doctor.

content: 11. (=目を通す、 世話をする)to attend to (business); to look to (a matter); to see to (anything); to see about (anything); to look after (a child)

content.content: (人に用を頼まれて)見ておきます
I will see to it―see about it.
不在中子どもを見て下さい
Please look after the child while I am out.
主婦が万事を自分で見る
The mistress looks to everything―sees to everything―herself.
今晩ここへ泊るから夜具を見ておいてくれ
I shall stay here for the night, so please see to the bedding.
万事不都合の無いように見ておきます
I will look to it that all is well―see to it that all is well―see that all is well.

content: 12. (=見込む)to allow for (breakage, etc.)

content.content: 破損を見る
to allow for breakage
破損を見ても十は残る
Allowing for breakage, there will be ten left.
五分の減りを見ておいたらよかろう
We shall allow five percent for the loss.
(卵を百抱かせたから)間違いを見ても八十羽は孵る
Allowing for accidents, we shall have eighty chickens.

content: 13. (=見積る、評価する)to estimate (the cost at so much); to calculate (the number at so much); to value (the goods at so much); to put (the number at so many)

content.content: 生徒の数をざっと五千と見てよかろう
The number of students may be roughly put at 5,000.
建築費は一万円と見てある
The cost of building is estimated at 10,000 yen.
品物の価は二千円と見てある
The goods are valued at 2,000 yen.
実価はその半分と見てよかろう
Its true value may be put at half the sum.
好く見ても二流の役者だ
He is, at best, but a second-rate actor.
多く見ても百万はあるまい
He can not be worth a million, at most.

content: 14. (=供給する)to provide (one with anything); to find (one in clothes)

content.content: 着物を見て下さるならそれでやっていかれます
If you provide me with my clothes, I can get along on that sum.
給料は三十円で着物は見てやる
I will pay you thirty yen wages, and find you in clothes.

content: 15. (=司る)to manage; to administer

content.content: 政務を見る
to administer the affairs of state

みるかい〔水松貝〕
〈名〉The otter-shell

content:
みるかげもない〔見る影も無い〕
〈名〉Ruined; wrecked

content.content: 彼は見る影も無く衰えている
He is the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was.
見る影も無くやつれている
He is the shadow of his former self.

content:
ミルク
〈名〉Milk; cow's milk; condensed milk

content.content: 子どもをミルクで育てる
to bring up a baby on the bottle―bring up a child by the hand

content:
みるみる〔見る見る〕
〈名〉Fast; soon

content.content: ご馳走は見る見る無くなる
The good cheer was fast disappearing.
船は見る見る沈む
The ship was fast setting.
家は見る見る一面の火となった
The house was soon in a blaze.

content:
みるめ〔見る目〕
〈名〉A looker-on; an observer

content.content: 病人よりも見る目
The looker-on suffers more than the invalid.
見る目がうるさい
The observers are annoying―People will pry.
余所の見る目も哀れだ
A stranger can not look on without being moved with pity.

content:
みれん〔未練〕
〈名〉
1. (=心残り)regret; a lingering desire

content.content: 君はあの地位にまだ未練があるのか
Do you feel any regret for the position?
もう未練は無い
I feel no regret for it.
彼はあの女にまだ未練があるのだ
He has a lingering love for her.
君はあの女にまだ未練があるのか
Do you still love her?
もう未練は無い
I have done with her.
たとい今死んでもこの世に未練は無い
Even if I were to die tomorrow, I should leave the world without regret.
君はまだ投機に未練が残っているだろうね
You have a lingering desire for speculation, I suppose?
もう投機には未練が無い
I have done with speculation.
彼は昔に未練がある
He regrets the past―He looks back to the past―He has a lingering fondness for the past.
過ぎ去ったことに未練を残すものでない
You should not look back to the past.
昔に未練を残す
to regret the past―look back to the past―sigh for the past―“sign for the flesh-pots of Egypt”
彼は未練を残して昔を思い出している
He thinks of the past with regret―with a sigh.
未練を残して思い切った
I gave up the idea with a sigh.
思う存分遊ぶと未練が残らぬ
Let a man have his fling, and he will not look back.
(帰らぬことに)未練を言うな
Do not indulge in vain regrets!―Do not cry over spilt milk!―“It is not use crying over spilt milk.”
本に未練が残って離れられぬ
I can not tear myself away from my books.
古い習慣に未練が残って止められぬ
I can not break myself of my old habit.

content: 2. (=卑怯未練)cowardice; poltroonery

content.content: 未練者
a coward―a poltroon―a craven―a dastard―a recreant
未練な奴
You coward!―You poltroon!―You dastard!
未練な振る舞い
cowardly behaviour―poltroonery
卑怯未練な振る舞いをするな
Don't be a coward!―Do not act the coward!―Do not show the white feather!

content:
みわけ〔見分け〕
〈名〉
1. (=区別)distinction; discrimination:(=る) to distinguish (between the two―the one from the other); to discriminate (between good and evil―good from evil); to know (the one from the other); can tell (the one from the other)

content.content: 兄弟があまりよく似ていて見分けがつかぬ
The brothers are so much alike that you can not distinguish between them―distinguish the one from the other―know the one from the other―tell the one from the other.
お前はもう善悪の見分けのつく年だ
You are of an age to discriminate between good and evil―discriminate good from evil.
英国人と米国人とはどこで見分けるか
How do you distinguish between an Englishman and an American?―distinguish an Englishman from an American?―know an Englishman from an American?―How can you tell an Englishman from an American?
言葉遣いで見分ける
We know them by the way they speak English―We can tell them by the way they speak English.
雄と雌とはどこで見分けるか
How do you know the male from the female?―How can you tell the male from the female?
大きさで見分ける
We know them by their size―We can tell them by their size.
暗くて人の顔を見分けることができなかった
I could not distinguish―could not tell―people's faces in dark.
赤ん坊はもう人の顔を見分ける
The baby knows people already.

content: 2. (=明らかに見えること、微かに見えること)discernment:(=る)to discern,(a form); to make out (a figure)

content.content: 暗闇に男女の姿を見分けた
I made out the forms of a man and a woman in the dark.
霧の中にかすかに島を見分けた
We barely discerned an island in the fog.

content: 3. (=認識)recognition:(=る) to recognize

content.content: 君は見分けのつかないほど変わった
You have changed beyond recognition―I should know you if I met you in the streets.

content:
みわすれる〔見忘れる〕
〈他動〉To forget; to fail; to recognize

content.content: 久しく逢わなかったから見忘れておった
I had not met him so long that I did not recognize him.
彼は見忘れるほど変わっておった
He had changed beyond recognition.
貴様は俺を見忘れたか
Have you forgotten me?

content:
みわたす〔見渡す〕
〈自他動〉To survey (a scene); to sweep (the horizon); to look out over (the sea or the mountains); to look out across (a lake or a river); to gaze off

content.content: 四方の山辺を見渡せば
As I look out over the hills on very side,...
海を見渡す景色はいつ見ても好い
I never tire of looking out over the sea.
山を見渡すのも好い
I like to look out over the mountains.
湖水を見渡すと向こう側に山が見える
If you look out across the lake, you sea a mountain at the farther end.
沖を見渡すといつでも船が一つ二つ見える
If you sweep the horizon, you always see a ship or two.
世を見渡せば刻下の急務がたくさんある
If you look out over the world, we see many pressing needs of the hour.
向こう遙か見渡せば雲外にそびえる新高山
As I gaze off far into the distance, I see Mt. Niitaka rise above the clouds.
見渡す限り一面の火であった
It was a sea of fire as far as the eye could reach―as far the eye could sweep.
見渡す限り我が天下(孤島の独居)
I am “monarch of all I survey”

content:
みんい〔民意〕
〈名〉The will of the people; the people's will; the popular will

content.content: 民意を尊重する
to respect the people's will
民意を代表する
to represent the popular will

content:
みんえい〔民営〕
〈名〉(A) private enterprise

content.content: 鉄道は民営にすべきものでない
Rail way business should not be left to private enterprise.
電灯は民営になっている
Electric lighting is a private enterprise.

みんか〔民家〕
〈名〉A private house

content:
みんかん〔民間〕
〈副〉Among the people:(=の) popular; private

content.content: 彼は民間に勢力がある
He has influence over the people.
我民間に人と為り
I was born and bred among the people.
民間の事業
a popular enterprise―a private enterprise―private business
民間の風説
a flying rumour―town talk
民間飛行家
a private airman―a civilian aviator

content:
みんぎょう〔民業〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: みんえい〔民営〕

content:
みんけん〔民権〕
〈名〉The people's rights; popular rights; the liberties of the people

content.content: 民権を主張する
to assert popular rights
民権主張
assertion of popular rights
民権を擁護する
to defend the liberties of the people
民権を拡張する
to extend popular right
民権拡張
extension of popular rights
民権主義
democracy
民権家
a democrat

content:
みんこく〔民国〕
〈名〉A republic

content.content: 中華民国
the Chinese republic

content:
みんじ〔民事〕
〈名〉A civil case

content.content: これは民事上の問題だ
This is a civil case.
民事訴訟
a civil suit―a civil action
民事訴訟法
the code of civil procedure
民事裁判
a civil trial
民事原告人
a plaintiff
民事被告人
a defendant

content:
みんしゅ〔民主〕
〈名〉Democracy

content.content: 民主主義
democracy
民主主義者
a democrat
民主国
a democracy
民主政体
democratic government―democracy
民主化する
to democratize
世界は民主化しつつあり
The world is being democratized.

content:
みんしゅう〔民衆〕
〈名〉The people; the populace; the masses; the crowd; the multitude

content.content: 一般民衆
the masses of the people
民衆政治
popular government
国体を民衆化する
to popularize the national constitution

content:
みんじょう〔民情〕
〈名〉The conditions of the people

content.content: 彼は民情に通じている
He is familiar with the conditions of the people.
民情を視察する
to observe the conditions of the people

content:
みんしん〔民心〕
〈名〉Popular feelings; public sentiment; popular favour; popularity

content.content: 民心を得る、民心を収攬{しゅうらん}する
to win popular favour―win popularity
民心を得んとする
to bid for popular favour
民心を失う
to lose popular favour―lose popularity
処置が民心に投合した
The measure fell in with the popular sentiment.

content:
みんせい〔民政〕
〈名〉
1. (=軍政に対し)civil administration

content.content: 民政を布く
to place a territory under civil administration―establish a civil government
占領地に民政を布いた
The occupied territory was placed under civil administration.
民政局
the Bureau of Civil Administration
民政長官
a civil governor

content: 2. (=民主政体)democratic government; democracy

content.content: 民政党
the democratic party―(米国のは)―the Democrats
民政党員
a Democrat

みんせいきょく〔民政局〕
〈名〉The Bureau of Civil Administration

content:
みんせいちょうさ〔民勢調査〕
〈名〉Census-taking

content.content: 民勢調査を行う
to take the census

content:
みんせん〔民選〕
〈名〉Popular election:(=の) elected by the people

content.content: 議員は民選だ
The representatives are elected by the people.

みんぞく〔民俗〕
〈名〉The manners and customs of a people

content:
みんぞく〔民族〕
〈名〉A race; a people; a nation

content.content: 大和民族
the Japanese people
アジアの諸民族
the peoples of Asia
サクソン民族
the Saxon race
民族性
racial characteristics―national character
民族精神
national spirit―ethos
民族自決
self-determination of nations

content:
みんだん〔民団〕
〈名〉A corporation

content.content: 居留民団
a settlement corporation

みんちょう〔明朝〕
〈固名〉
1. The Ming dynasty
2. A style of Chinese characters

みんど〔民度〕
〈名〉The wealth and culture of the people

みんとう〔民党〕
〈名〉The people's party

content:
みんな〔皆〕
〈代名詞〉→『

content.content: みな〔皆〕

content:
みんぷく〔民福〕
〈名〉The welfare of the people

content.content: 民福を図る
to consult the welfare of the people
国利民福を図るは政治家の本分
It is the duty of the politician to look to the interests of the country and the welfare of the people.

みんぺい〔民兵〕
〈名〉Militia:(一人なら)a militia-man

content:
みんぽう〔民法〕
〈名〉The civil law; the civil code

content.content: 民法学者
a civilian

みんぽんしゅぎ〔民本主義〕
〈名〉Democracy

content:
みんゆう〔民有〕
〈形〉Privately-owned

content.content: 民有鉄道
a privately-owned railway
民有地
private land

みんよう〔民謡〕
〈名〉A folk-song; a ballad

content:
みんりょく〔民力〕
〈名〉National resources

content.content: 民力を養う
to enrich national resources
民力を節する
to husband national resources
民力を休養する
to recuperate national resources

content:
む〔無〕
〈名〉Nothing; nought; naught

content.content: 無より出でて無に帰る
to rise from nothing and return to nothing
無より有は生せず
Nothing can come of nothing.
せっかくの骨折りが無になった
All my efforts have come to naught.
君が干渉したためにせっかくの骨折りが無になった
Your interference has brought all my efforts to naught.
彼には親切を尽しても無になる
Kindness is thrown away upon him.
ご親切を無にするのは残念ですが
I am sorry I can not avail myself of your kindness.
人の好意を無にするものでない
You should not set aside people's kindness.

content: 〈接頭詞〉Un-; in-; dis-; non-; -less; free from (blemish); free of (charge)

content.content: 無根
unfounded―groundless
無比
incomparable―unparallelled―matchless
無私
disinterested
無干渉
non-interference
無キズ
free from blemish［注意］「特に免ずる」の意味「無」は“free of”と訳す。
傍聴無料
Admitted free of charge.
無試験(入学)
to be admitted free of examination
無賃配達
to be delivered free of charge
無家賃で住む
to live in a house free of rent―rent-free
無月謝で通学する
to attend school free of tuition-fee―tuition-free

content:
むい〔無位〕
〈形〉Without rank

content.content: 無位無官者
a plain individual

content:
むい〔無為〕
〈名〉Doing nothing; inactivity

content.content: 無為に日を暮らす
to idle one's time away
彼は無為に終わった
He died without leaving his mark on anything.
無為にして化す
to rule the people by letting them alone
無為主義
a laissez-faire policy―(は政治、宗教は)―quietism
無為王
a king fain?ant

content:
むいか〔六日〕
〈名〉Six days:(何月六日)the 6th (of January, etc.)

content.content: 六日の菖蒲十日の菊
It is too late―a day after the fair.

content:
むいし〔無意志〕
〈形〉Non-volitional; involuntary; spontaneous; unintentional

content.content: 無意志の競争
unintentional competition

content:
むいしき〔無意識〕
〈形〉Unconscious; automatic; mechanical:(=に) unconsciously; automatically, mechanically

content.content: その日は一日無意識に職務に従事した
I mechanically attended to my duties all day.
無意識行動
an unconscious action

content:
むいちぶつ〔無一物〕
〈名〉Having nothing

content.content: 嚢中無一物
I have not a penny to bless myself with―not a shot in the locker.

content:
むいみ〔無意味〕
〈形〉Meaningless, senseless (proceedings); absurd (ceremony); wanton (waste of life); unwarranted, gratuitous (slaughter, etc.)

content.content: 本人が出席しなくては無意味の会になる
The absence of the principal party will make the meeting meaningless.
肝心の花嫁がいなくては儀式が無意味になる
The absence of the all-important bride will make the ceremony absurd.
無意味な殺生をするな
Do not indulge in wanton waste of life―unwarranted slaughter―gratuitous slaughter.
負けると知りつつ戦うのは無意味の殺生だ
To fight with a certainty of defeat is wanton waste of life.
無意味な生活をする
to live to no purpose
これが成功すれば僕の生活は無意味でなくなる
If I succeed in this, I shall have lived to some purpose.

content:
むいん〔無韻〕
〈形〉Unrhymed; rhymeless

content.content: 無韻詩
blank verse

むうき〔無雨季〕
〈名〉The dry season

むうたい〔無雨帯〕
〈名〉A rain-less zone

content:
むえき〔無益〕
〈形〉Vain (efforts); useless (labour); unavailing (endeavours); fruitless (attempt); futile (endeavours); barren (discussion, etc.)

content.content: 試みても無益だ
There is no use in trying―It is useless to try―It is of no use to try―(Idiom は)―It is no use trying―It is no good trying.
そんなことは学んでも無益じゃないか
What is the use of―Where is the good of―learning such things?
こんなことを学んでおけば将来無益になるまい
Such things, if learned, may prove of service―stand me in stand―some day.
もう医者を呼んでも無益だ
It will be useless―It will do no good―go send for the doctor now.
君が干渉するのは有害無益だ
Your interference will do more harm than good.
金を遊ばしておくのは無益だ
It is unadvisable to have your money lying idle.

むえききあつけい〔無液気圧計〕
〈名〉An aneroid barometer

content:
むえん〔無縁〕
〈形〉Without relations

content.content: 無縁の墓
a neglected grave―a pauper's grave
無縁の墓地
a potter's field

むえんかやく〔無煙火薬〕
〈名〉Smokeless powder

むえんたん〔無煙炭〕
〈名〉Smokeless coal; stone-coal; anthracite

content:
むか〔無価〕
〈形〉Above price; priceless

content.content: 真性の愛は無価なり
Genuine love is above price.

content:
むが〔無我〕
〈名〉
1. (=我れを忘れること)annihilation of self; ecstasy

content.content: 無我の境に入る
to be in ecstasies

content: 2. (=私心無きこと)disinterestedness

むかい〔向い〕
〈形〉Opposite

content.content: 向いの家
the house opposite―the house over the way―the house across the street

content: 〈副〉Over the way; across the street

content.content: その人の家は真向いです
He lives right over the way―right across the street―right opposite our house.

content: 〈前置詞相当〉Opposite (the house)

content.content: 学校の真向かいに本屋がある
There is a bookstore right opposite the school―(古文体では)―over against the school.

content:
むがい〔無害〕
〈形〉Harmless (pleasure); innocent (amusement); innoxious (food or drink); innocuous (snake); inoffensive (person, etc.)

content.content: 少量の酒は有益無害だ
A little wine does more good than harm.

content:
むかいあい〔向い合い〕
〈副〉Opposite each other; face to face; vis-?-vis

content.content: 向かい合いに坐る
to sit opposite each other―sit facing each other―sit vis-?-vis to each other
彼と向かい合いに坐った
I sat opposite him.

content:
むかいあう〔向い合う〕
〈自動〉To be opposite each other; to face each other; to be vis-?-vis to each other

content.content: 汽車の中で西洋人と向かい合った
I sat opposite a foreigner in the train.
向かい合って
face to face―vis-?-vis
我々二人は向かい合って坐った
We sat opposite each other―sat facing each other―sat vis-?-vis to each other.
停車場とホテルと向かい合っている
The station and the hotel stand opposite each other―The hotel stands opposite the station.

content:
むかいあわせ〔向い合せ〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: むかいあい〔向い合い〕

むがいかしゃ〔無蓋貨車〕
〈名〉A truck

content:
むかいかぜ〔向い風〕
〈名〉A head wind; a foul wind; a contrary wind; an adverse wind

content.content: 風は向かい風だ
The wind is against us―We are going in the wind's eye―in the teeth of the wind.

content:
むかう〔向う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=面する)to face (the street); to front on (the street); to confront(one); to look toward (the south); to look out on (the sea); to look out into (a yard, etc.)

content.content: その旅館は港の方に向かっている
The hotel faces the harbour―fronts on the harbour.
座敷は皆南の方に向かっている
The rooms all look toward the south.
その家は海の方に向かっている
The house looks out on the sea.
座敷は河の方に向かっている
The room looks out on the river.
僕の書斎は庭の方に向かっている
My study looks out into the garden.
通りの方へ向かっている窓と中庭に向かっている窓がある
Some windows look out on the street, the others look out into the yard.
日に向かう
to face the sun―have the sun in one's eyes
刀を抜いて賊に向かった
I confronted―stood face to face with―the burglar with a drawn sword.

content: 2. (=向かって進む)to head for, steer for (a point) ; to leave for, depart for, sail for(America) ; to advance toward, march toward (the capital) ; sail against, run against, make head against (the wind) ; to set one's face toward (the south, etc.)

content.content: 敵艦隊は東水道に向かうものの如し
The enemy fleet seems to be heading for―steering for―the East Channel.
軍は都に向かう
The army advanced toward―marched toward―the capital.
明日米国に向かう
I depart for―sail for―America tomorrow.
横浜を抜錨して上海に向かう
We leave Yokohama for Shanghai.
風が強くて船が向かえぬ
The ship can not make head against the wind.
汽船は風に向かって走る
A steamer can run against―sail against―the wind.
これより南に向かう
I now turn toward the south―set my face toward the south.

content: 3. (=敵対する)to oppose (the enemy); to go against, march against, advance against(the enemy) ; to make head against (the enemy) ; to rise against, raise one's hand against(another) ; to turn upon (one)

content.content: 本軍は敵に向かう
We go against the enemy―march against the enemy―advance against the enemy.
烏合の衆は正規軍には向かぬ
A rabble can not make head against a regular army.
貴様は俺に向かう気か
Dare you raise your hand against me?
彼は怒って僕に向かって来た
He turned upon me in anger.
先方が暴で来るならこちらは堪忍でもってこれに向かおう
Let us oppose forbearance to violence.
勇をもって富に向かう
We will oppose our valour to their wealth.
彼は短刀を抜いて向かって来た
He draw a dagger, and cut at me.
木刀をもって向かって来た
He struck at me with a cudgel.
鹿は追い詰められると人に向かう
A stag comes to bay.
この動物は人に向かうか
Does this animal come to bay?
日本軍の向かうところ敵無し
The Japanese carry everything before them.
皇軍の向かうところ敵無し
The Imperial army is invincible.

content: 4. (=赴く)to leave for, proceed to (a place); to make for (a place); to go toward, come toward (a place); to progress towards (some state)

content.content: 彼はこちらの方へ向かって来る
He is coming toward us―coming this way.
任地に向かう
to leave for one's new post―proceed to one's new post
火事と聞いて皆入口の方へ向かった
On hearing the cry of “Fire!” everybody made for the door.
商売もだんだん隆盛に向かいます
The business progressing towards prosperity―making towards prosperity―growing in prosperity―becoming prosperous.
病気は快方に向かう
One's illness progresses toward recovery―takes a favourable turn―takes a turn for the better.
病人は次第に快方に向かいます
The invalid is convalescent―on the mending hand―on the mend―getting better.
夏場に向かうと海岸へ人が集まる
People flock to the seaside toward summer.
時勢の向かうところを察する
to observe the trend of events―watch the tendency of the times

content: 5. (=顔や身体を向ける)to turn to, turn toward (anything)

content.content: 彼は僕に向かってこう言った
He turned to me, and said...
膳に向かう
to sit down to table―sit down to dinner
鏡に向かう
to stand before a looking-glass
向かう笑顔に矢立たず
A smile will disarm anger.

content: 6. (=当る)to be equal to, be equivalent to (something)

content.content: 屁一つは薬千服に向かう
A single discharge of wind is equivalent to a thousand doses of medicine.

content:
むかえ〔迎え〕
〈名〉Going to meet

content.content: 伯(叔)父が上京したので停車場へ迎えに言って来た
My uncle has come to town, and I have been to the station to meet him.
医者を迎えにやれ
Send for the doctor!
医者を迎えに自動車をやりました
I have sent a motor-car for the doctor.
三時までに迎えに来る
I shall come for you―call for you―by three.
馬車をお迎えに出します
I will send a carriage for you.
停車場まで自動車をお迎えに出します
I will send a motor-car to meet you at the station.
僕を迎えに停車場に自動車が来ているはずだ
A motor-car is to meet me at the station.
主人が自身に迎えに出て来た
The master of the house came out in person to meet me.

むかえうつ〔迎え撃つ〕
〈他動〉To go forth to meet (the enemy)

content:
むかえざけ〔迎え酒〕
〈名〉A hair of the dog that bit you

content.content: 迎え酒を飲む
to take a hair of the dog that bit you―cool one's coppers
二日酔いに迎え酒
Like cures like.

content:
むかえび〔迎え火〕
〈名〉A fire (burnt in front of the door at the Feast of Lanterns) to welcome the spirits of the dead; a welcome fire

content.content: 迎え火を焚く
to burn the welcome fire

content:
むかえる〔迎える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=出迎える)to go (come) out to meet (a visitor)

content.content: 主人が玄関まで出て客人を迎えた
The master of the house came out to the door to meet the visitor.

content: 2. (=接待する)to receive (a visitor)

content.content: 客を迎える
to receive a visitor
駕を迎える
to receive an exalted personage
貴賓を迎える
to give reception to an illustrious guest
座敷を用意して人を迎える
to prepare a room for one's reception
この室は貴賓を迎えるために準備した室だ
This room has been prepared for the reception of an illustrious visitor.
一行は熱誠をもって迎えられた
The party was cordially received―The party met with a cordial reception.
攻撃軍は烈しい砲火をもって迎えられた
The attacking force met with a warm reception.

content: 3. (=歓迎する)to welcome, hail, greet (a visitant)

content.content: 両手を拡げて人を迎える
to welcome one with open arms
人を盛んに迎える
to give one a rousing welcome
万歳をもって迎える
to hail one with cheers
新計画は全校に熱心に迎えられた
The new project was enthusiastically welcomed―enthusiastically received―by the whole school.
このたびの改革は一般の満足をもって迎えらるるならん
The new reform will be hailed with general satisfaction.
凱旋軍人を迎える
to welcome the returning heroes
彼女はにっこり笑って彼を迎えた
She greeted him with a smile―smiled him a welcome.
犬は尾を振って人を迎える
A dog wags you a welcome.
新年を迎える
to greet the New Year
旧年を送り新年を迎える
to speed the Parting Year and welcome the Coming Year―ring out the Old Year and ring in the New Year
この仕事を終わってから昭和三年を迎えたいと思っている
I expect to be done with my work before entering upon the Second Year of Showa.
十五の春を迎えて初陣をした
On attaining his fifteenth year, he entered upon his first campaign.

content: 4. (=招聘する)to engage, call in (a professional man)

content.content: 専門家を迎える
to engage an expert
医者を迎える
to call in a doctor
妻を迎える
to marry a wife
後妻を迎える
to marry a second wife
人の意を迎える
to insinuate oneself into another's favour―ingratiate oneself with another―scratch one where one itches
むかえうつ〔迎え撃つ〕

content:
むがく〔無学〕
〈名〉Ignorance; illiteracy:(=な) ignorant; illiterate; unlettered

content.content: 彼は非常に無学だ
He shows crass ignorance.
無学文盲の徒
a lot of ignoramuses

content:
むかし〔昔〕
〈名〉Ancient times; old times; bygone days; days of yore; the past; antiquity:(=は)in ancient times; in old times; in former times; formerly; in days gone by; (in days) of old; (in days) of yore:(=の) ancient; old; former; past; time-honoured

content.content: 昔々お爺さんとお婆さんとあったとさ
Once upon a time, there lived an old man and an old dame.
昔この洞に大蛇が棲んだと言う
A dragon is said to have lived in this den of old―of yore.
昔は偉い人があった
There were great men in days of old―in days of yore.
(老人に言わせると)昔は好かった
Give me the good old times!
昔は好かったと老人が言う
Old men talk of the good old times.
昔からこうだ
It has been so time out of mind―from time immemorial.
これは昔からの習慣だ
It is an old custom―a time-honoured custom.
昔も今も同じことだ
It is the same now as of old.
今は昔のようでない
Things are not now what they used to be.
師弟の関係は今は昔と違う
The relation between teacher and student is not now what it used to be.
昔は昔今は今
“Let bygones be bygones”―“Let the dead bury their dead.”
昔は異人が跋扈したものだ
The time was when the foreigner lorded it over the Japanese.
昔は全盛を極めたこともある
The time was when she was a reigning beauty.
彼女の全盛は昔のことだ
Her reign is a thing of the past.
この石垣を見ると昔が偲ばれる
These stone-walls remind us of the past.
彼は昔のおもかげも無い
He is but the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was―the shadow of his old self.
昔の彼
his former self―what he was
昔の彼ではない
He is not what he used to be.
彼は(今は落ちぶれてるが)昔は何某と言われた身だ
He has seen better days.
昔取った杵柄だからお手のものだ
He is an old band at it, and has it at his fingers' ends.
江戸っ子は気が早いと昔からきまっている
The quick temper of the Edokko is nothing new.
十年ひと昔
Ten years ago is an old time.

content:
むかしかたぎ〔昔気質〕
〈名〉The old-time spirit:(=の)(a gentleman)of the old school

content.content: 親父は昔気質で頑固だ
My father is a rigid disciplinarian of the old school.

むかしなじみ〔昔馴染〕
〈名〉(友人なら)an old friend; an old crony:(情人なら)an old flame

content:
むかしばなし〔昔話〕
〈名〉A tale of old times; a talk about old times

content.content: 昔話をする
to talk about old times―talk over old times

content:
むかしふう〔昔風〕
〈形〉Old-fashioned; antiquated; out of date

content.content: 家は昔ふうの家だ
It is an old-fashioned house.
あの人は昔ふうだ
He has antiquated manners.

content:
むかしむかし〔昔々〕
〈副〉Once upon a time

content.content: 昔々お爺さんとお婆さんがあったとさ
Once upon a time, there lived an old man an old dame.
昔々大昔
long, long ago

content:
むかつく〔逆く〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: むかむかする

content:
むかって〔向って〕
〈前置詞相当〉
1. (=指して)for; toward; in the direction of

content.content: 船は西に向かって航した
The ships sailed toward the west―in a western direction.
敵艦隊は東水道に向かって進行するものの如し
The enemy fleet seems to be steering for―heading for―the Eastern Channel.
西に向かって手を合わせた
Turning toward the west,he folded his hands in prayer.

content: 2. (=逆って)against

content.content: 汽船は風に向かって走る
A steamer can run against the wind―in the wind's eye―in the teeth of the wind.
我らは肌切る北風に向かって行軍した
We marched in the teeth of a cutting north wind.
流れに向かって泳ぐ
to swim against the stream
君に向かって弓を引く
to draw the bow―draw the sword―bear arms―against one's lord

content: 3. (=対して)to

content.content: 人に向かって黙礼する
to make a bow to one
俺に向かって何を言うか
This to my face!
面と向かって人を賞める
to praise a man to his face
面と向かって悪口を言う
to abuse one to one's face

content: 4. (=相対して)opposite

content.content: 壁に向かって坐す
to sit opposite a wall―facing a wall
彼は一日机に向かって坐っている
He sits at his desk all day.
婦人は鏡に向かって化粧をしている
The lady is making her toilet before the looking-glass.

content:
むかっぱら〔むかっ腹〕
〈名〉Sudden anger

content.content: むかっ腹を立てる
to fly into a passion―lose one's temper―fire up―flame up―flare up
彼は些細なことでむかっ腹を立てる
He will fire up at trifles.

content:
むかばら〔むか腹〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: むかっぱら〔むかっ腹〕

content:
むかむかする
〈自動〉
1. (=吐き気を催す)to feel nausea; to feel queasy; to feel sick; to turn sick; to heave the gorge

content.content: 見るとむかむかする
I feel nausea―feel sick―heave the gorge―at the sight―My gorge rises―My stomach turns―at the sight―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight makes me sick―turns me sick―turns my stomach―raises my gorge.

content: 2. (=にわかに腹が立つ)one's heart swells (with anger or indignation)

content.content: 彼の言うことを聞くとむかむかして黙っていられなかった
My heart swelled with anger at his remark, and I could not contain myself.

content:
むがむちゅう〔無我夢中〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: むちゅう〔夢中〕
我が家へ帰るまでは無我夢中だった
I knew nothing till I got home.

content:
むかんかく〔無感覚〕
〈形〉Insensible (to pleasure or pain); insensitive (to shame); insusceptible (to influence); callous (to ridicule); dead (to shame); numb, benumbed (with cold); thick-skinned; stolid; apathetic; indifferent

content.content: 彼は無感覚で恥を知らぬ
He is insensible to shame―dead to shame―callous to ridicule.
無感覚で苦楽を感ぜぬ
He is insensible to pleasure or pain―indifferent to pleasure or pain.
寒くて手足が無感覚だ
My hands and feet are benumbed with cold.

content:
むかんけい〔無関係〕
〈名詞を動詞に訳す〉(人や物に無関係)to have no relation to, have no connection with, have nothing to do with, have no concern with (a person or thing):(事に無関係)to bear no reference to, have no bearing on, have nothing to do with (a matter):(事件に無関係)not to be concerned in, to have no hand in, have no art or part in (an affair):(事が人に無関係)not to concern (one); not to matter to (one)

content.content: これとそれとは無関係だ
This has no relation to that―This has no connection with that―This has nothing to do with that.
彼は学校には無関係だ
He has no connection with the school―He is not connected with the school.
僕はこの事件には無関係だ
I am not concerned in the affair―I have no hand in the affair―I have no art or part in the affair―I have no part nor lot in the affair.
僕はあの人とはいっさい無関係だ
I have nothing to do with him―I have no concern with him.
その事は僕には無関係だ
The matter does not concern me.
その評判は本当であろうと嘘であろうと僕には無関係だ
The report, be it true or false, does not concern me―does not matter to me.
どちらが勝とうと僕には無関係だ
It does not matter to me which side may win.
君の言われることは本件には無関係だ
Your remark bears no reference to the matter in hand―Your remark has no bearing on the matter in hand.
僕は政治には無関係だ
I do not concern myself with politics―I keep clear of politics.

content:
むかんさつ〔無鑑札〕
〈形〉Without a licence; unlicensed

content.content: 彼は無鑑札で銃猟をして罰金を取られた
He was fined for shooting without a licence.

content:
むかんしょう〔無干渉〕
〈名〉Non-interference; non-intervention; laissez-faire

content.content: 無干渉主義
a laissez-faire policy―a let-alone policy

content:
むかんしん〔無関心〕
〈名〉Indifference; unconcern:(=の) indifferent (to anything); unconcerned (about anything)

content.content: 僕は政治には無関心だ
I am indifferent to politics―I take to interest in politics.
彼は専門以外のことには全く無関心だ
He is quite unconcerned about whatever lies outside his specialty.

content:
むき〔向き〕
〈名〉
1. (=力向、方面)direction; quarter

content.content: 風の向き
the direction of the wind―the direction in which the wind blows―the quarter from which the wind blows
風の向きが変わる
The wind shifts―The wind veers.
しかるべき向きに運動してみよう
I will make interest in the proper quarter―put the proper machinery in motion.
相場は上向き
The market is looking up―on the rise―on the advance.
下向き
It is looking down―on the fall―on the decline.
真向きの面
a full face
横向きの顔
a profile
向きを変える
to change front

content: 2. (=家の向き)aspect; exposure

content.content: 家は南向きだ
The house has a southern aspect―a southern exposure―The house faces south―looks toward the south.
この室は北向きだから冬は寒い
This room is cold in winter, for it looks toward the north.
この室は西向きだから夕日が射す
This room looks toward the west, and is exposed to the evening sun.
この家は向きが悪い
The house has an unlucky aspect.

content: 3. (=商品の向き)market

content.content: この品は向きが好い
The article is marketable―salable.
この品は向きが悪い
These goods are unmarketable―unsalable.
この品は東京では向きが悪い
These goods find no market in Tokyo.

content: 〈形〉(=適当)suited (for something)

content.content: これは支那向きの品だ
These goods are suited for the Chinese market.
この家は役人向きだ
This house is suited for an official.
あの人は教師向きだ
He is made for a teacher―cut out for a teacher.
彼は学校向きではない
He won't do for a school.
これは学生向きの新聞だ
This is a paper for students―This is a paper appealing to the student.
この柄は婦人向きだ
This pattern will suit ladies.
人はそれぞれ向きがある
Each man has his forte.
品には向きがある
Each article has its uses―There is an article for each kind of customers.

content:
むき〔本気〕
〈形〉Earnest

content.content: むきになる

むきになって怒る
to fire up―flame up―flare up

content.content: 無期延期
indefinite postponement
無期延期になる
to be postponed indefinitely―postponed for an indefinite period―postponed without day―postponed sine die

penal servitude for life―life imprisonment

He is serving a life term.

content:
むきげん〔無期限〕
〈形〉Indefinite :(副詞に訳せば)indefinitely; for an indefinite period; without day; sine die

content.content: 無期限延期
indefinite postponement
無期限延期になる
to be postponed indefinitely―postponed for an indefinite period―postponed without day―postponed sine die

content:
むきず〔無疵〕
〈形〉Flawless; faultless; sound; free form blemish

content.content: この品は無キズです
The article is free from blemish―There is no flaw in the article―(米国では)―There are no flies on it.
芸者には無キズの女は無い
Every geisha has a history.

He sold me an unsound article at a sound price.
品物は無キズで到着した
The goods have arrived in good condition―in perfect condition.

content:
むきだし〔剥き出し〕
〈形〉
1. (=露骨)Plain, naked, unvarnished (truth)

content.content: むき出しに言う
to speak plainly―speak in plain terms―speak in plain English―call a spade a spade
あれはむき出しにものを言う人だ
He is given to plain speaking―plain-spoken―outspoken.
むき出しに言えば詐欺だ
In plain English,―To be plain with you,―not to put too fine an edge upon it,―it is fraud.
歯に衣を着せずにむき出しに言おう
I will not mince matters.
彼はむき出しの奥州弁だ
He speak a broad Oshu dialect.

content: 2. (=包まずに)bare; uncovered

content.content: 金をむき出しで出すのは失礼だ
It is indelicate to give money uncovered.

content:
むきだす〔剥き出す〕
〈他動〉To bare (one's legs) ; to show (one's teeth)

content.content: 犬が歯をむき出していがんだ
The dog showed his teeth and snarled.
歯をむき出してにやりと笑う
to grin
目をむき出す
to goggle one's eyes

content:

〈副〉To one's face

content.content: 向き付けにそんなことを言うとはひどい
It is hard of him to say such thing to your face.

content:

content.content: 無期徒刑服役中

content:

content.content: むきになって怒る
to fire up―flame up―flare up

He will take seriously what you say in joke.

むぎばたけ〔麦畑〕
〈名〉A barley-field; a wheat-field:(英国にては)a corn-field

むきぶつ〔無機物〕
〈名〉Inorganic matter

content.content: 人にはそれぞれ向き向きがある
Each man is useful in his way―Each man has his forte.
品には向き向きがある
Each article has its special use―There is an article for each kind of customers.

content:
むきめい〔無記名〕
〈形〉Unregistered; uninscribed; unsigned

content.content: 無記名公債
unregistered loan bonds―uninscribed loan bonds
無記名株券
unregistered shares―bearer shares
無記名債権
bearer bonds
無記名有価証券
bearer securities
記名投票、無記名投票
open ballot―secret ballot

content:
むぎめし〔麦飯〕
〈名〉(Boiled) rice and barley

content.content: 麦飯で鯉を釣る
A little bait catches a big fish.

content:
むきゅう〔無窮〕
〈名〉Eternity; infinity; infinitude:(=の) eternal (reign); infinite (space):(=に) eternally; for ever

content.content: 天壌無窮{てんじょうむきゅう}

その名は天地と共に無窮ならん
His name shall live as long as heaven and earth shall endure.

content:
むきゅう〔無給〕
〈形〉Unpaid (assistant) ; honorary (secretary) :(=で) without pay; gratuitously; for nothing; for fame

content.content: 彼は無給で教えている
He teaches for nothing―He teaches for fame―He is a free teacher.
休暇中は無給
They are not paid during the vacation.
無給助手
an unpaid assistant

content:
むきゅうかん〔無休刊〕
〈名〉Publication without intermission

content.content: 年中無休刊
(The paper is) published every day of the year.

content:
むきょういく〔無教育〕
〈形〉Uneducated (person) ; untutored (savages)

content.content: 彼は無教育な成り上がりだ
He is a self-made man.

content:
むきりょく〔無気力〕
〈形〉Spiritless; nerveless; emasculated

content.content: あの男は無気力だ
He has no spirit―no backbone.

content:
むぎわら〔麦稈〕
〈名〉(Wheat) straw

content.content: 麦稈帽子
a straw hat
麦稈真田
straw-plait
麦稈細工
(fancy) straw-work

content:
むきん〔無菌〕
〈形〉Without bacilli; sterilized

content.content: 無菌牛乳
a sterilized milk―Pasteurized milk

content:
むく〔向く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=振り向く)to turn; to look

content.content: 彼はこちらを向いている
He is looking this way.
僕があちらを向いているうちに彼は手紙を隠してしまった
He hid the letter while I was looking the other way.
振り向く
to look back―look round―look over one's shoulder
どちらを向いても知らぬ顔ばかり
Whichever way I may turn,―Turn which way I may,―I see strange faces.
右向け右
Right turn!
足の向いた方へ行く
I go wherever fancy leads me.

content: 2. (=面する)to face (the sea) ; to front on (the harbour) ; to give on (the street) ; to look toward (the south, etc.)

content.content: 家は河の方へ向いている
The house faces the river―fronts on the river―gives on the river.
座敷は南の方へ向いている
The room looks toward the south.
僕の室は庭の方に向いている
My room faces the garden―looks out into the garden.

content: 3. (=適する)to suit (a person); to be suited for (China); to be fit for (some work); to be made for (a teacher) ; to do for (a school, etc.)

content.content: 君は近眼だから船乗りには向かぬ
As you are near-sighted, you won't do for a sailor.
彼は教師に向いている
He will do for a teacher―He is made for a teacher―He is cut out for a teacher.
いくら学問があっても教師に向かぬ人がある
The best scholar may not do for a teacher―make a good teacher.
日本は牧羊に向かぬ、牧羊は日本に向かぬ
Japan is not suited for sheep-farming―Sheep-farming is not suited to Japan.
この本は教科書には向かぬ
The book won't do for a text-book―It is not fit for a text-book.
この柄は若いご婦人に向きます
This pattern will suit a young lady―become a young lady.
この品は支那に向く
These goods are suited for China.
この舟は荒海には向かぬ
The boat is not fit for a rough sea.
気が向く
to be in the humour―in the mood―in the vein―for doing something
彼は気が向くとよく働く
He will work hard when he is in the humour.
子どもは気が向くとよく覚える
A child will learn well when it is in the vein.
今日は気が向かないから働くのはいやだ
I am in no mood for working today.
運が向く
Luck turns in one's favour.
運が向かぬ
Luck goes against me―I am out of luck.
やっと運が向いて来た
Luck has turned in my favour at last.
今日は強勢に運が向いた来た
I am in luck―I have come to luck―today.

content:
むく〔剥く〕
〈他動〉To peel off (the skin)

content.content: 皮をむく
to peel off the skin―(獣や魚や芋なら)―skin a rabbit―skin a fish―skin a potato―(木の皮なら)―bark a tree―(馬の皮なら)―flay a horse―(果物の皮なら)―rind a fruit―peel an orange―pare an apple
鳥の毛をむく
to pluck a fowl―pick a fowl
面{つら}の皮をむく
to put one to shame―put one to the blush―shame one―humiliate one―put one out of countenance

content:
むく〔無垢〕
〈形〉Pure; solid; innocent; stainless; spotless; undefiled; unpolluted; immaculate

content.content: 食器は金無垢だ
The plate is of pure gold―of solid gold.
清浄無垢の処女だ
She is a pure virgin―a spotless virgin―an immaculate virgin.
花嫁の支度は白無垢
The bride was attired in white.

content:
むくい〔報い〕
〈名〉
1. (=報復)revenge; vengeance; requital; repayment; return:(=る)to revenge (one's wrong); to avenge (one's father's wrongs); to requite, repay (one's kindness); to return (good for evil)

content.content: 仇を報いる
to revenge one's wrongs―(を通例略して)―revenge oneself―(また)―be revenged―take one's revenge―have one's revenge
親の仇を報いる
to avenge one's father's wrongs―(を略して)―avenge one's father
恩に報いる
to requite one's kindness―repay one's kindness
ご恩の万分の一も報いたいと思います
I shall never be able to repay your kindness.
恩をもって仇に報いる
to return good for evil
恩をもって仇に報いもって人を慚愧{ざんき}せしむ
to heaps coals of fire on one's head
恩を仇で報いる
to return evil for good
国恩に報いる
to pay one's debt to one's country
国恩の万分の一に報いる
to do one's bit for one's country
暴をもって暴に報いる
to give tit for tat―give measure for measure
親の因果が子に報う
“The sins of the father are visited on the children.”
それは親に苦労をかけた報いだ
It is a judgment for bringing your father's gray hairs to the grave.
それは人を欺いた報いだ
It is a punishment for your deceit.
間違ったことをした報いを受ける
to pay for doing wrong
あれは猪{しし}を食った報いだ
He must pay dearly for his follies.
職務怠慢の報いが免職
He must pay for his neglect of duty by losing his place.
怠けた報いで落第だ
You must pay for your idleness by failing in your examination.

content: 2. (=報償)compensation, indemnity (for a loss) ; recompense, remuneration (for one's labours) ; a reward (for one's services); the reward (of one's services) :(=る) to compensate, indemnify (one for a loss) ; to recompense, remunerate (one for one's labours) ; to pay (one for one's trouble) ; to reward (one for one's services)

content.content: 労に報います
I will recompense you for your labours―remunerate you for your labours―pay you for your trouble.
功労に報いる
to reward one for one's services
損労(功労)の報いとして些少ながらこれをさし上げます
I beg you will accept this trifle in compensation for your loss―in recompense for your labours―in reward for your services.

content: 3. (=応報)retribution; nemesis

content.content: これは悪事の報いだ
It is a retribution for your evil deed―You must pay the penalty of your deed.
天の報いはてきめんだ
Swift is Heaven's retribution.

人の言を無下に拒否する

content:

〈形〉Abstract (idea); immaterial (loss); incorporeal (soul); spiritual (things); moral (support, etc.)

content.content: 有形無形の財産
material and immaterial property
無形の損害の方が有形の損害よりも大きい
The immaterial loss is greater than the material.
彼からは有形無形の助力を受けている
I have received assistance, both material and moral, at his hands.
有形無形の援助
material and moral support
無形名詞
an abstract noun

content.content: 無稽の風説だ
The rumour is unfounded―It is a groundless rumour―a baseless rumour.

The Bolshevist invasion of Japan is a myth.

〈形〉Unaccomplished

content.content: 多芸は無芸
“A Jack of all trades is master of none.”

content:
むける〔向ける〕
〈他動〉
1. (=向わせる)to turn(something to or upon or toward anything) ; to turn, bend, direct (one's feet to or toward a place) ; to send (an army against the enemy)

content.content: 人に目を向ける
to turn one's eyes upon a man
彼は僕の方へ背中を向けた、尻を向けた
He turned his back toward me.
人に尻を向けて坐るのは失礼だ
It is bad manners to sit with your back toward a person.
どこへ足を向ける
to turn one's steps―bend one's steps―direct one's steps―to or toward a place
我が家の方に足を向けた
I turned my steps homeward.
人へ足を向けて寝るのは失礼だ
It is bad manner (in Japan) to lie down with your feet toward any one.
恩人の方へは足を向けて寝ない
I do not lie down at night with my feet toward my benefactor―(英国風に言えば)―I do not forget my gratitude to him, walking or sleeping.
注意を向ける
to turn one's attention―direct one's attention―bent one's mind―to a subject
兵を向ける
to send a force against the enemy
(どこへ)船首を向ける
to head for―steer for―a point
ポンプの筒先を向ける
to turn a hose upon a burning house
今度は僕の方へ鋒先を向けて来た
Then he turned his attack upon me.
君に鋒を向ける
to bear arms against one's load―rise in arms against one's sovereign

content: 2. (=銃砲を向ける)to point (a gun at a mark) ; to level (a gun at a mark) ; to present (a pistol at a person) ; to aim (a revolver at a person) :(大砲なら)to train(a gun upon a mark) ; to bring (a gun) to bear on (the mark)

content.content: 幕兵は鎮撫使に向かって銃を向けた
The Shogunate troops pointed their guns―levelled their guns―at the peace-maker.
一人の暴漢が女皇に拳銃を向けた
A ruffian presented a pistol at the Queen.
泥棒にピストルを向けた
I aimed a revolver at the burglar―covered the burglar with a pistol.
標的に大砲を向けることができなかった
They could not train the guns upon the mark―bring the guns to bear upon the mark.

content: 3. (=さし向ける)to send (a bailiff to a person) ; to direct (a person to a place) ; to refer(a person to another)

content.content: この品は支那へ向けるのだ
These goods are to be sent to China.
その人を役所の方へ向けてやった
I directed the man to the office.
人が聞きに来たなら君の方へ向けてやる
If any one comes to me for information, I shall refer him to you.
僕の方へ英語の先生を一人向けて下さるまいか
Can you get us―procure us―(譲るの意味なら)―spare us―a teacher of English?

content: 4. (=充てる)to apply (money to some purpose) ; to devote (a fund to some purpose) ; to appropriate (a fund for some purpose)

content.content: あの金は月払いに向けた
I have applied the money to the payment of the monthly bills.
彼は金を取ると皆学資の方へ向ける
He devotes all his earnings to his school-expenses.
この資金は建築費の方へ向けてある
The fund is appropriated for the new building.
水を向ける
to draw out a man―(誉められたくてなら)―fish for compliments
彼は少し水を向けるとなんでもしゃべってしまう
If you draw him out a little, he will blab everything.

content:
むける〔剥ける〕
〈自動〉To peel; to come off

content.content: 皮が剥ける
the skin comes off
(日に焼けて)背中の皮が剥ける

content.content: 無限の空間
infinite space
無限の時
infinite time―limitless time―eternity
無限の世
the endless world
慾は無限なり
Avarice knows no bounds.
日本は無限の海産物を有す
Japan has an inexhaustible supply of marine products.
日本の人口は無限に増加する
Japan increases in population to an unlimited extent―ad infinitum.
無限数
infinity
無限小
infinitesimal
無限責任
unlimited liability
(合資会社の)無限責任社員

むこ〔婿〕
〈名〉(=娘の夫)a husband:(娘の親から言えば)a son-in-law:(花婿)a bridegroom:(婿の候補者)a suitor

content.content: 婿を取る
to take a husband
娘に婿を取る
to find a husband for one's daughter
婿を選ぶ
to choose a husband
あの娘は好い婿を取った
She has made a good match.
良い婿だ
He is a good match―She has an excellent match in him.
婿になる
to marry―get married―(どこの婿になる)―marry into a family―(一人娘の婿になる)―marry an heiress
一人娘が大勢と見合いをしてこれならというので婿にしたのが即ち彼
The heiress saw many suitors, and he was found eligible for the post of husband.
娘一人に婿八人
(直訳すれば)There are eight suitors for one daughter―(意訳すれば)She has many suitors―She is much sought after―much run after.
婿は大名から貰え
Take your daughter's husband from a good family.

content:
むこう〔向う〕
〈名〉
1. (=向う側)the opposite side; the other side:(=の) the opposite; the other; yonder; that... over there:(=に) yonder; over there:(前置詞に訳せば)on the other side of (the river) ; over (the way) ; across (the street) ; beyond (a mountain); opposite, over against (a house) ; across, over, beyond (the seas)

content.content: その家は河向こうだ
The house stands across the river―on the other side of the river.
学校のじき向こうに本屋がある
There is a bookstore right opposite the school.
その向こうが外国語学校です
The house opposite is the Foreign Language School.
彼は海の向こうの遠い国へ行った
He has gone to a far country over the seas―across the seas―beyond the seas.
あの山の向こうに村がある
There is a village beyond that mountain.
僕は向こうの山を越えて行くのだ
I am going to cross that mountain over there―(は現代用語、古文体では)―yonder mountain.
向こう河岸
the opposite side of the river
遙か向うに灯火が見える
I see a light far in the distance―far away.
向こうはるかに見渡せば
As I gaze off far into the distance,...
向こうから来たのは誰だ
Who is that coming this way?
向こうへお出なさい
Go to the other place.
向こう三軒両隣り(善隣)
good neighbourhood
向こう三軒両隣に好くせよ
Be a good neighbour.
浮草や
Glide, water-flower, glide!
今日は向うの
And this day on the other side
岸に咲く
Is it thy will to grace the tide?

content: 2. (=行き先)one's destination; one's journey's end

content.content: 向こうへ着く
to reach one's destination―get to one's journey's end
向こうへ着いたら知らして下さい
When you get there, pleas let me know.

content: 3. (=先方)the other party; the other side; he (she, they)

content.content: 向こうにも言い分があるだろう
Much might be said on the other side.
向こうの話も聞いて見なけりゃならぬ
I must hear the other side of the story.
向こうが無理だ
He is in the wrong.
(何で誰の)向こうを張る
to rival―emulate―compete with―cope with―vie with―some one in some respect
海軍で英国の向こうを張る国は無い
No power can cope with English in navel power.
彼らは皇室の向こうを張って栄耀栄華を極めている
They vie with royalty in splendour.
日本は Newton の向こうを張る数学者を出した
Japan produced a mathematician who could emulate Newton.
これをもって彼の向こうを張る
to oppose this to that―set this against that
我が勇をもって彼の富の向こうを張る
We can oppose our valour to their wealth.
我が近松をもって沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の向こうを張る
We can set our Chikamatsu against their Shakespeare.

content: 〈形〉(=来たる)next; these; to come

content.content: 向こう三日間臨時休業
The school is closed for the next three days.
向こう十日間ここに居る
I shall stay here these ten days.
向こう一年間滞在する
I shall stay here for a year to come.
工事は向こう一年間に竣工の予定

向こう一週間で仕事を終わります
I shall finish my work in a week's time.
向こう一週間かかります

content:
むこう〔無効〕
〈形〉
1. (=効力無き)invalid (contract) ; unavailable, bad (ticket) ; (the agreement is) null, null and void; (the law is) void, null and void; (the promise is) not binding, of no force, of no legal force; (the deed is) of no effect, of no legal effect

content.content: 強制せられて為せる約束は無効だ
A promise made under compulsion is not binding―of no force.
この契約はもう無効だ
The contract is now invalid―null―null and void―of no effect.
この証文はもう無効だ
The deed is now null―void―null and void―of no effect (時効の為なら)―barred by prescription.
無効になる
A contract becomes invalid―loses its validity―loses effect―An agreement becomes null―A law becomes void―goes out of force―A right lapses―A ticket is not available.
この切符は三日後は無効になる
The ticket will not be available―cease to be available―after three days.
途中でちょっと下車したら切符は無効になりますか
Will my ticket cease to be available―Shall I forfeit my ticket―if I stop over at a way-station?
かかる場合には約束は無効に帰すべし
In such cases, the promise will cease to be binding.
無効にする

(契約なら)to invalidate a contract―vitiate a contract―(約束なら)―annul a promise―make a promise of no force―(法律なら)―nullify a law―make a law of no effect―(証文なら)―defeat a deed―(結婚なら)―make a marriage null and void.
結婚を無効にする障害
a diriment impediment

content: 2. (=効を奏さぬ)ineffectual, abortive, fruitless (attempt, etc.)

content.content: その試みは無効であった
The attempt was ineffectual―abortive―fruitless of results―attended with no results.
多年の労は無効に帰した
Years of labour has come to naught.

むこうみず〔向う見ず〕
〈形〉Rash; reckless; headlong; foolhardy; dare-devil; devil-may-care:(=に) rashly; recklessly; headlong; head over heels

content.content: 血気の若者は向こう見ずだ

彼は向こう見ずで後先の考えが無い

content:
むこん〔無根〕
〈形〉Unfounded; groundless; baseless

content.content: 評判は事実無根だ

無根の風説に過ぎぬ
