content:
むそう〔無双〕
〈形〉
1. (=無比)peerless; matchless; unmatched; unequalled; unrivalled; unparallelled; unique; nonpareil

content.content: 大力無双の英雄
a warrior of unparallelled strength
天下無双の豪傑
the greatest man alive

content: 2. (=表裏同質同製の)of the same material inside and out; of the same make on both sides

content.content: 無双の羽織
a haori lined with the same material
無双の時計
a hunting-watch

content:
むぞうさ〔無造作〕
〈形〉
1. (=容易)easy:(=に) easily; with ease; with facility

content.content: 無造作にやってのけた
He accomplished his task with ease.
彼は無造作に失錯もするがまた無造作にごまかす
He easily gets into scrapes, and gets out of them with equal facility.

content: 2. (=ぞんざい)careless:(=に) carelessly; without ceremony; without more ado; off-hand

content.content: 君のやりかたは無造作だ
You do things in a careless way.
彼は人を無造作に扱う
He treats people without ceremony.
彼は僕を無造作に引張って行った
He hustled me off without more ado.
彼は仕事を無造作にかたづけてしまう
He despatches his business off-hand.

content:
むだ〔無駄〕
〈形〉Vain (efforts); useless (labour); unavailing (endeavours); fruitless (attempt); futile (endeavours); barren (discussion); idle (talk)

content.content: やってみても無駄だ(から止せ)
There is no use in trying―It is no use trying―It is no good trying.
そんなことを学んでも無駄じゃないか
What is the use of―Where is the good of―learning such things?
彼には何を言っても無駄だ
Words are wasted on him.
彼には忠告をしても無駄だ
All advice is lost on him.
彼には親切を尽しても無駄になる
Kindness is thrown away upon him.
そんな金は無駄になる
Such money is as good as thrown away―It is a sheer waste of money.
金を無駄に使う
to waste money
時間が無駄になる
It is a waste of time.
せっかくの骨折りが無駄になった
All my efforts have come to naught.
そうすれば骨折りが無駄にならぬ
It will make your efforts tell.
こんなことでも覚えておけば将来無駄になるまい
Such things, if learned, may prove of service―stand you in stead―some day.
無駄なことをする
to butter the bread on both sides―paint the lily―refine a violet―gild refined gold

content:
むだあし〔無駄足〕
〈名〉A fruitless quest

content.content: 無駄足を運ぶ
to go on a fruitless quest―“go on a fool's errand”
無駄足を運ばせる
to send one on a fool's errand
訪れた人が不在で無駄足を運んだ
I went to see a man, only to find him out.

content:
むたい〔無体〕
〈名〉Force; compulsion; unreason

content.content: 無理無体に
compulsorily―forcibly―by force
無体に働かせる
to make one work by force―force one to work―hold one's nose to the grindstone
そりゃご無体です
You are unreasonable.

content:
むだい〔無代〕
〈副〉Free of charge; for nothing; for the asking; gratis

content.content: 無代進呈
You shall have it for nothing―It may be had for the asking―It is a free gift.
無代食事
to have free board
見本無代進呈
Sample sent gratis.

content:
むだいか〔無代価〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: むだい〔無代〕

content:
むだぐち〔無駄口〕
〈名〉Chatter; prattle; twaddle

content.content: 無駄口を利く
to chatter―prattle―twaddle
無駄口を利くな
Do not waste words!―Do not waste your breath!―“Keep your breath to cool your porridge!”
彼は無駄口を利かぬ
He has no words to throw at a dog.

むだづかい〔無駄使い〕
〈名〉Waste of money:(=する) to waste money; to squander one's money; to make ducks and drakes of one's money

むだはな〔無駄花〕
〈名〉A neuter flower

content:
むだばなし〔無駄話〕
〈名〉Idle talk; empty palaver; idle gossip; tittle-tattle

content.content: 無駄話をして時間をつぶした
We wasted time in empty palaver.

content:
むだぼねおり〔無駄骨折〕
〈名〉Vain efforts; lost labour; waste of labour; a thankless task

content.content: 無駄骨折りをする
to labour in vain―beat the air―plough the sands―flog a dead horse―get nothing for one's pains―get laughed at for one's pains

content:
むだん〔無断〕
〈副〉
1. (=無届けで)without notice; without warning

content.content: 無断欠席
absence without notice―absence without leave
無断欠席する
to absent oneself without due notice―absent oneself without leave―play truant
彼は無断で家出をした
He left home without the knowledge of his people.
無断中座する
to take French leave

content: 2. (=無許可で)without leave; without permission

content.content: 彼は無断で外出した
He has been absent without leave.
書籍を無断で持ち帰ることを禁ず
The books must not be taken home without permission.
無断入場を禁ず
No admittance without permission.
人の物を無断で取るものでない
You should not make free with―help yourself to―others' possessions.

content:
むち〔鞭〕
〈名〉A whip:(籐の鞭)a cane:(索鞭)a lash:(学校で体罰に用いる鞭)the birch:(教鞭)the rod:(地図などを指す鞭)a pointer

content.content: 鞭で打つ
to whip―lash―flog―swish―one
鞭を加える
to lay on lashes
鞭を鳴らす
to crack a whip
鞭でコマを打って回す
to whip a top
鞭長しと雖馬腹に及ばず{むちながしといえどもばふくにおよばず}
“The king has long arms, but they do not reach all places.”

content:
むち〔無恥〕
〈名〉Shamelessness; effrontery; impudence:(=なる) shameless; impudent; unblushing

content.content: 彼らは厚顔無恥の徒だ
They are dead to shame―lost to virtue.

content:
むち〔無智〕
〈名〉Ignorance:(=なる) ignorant

content.content: 無智に甘んずる
to repose in the lap of ignorance

content:
むちうつ〔鞭つ〕
〈他動〉
1. (=鞭で打つ)to whip (a horse):(罰としてなら)to lash (a culprit); to flog (a school-boy); to swish (a boy); to lay on lashes

content.content: 馬に鞭つ
to whip a horse―whip a horse on―whip up horse
死馬に鞭つ
to flog a dead horse
駿馬に鞭たず
“Do not spur a willing horse.”
膝栗毛に鞭つ
to ride one's shanks' mare
死屍に鞭つ
to speak ill of the dead
死屍に鞭たず
Never speak ill of the dead―“Nil nisi bonum.”

content: 2. (=激励する)to spur (one) on; to egg (one) on; to goad (one) on

content.content: 心の駒に鞭つ
to nerve one's heart―nerve oneself

むちつじょ〔無秩序〕
〈名〉Want of order; disorder; chaos

content:
むちもうまい〔無智蒙昧〕
〈形〉Ignorant, unenlightened, benighted (people); untutored (savages); dark (ages)

content.content: 土人は無恥蒙昧だ
The natives are in the darkest ignorance―wrapped in the darkness of ignorance.
無恥蒙昧の民
unenlightened people―benighted people
無恥蒙昧の蛮人
untutored savages
無恥蒙昧の時代
the dark ages

content:
むちゃ〔無茶〕
〈形〉
1. (=混乱せる)confused; disordered; indiscriminate; mixed up; jumbled up:(副詞に訳せば)topsyturvy; pell-mell; at sixes and sevens

content.content: 家の中はむちゃくちゃだ
The house is in wild disorder―topsyturvy.
会計はむちゃくちゃだ
The accounts are in the greatest confusion―at sixes and sevens.
彼の言うことはむちゃくちゃだ
His ideas are hopelessly confused.
自分の物やら人の物やらむちゃくちゃになった
Things are mixed up pell-mell.
いろいろさまざまの物がむちゃくちゃに混じっている
All sorts of things are jumbled together―huddled together―tumbled together.
そうむちゃに人を入れては困る
You must not admit people so indiscriminately.

content: 2. (=わけのわからぬ)nonsensical; unreasonable; without rhyme or reason

content.content: 彼の言うことはむちゃくちゃだ
What he says, is without rhyme or reason.
そんなむちゃを言っては困る
You must not talk such nonsense―talk such unreason.
そんなむちゃを言っては話にならぬ
Such nonsense is out of the question.
僕は決してむちゃは言わぬ
I am talking sense―quite reasonable.

content: 3. (=無鉄砲)rash; reckless; wild; mad; madcap; harum-scarum

content.content: そんなむちゃをしては困る
You must not be so rash―so reckless.
お前はむちゃで困る
You are a madcap―a harum-scarum.
若い時はむちゃだ
Young men are wild.
あの頃は若かったからむちゃだった
I was a wild young man at that time.

content: 4. (=に)(=むやみに、やたらに)immoderately; inordinately; madly; to excess; like fury; like thunder; like hell; like blazes; like the devil; like one o'clock; like anything

content.content: 彼はむちゃくちゃに細君を可愛がる
He is immoderately fond of his wife―He is inordinately fond of his wife―He dotes upon his wife.
彼はむちゃくちゃに勉強する
He works like fury―like thunder―like hell―like the devil―like anything.
むちゃに食う、むちゃに飲む
He eats to excess―drinks to excess―commits excesses.
女が男にむちゃくちゃに惚れている
She loves him to distraction.
皆むちゃくちゃに駈け出した
They ran like mad.

content:
むちゃくちゃ〔無茶苦茶〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: むちゃ〔無茶〕

content:
むちゅう〔夢中〕
〈名〉
1. (=恍惚、有頂天)ecstasy; rapture

content.content: 夢中になる
to go off into ecstasies―go off into raptures
彼に珍しい骨董でも見せようものなら夢中になってしまう
He will go off into raptures over a rare curio.
彼は嬉しくて夢中だ
He is in raptures―in ecstasies―in an ecstasy of joy―beside himself with joy.
悲しくて夢中だ
He is beside himself with grief―stupefied with grief.
夢中になって怒っている
He is beside himself with anger.
夢中になって芝居を見ていた
He gazed on the scene with rapture.
夢中になって音楽を聴いていた
He listened to the music with rapt attention.
夢中になって感心していた
He was rapt in wonder―lost in admiration.
怖い怖いの一念で夢中で駈け出した
I ran in terror.
(演説に慣れないものだから)夢中にしゃべった
I talked like one dazed―in a dazed sort of way.

content: 2. (=熱中)absorption; engrossment

content.content: 彼は学問に夢中だ
He is absorbed in his studies―wrapped up in his studies―immersed in his studies―deep in his studies.
専門に夢中だ
He is engrossed in his profession.
仕事に夢中だ
He is absorbed in work―up to the eyes in work―up to the elbows in work.
子どもらは遊びに夢中だ
The children are absorbed in play―wrapped up in play.
(大人が)遊びに夢中になっている
He is immersed in pleasures.
遊びに夢中になる
to abandon oneself to pleasures
彼は商売に夢中だ
He is engrossed in his business.
彼は自動車に夢中になっている
He is mad on motoring.
女に夢中になっている
He is infatuated with a woman.
彼は何をさせても夢中になる質だ
He will go, heart and soul, into any scheme.

content: 3. (=無意、無心)unconsciousness

content.content: 夢中で
without knowing it
夢中で走った
I ran without knowing it.
我が家へ帰るまでは無我夢中だった
I knew nothing till I got home.
あまり忙しくて夢中で日を暮らした
I was so busy that I took no note of time.
一生夢中で暮らす人がある
Some people dream their lives away.
あまり面白くて夢中で一夜を明かした
I was so interested that I passed the night without knowing it.
彼は夢中で身代を使い果たした
He went through his fortune without knowing it―He awoke one morning to find himself penniless.
昨今来たばかりでここの事情は夢中です
I am new to the place, and utterly in the dark about the state of things here.
有望な事業と聞いて夢中で飛び込んだ
I plunged headlong into the enterprise which was said to be so promising.
夢中で大任を引き受けてしまった
I took the trust upon myself head over heels.

content:
むちゅう〔霧中〕
〈副〉In the fog

content.content: 霧中信号
a fog-signal
霧中号角
a fog-horn
霧中号笛
a fog-siren―a fog-whistle
五里霧中に迷う
to lose one's bearings―to be bewildered―in a fog―in a cloud―in a maze―utterly at fault―wholly at sea―all abroad

content:
むちゅうほこう〔夢中歩行〕
〈名〉Sleep-walking; somnambulism:(=する) to walk in one's sleep

content.content: 夢中歩行者
a sleep-walker―a somnambulist

content:
むちん〔無賃〕
〈形〉Free of charge; charge-free; free

content.content: 市内は無賃配達
The goods are delivered free (of charge) within the limits of the city.
無賃配達
free delivery
手荷物は三十斤まで無賃
Luggage is allowed free up to 30 pounds.
無賃手荷物
free luggage
無賃制限外手荷物
excess luggage
無賃乗車する
to travel free (in a train)
無賃乗車
free passage
無賃乗車券
a free-pass
無賃乗客
a free passenger―(米国では)―a dead-head
五歳未満の小児は無賃
Children under five years of age are not charged.

ムツ
〈名〉A medium-sized fish prized for food in the winter months

content:
むつう〔無痛〕
〈形〉Painless

content.content: 無痛出産
painless delivery
無痛腫物
an indolent tumour

content:
むつかしい〔六かしい〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: むずかしい〔六かしい、難しい〕

むつき〔睦月〕
〈名〉(A poetical name for) the first month of the lunar calendar; January

content:
むつき〔襁褓〕
〈名〉Swaddling-bands; swaddling-clothes; long-clothes

content.content: 赤児をむつきに包む
to swaddle a baby
むつきの赤児
a baby in its long-clothes
むつきのうちから伯(叔)母に育てられた
His aunt look charge of him when he was in his long-clothes.

content:
ムックリ
〈副〉

content.content: ムックリ肥えている
to be plump―plump as a dumpling―plump as a partridge
ムックリ起きる
to get up suddenly―start to one's feet

content:
むつごと〔睦言〕
〈名〉Lovers' talk; soft whisperings; soft nothings

content.content: 寝屋の睦言
the soft whisperings of the bedchamber
睦言を言う
to whisper soft nothings to each other

content:
むっつ〔六つ〕
〈名、形〉Six

content.content: 坊やは六つです
Sonny is six (years old).

content:
むっつりした
〈形〉Sullen; morose; grim

content.content: 彼はむっつりした人だ
He is a morose man―a grim-looking man―He has not a word to throw at a dog.

content:
むっとする
〈自動〉
1. (=憤る)to get into a rage; to take (anything) in dudgeon:(=した) sullen; grim

content.content: 彼はむっとした顔をしている
He has a sullen look―a grim look.
彼はむっとして席を蹴って去った
He flung away in a rage.
その言葉を聞いて彼はむっとした
He took the remark in dudgeon.

content: 2. (=咽せる)to be choked; to be stifled; to be suffocated

content.content: 室内はむっとするほど暑い
The heat of the room is stiffing―The heat of the room is suffocating.

content:
むつまじい〔睦じい〕
〈形〉Intimate; familiar; friendly; brotherly; loving; harmonious

content.content: 人と睦じくする
to hold familiar intercourse with one―make friends with one―fraternize with one―hob-nob with one―chum with one
二人は睦じい
They are on intimate terms with each other―on familiar terms with each other.
たいそう睦じい
They are great friends.
ばかに睦じい
They are hand and glove with each other―as thick as thieves.
夫婦睦じく暮らしている
The couple live in harmony―They are happy together.
睦じい夫婦だ
They are a loving couple.
一家睦じく暮らしている
The family live in concord.
兄弟が睦じい
The brothers love each other.
睦じい兄弟だ
They are loving brothers.
睦じい友達だ
They are intimate friends.
坊ちゃんは百姓の子どもと睦じく遊んでいる
Young master is fraternizing with the village boys.

content:
むて〔無手〕
〈副〉
1. (=武器を持たずに)Without arms; unarmed

content.content: 彼は無手でけんかに飛び込んだ
He dashed unarmed into the row.

content: 2. (=資本無しに)without capital

content.content: 無手で商売を始めた
He engaged in business without capital―He had nothing to start with.

content:
むていい〔無定位〕
〈形〉Astatic

content.content: 無定位針
an astatic needle

content:
むていけい〔無定形〕
〈名〉Formless; amorphous

content.content: 無定形炭素
amorphous carbon

content:
むてき〔無敵〕
〈形〉Matchless; invincible

content.content: 無敵艦隊
the Invincible Armada

content:
むてき〔霧笛〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きりぶえ〔霧笛〕

content:
むてっぽう〔無鉄砲〕
〈形〉Rash; reckless; dare-devil; wild; madcap; harum-scarum

content.content: そんな無鉄砲なことをしては困る
You must not be so rash―so reckless.
お前は無鉄砲で困る
You are a madcap―a harum-scarum.
若いときは無鉄砲だ
Young men are wild.
あの頃は若かったから無鉄砲であった
I was a wild young man at that time.

content:
むでん〔無電〕
〈名〉
1. (=無線電信)wireless telegraph; radio-telegraphy
2. (=無線電話)a wireless telegraph; a radio-telephone; radio

content.content: 無電放送局
the Radio Broadcasting Bureau

content:
むとどけ〔無届〕
〈形、副〉Without (due) notion; without leave

content.content: 無届欠席
absence without notice―absence without leave
無届で欠席する
to absent oneself without due notice―play truant

content:
むとんじゃく〔無頓着〕
〈名〉Indifference; unconcern; carelessness; nonchalance:(=な) indifferent (to or about appearance); unconcerned (about the result); careless(about dress) ; unmindful (of others); nonchalant (air, etc.)

content.content: 彼は世の毀誉褒貶{きよほうへん}に無頓着だ
He is indifferent to praise or censure.
些細なことには無頓着だ
He does not care about trifles―He is careless about trifles―indifferent about trifles.
食物はやかましいが身なりには無頓着だ
He is particular about his food, but indifferent about―careless about―his dress.
試験の成績がどうなろうと無頓着だ
He is unconcerned about―careless about―the result of his examination.
彼は人のことには無頓着だ
He is unmindful of others.
彼は無頓着なふうをしている
He has an air of indifference―an unconcerned air―a nonchalant air.

むなあて〔胸当て〕
〈名〉A breast-plate; a plastron

content:
むないた〔胸板〕
〈名〉The breast (of a man); the breast-plate (of an armour)

content.content: 胸板を撃ち抜かれる
to be shot through the breast
剣で胸板を貫く
to run one through
胸板を貫かれて倒れた
He was run trough and fell.

むながわら〔棟瓦〕
〈名〉A ridge-tile

むなかんじょう〔胸勘定〕
〈名〉Mental arithmetic; a rough estimate:(=する) to calculate mentally; to make a rough estimate (of the cost, etc.)

むなぎ〔棟木〕
〈名〉A ridge-pole; a ridge-beam; a ridge-timber

content:
むなぐら〔胸倉〕
〈名〉The breast (of a grow)

content.content: 胸倉を取る
to seize one by the collar―collar one―hold one at arm's length

むなぐるしい〔胸苦しい〕
〈形容詞を動詞に訳して〉To feel oppressed in one's breast

むなさき〔胸先〕
〈名〉The pit of the stomach

content:
むなさわぎ〔胸騒ぎ〕
〈名〉Agitation; trepidation; flutter; tumult; presentiment

content.content: 胸騒ぎがする
I am agitated―fluttered―in a flutter―in a tumult―My heart beat fast.
名を呼ばれたときは胸騒ぎがした
When I heard myself called by name, I felt a flutter in my breast.
胸騒ぎがするから何事も無ければよいが
I have a presentiment of something happening.
その物音にもしや主かと胸騒ぎ
The sound puts me in a flutter―Can it be you?

むなざん〔胸算〕
〈名〉(=胸算用)Mental arithmetic; a rough estimate:(=する) to calculate mentally; to form a rough estimate (of the coat, etc.)

content:
むなしい〔空しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=空虚)empty; vacant

content.content: 手をむなしうして帰る
to return empty-handed
宝の山に入って手をむなしうして帰るが如し
It is returning empty-handed from a mountain of treasures.
嚢中むなし
My purse is empty―My money is out―I am out of money.
己をむなしうする
to effect oneself―sink oneself
かかる書は己をむなしうして読むべきものである
Such books should be read with entire submission of self―free from all bias.

content: 2. (=無効、無益、無駄)vain; fruitless; futile; unavailing; ineffectual

content.content: 試みはむなしかった
The attempt was ineffectual―fruitless of results―attended with no results.
多年の労もむなしくなった
Years of labour has come to naught.
努力むなしからず
My labours are crowned with success―My labours have borne fruit.
英語の研究むなしからず
I have not studied English for nothing.
寝て食えば山もむなし
Idleness will consume a mountain of wealth.
(敵の)計をむなしくする
to baffle a design―baulk a design―defeat a design―foil a design―frustrate a design
計がむなしくなる
One is baffled in one's design―baulked in one's design―defeated in one's design―foiled in one's design―frustrated in one's design.→『むなしく〔空しく〕』

content: 3. (=亡き)dead; lifeless

content.content: むなしき亡骸
a lifeless corpse
むなしき亡骸に取りすがりよよとばかりに泣き伏した
She abandoned herself to grief over his lifeless remains.

content:
むなしく〔空しく〕
〈副〉Vainly; in vain; to no purpose; in idleness; idly

content.content: 五年の月日をむなしく過ごした
Five years have been passed in vain.
むなしく日を暮らす
to pass one's time in idleness―idle one's time away―live to no purpose

むなもと〔胸元〕
〈名〉The pit of the stomach

content:
むなやけ〔胸焼け〕
〈名〉Heartburn

content.content: 胸焼けがする
I have a heartburn.

むなわりながや〔棟割長屋〕
〈名〉A partitioned tenement-house

content:
むに〔無二〕
〈形〉Peerless; matchless; unmatched; unequalled; unrivalled; unique; sans pareil; the one

content.content: 天下無二の美人
a peerless beauty―a matchless beauty
世界無二の国体
a nationality with no equal in the world
堅牢無二の戦艦
a battleship of matchless strength
忠義無二の人
a man of peerless loyalty
天下無二の珍品
a unique article
彼は当代無二の詩人だ
He is the one poet of the day.
無二の友
one's second self―one's alter ego

content:
むにする〔無にする〕
〈他動〉To bring (anything) to naught

content.content: 人の好意を無にするものではない
You should not bring people's kindness to naught―set aside people's kindness.
ご好意を無にするのは残念ですが
I am sorry I can not avail myself of your kindness.

content:
むにむさんに〔無二無三に〕
〈副〉With might and main; hummer and tongs; tooth and nail

content.content: 無二無三に攻め立てる
to attack the enemy hammer and tongs―throw ［fling, hurl］ oneself upon the enemy―(相手が個人なら)―make a dead set at a man―(相手が仕事なら)―go to it, tooth and nail
無二無三に城を攻め立てる
to push the siege

content:
むにんしょ〔無任所〕
〈形〉Unattached; supernumerary

content.content: 無任所書記官
a secretary unattached
無任所将校
a supernumerary office

content:
むにんしょう〔無人称〕
〈形〉［文法］Impersonal

content.content: 無人称動詞
an impersonal verb

むにんとう〔無人島〕
〈名〉An uninhabited island

content:
むね〔胸〕
〈名〉
1. (=胸部)the breast; the bosom; the chest

content.content: 胸に手を当てる
to lay a hand on one's breast―apply a hand to one's breast
胸に手を当てて考えた
I thought with my hand on my breast―I pondered over the matter.
胸に勲章を掛ける
to wear a decoration on one's breast
胸が痛い
I feel a pain in my chest―My chest pains me.
胸を出す
to throw out one's chest
ある食物は胸につかえる
Some food sits heavy on the stomach.
胸がつかえる
I feel a pressure on the chest.
胸のつかえを直す
to remove the pressure off the chest
胸のつかえが直った、胸がすいた
I feel relieved of the pressure on the chest.
胸が悪くなる
to feel nausea―feel queasy―feel sick
見ると胸が悪くなる
The sight is nauseating―sickening―disgusting―My gorge rises at the sight―My stomach turns at the sight.
胸の悪い匂い
a sickly smell
胸の悪いお世辞
fulsome flattery
胸がふさがる
One is choked with emotions―One feels a lump in one's throat―One's heart swells with grief.
胸がいっぱいになる
One's heart is full.
胸がいっぱいでものが言えぬ
My heart is too full for words.
(安心して)胸を撫で下ろす
I breathe again―breathe freely―give a sigh of relief―fell a sense of relief.
胸に釘
The cap fits.
そう言われたときは胸に釘を打たれたような気がした
His words went home to my heart.

content: 2. (=心臓)the heart

content.content: 胸がどきどきする
My heart throbs.
胸が轟く、胸は早鐘を打つよう
My heart beats fast.
胸を轟かす
to make one's heart beat fast
胸を躍らす
My heart leaps―My heart gives a leap―I have my heart in my mouth.
胸が張り裂ける
My heart breaks―It breaks my heart―I am heart-broken.
女は胸が張り裂けそうに泣いた
She cried as if her heart would break―She cried her heart out.
それを思うと胸が張り裂けそうだ
It breaks my heart to think of it.
胸の張り裂けるような思い
heart-breaking grief―heart-rending grief
胸が焼ける
I have a heartburn.

content:
3. (=心)heart; mind; feelings
《a》(胸が)

content.content: 胸が大きい
He is large-hearted―large-minded―magnanimous―generous.
胸が小さい
He is little-hearted―small-minded―ungenerous.
胸が広い
He is broad-minded―liberal.
胸が狭い
He is narrow-minded―liberal.
それで胸が晴れた
You have convinced me―I am convinced.
これを見たら君も胸が晴れるだろう
This will convince you.

content: 《b》(胸に)

content.content: 一趣向胸に浮かんだ
An idea occurs to my mind―suggests itself to my mind―comes across my mind―comes into my head―enters my head―strikes me.
煙を見ると火という念が胸に浮かぶ
When I see smoke, the idea of fire occurs to my mind―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sight of smoke suggests to my mind the idea of fire.
種々の考えが胸に浮かぶ
Various thoughts pass through my mind.
事実がそろそろ胸に浮かんだ
The truth dawned on my mind.
真相が電光の閃くように胸に浮かんだ
The truth flashed on my mind.
万感胸に迫る
A thousand emotions crowd upon my mind―throng upon my mind.
万事僕の胸にある
I understand my business―I know what I am about.
君の胸一つでどうにでもなる
It rests with you to decide―The decision rests with you.
胸に問う
to ask oneself
君の胸に問うてみ給え
I leave you to your conscience.
親の教えが胸にこたえた
My father's teaching have come home to my heart.
と聞いてギックリ胸にこたえた
I was startled by the news.
その話は胸に落ちぬ
The story does not go down with me―I can not swallow the story.
その説明なら生徒の胸に落ちる
That explanation will go down with the students.
この事は胸に納めておく(誰にも言わぬ)
I keep the matter to myself.
胸に思い当たることがある
I have thought of something.
それを聞いて胸に思い当たることがある
That reminds me of something―That suggests something to my mind.
胸に一物ある
He has a deep design in his mind.
胸に一物ありそうな声だと思った
I suspected from his voice that he meant mischief.
彼は胸に覚えがあるから赤面したのだ
He blushes, for he is conscious of his guilt.
彼は胸にやましいところがある
He is conscious of having done wrong―He has a sense of having done wrong.
僕は胸にやましいところは無い
I am conscious of having done right―I have a sense of having done right.
この詩は僕の胸に響かない
The poem does not appeal to my heart.
胸に釘
The cap fits―It is a dagger to my heart.

content: 《c》(胸の)

content.content: 胸の焔
the flame of passion
彼女は胸の底で彼を崇拝している
She worships him in her inmost heart―in her heart of hearts.
僕の胸の中を察し給え
Consider my feelings!
少しは僕の胸の内を察してくれ
You might have some consideration for my feelings.
君の胸の中はお察し申す
I feel for you.
彼女の胸の中は察すべしだ
Her mood must needs be pitied.

content: 《d》(胸を)

content.content: 胸を安める
to set one's heart at ease―set one's mind at rest―make oneself easy
胸を静める
to calm oneself―compose oneself
胸を落ち着ける
to collect oneself―gather one's scattered wits
胸を打明ける
to open one's heart―open one's mind―unbosom oneself―to another
胸を晴らす
to relieve one's feelings―ease one's mind
彼は人を叱って胸を晴らす
He works off his temper on other.
人の胸を察する
to consider one's feeling―enter into one's felling
胸を痛める
to distress oneself―trouble oneself―worry oneself―grieve―smart―take anything to heart
彼は試験で胸を痛めている
He is worrying himself over his examination―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The examination worries him.
彼は失敗して胸を痛めている
He takes his failure to heart.
彼は息子のことで胸を痛めている
He grieves for his son―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His son grieves him.
当てがはずれて胸を痛めている
He is smarting under disappointment.
胸を焦がす
to pine for―languish for―sigh for―some one
胸を掻きむしる
to lacerate one's heart―harrow one's feelings
胸を掻きむしるような話
the harrowing details(of a murder, etc.)

content: 4. (=着物の胸)the breast (of a grown)

content.content: シャツの胸
the shirt-front―the plastron

content:
むね〔旨〕
〈名〉
1. (=趣き)effect

content.content: 承諾する旨の電報がありました
I have received a telegram to the effect that he consents.
親父は上京する旨申越しました
Father writes to say (to the effect) that he is coming to town.
当日出席し難き向きはその旨届け出るべし
Those who can not attend on the day shall report to that effect.
その旨言ってやりました
I have written to him to that effect.

content: 2. (=主旨)(one's) aim, rule

content.content: 教育は心身の発達を旨とす
Education aims at the development of mind and body.
人に長たる者は寛大を旨とすべし
A leader of men should (make it a rule to) be lenient in dealing with his subordinates.
文は達意を旨とす
In writing, you should aim at expressing yourself to the point.
服装は質素を旨とす
The dress should be plain.
万端質素を旨とす
Simplicity should be observed in everything.

content: 3. (=命令)orders; directions; instructions

content.content: 旨を奉じて
in obedience to order
旨を含める
to give one directions

〈名〉The ridge (of a roof)

content.content: 棟瓦
a ridge-tile

content: 〈助数詞〉

content.content: 一棟、二棟
one house―two houses
一棟三戸建の長屋
a tenement-house divided into three sections

〈名〉(=刀の背)The back (of a sword)

content:
むねあげ〔棟上げ〕
〈名〉Putting the ridge-timber in place:(=する) to put the ridge-timber in place

content.content: 棟上式(に相当するは)
laying the corner-stone

〈名〉A breast-place; a plastron

content:
むねがわら〔棟瓦〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: むながわら〔棟瓦〕

むねと〔宗徒〕
〈名〉One's chief vassals; one's right-hand men

content:
むねん〔無念〕
〈名〉Vexation; mortification; chagrin; resentment; regret; grudge; wounded pride

content.content: 無念に思う、無念の涙にむせぶ
to be vexed―mortified―chagrined
失敗して無念に思っている
I am vexed at my failure.
無念の歯がみをした
I ground my teeth with vexation.
彼女はあまりの無念さにわっと泣き出した
She burst into s flood of tears in vexation of heart.
彼はいかにも無念そうに歯を食いしばって死んでおった
He was found dead with his teeth set as if in vexation of spirit.
この結果は無念ともなんとも言えない
The result is mortifying―I am mortified at the result.
成功せずに死ぬのは無念だ
I regret to die without having succeeded.
侮辱を受けて無念に思う
to resent an insult
無念骨髄に徹す
I am penetrated with resentment―cut to the heart.
彼は無念骨髄に徹している
He deeply resents the insult―His pride is wounded.
無念を晴らす
to wreak one's grudge (on one's enemy)
無念
(感嘆詞に用いれば)Zounds!

content:
むねんむそう〔無念無想〕
〈名〉An impassive state of mind; ecstasy

content.content: 無念無想を観ずる

content:
むのう〔無能〕
〈名〉Incompetence; incompetency; incapacity; inability; inefficiency:(=な)incompetent; incapable; inefficient

content.content: あれは無能な人だ
He is an incompetent―an incapable―a good-for-nothing.
敗北は将士の無能に起因する
The defeat is due to the incompetence of officers and men.
憲政党は政府の対支外交の無能を責めた
The Constitutionals charged the government with incompetency to deal with Chinese affairs.
無能な軍隊
inefficient troops

content:
むのうりょく〔無能力〕
〈名〉Incompetence; incompetency; legal incapacity; legal disability; legal disqualification:(=の) incompetent

content.content: 無能力者
an incompetent person―a person without legal capacity

content:
むひ〔無比〕
〈形〉Incomparable; unique; peerless; matchless; unmatched; unequalled; unrivalled; unparallelled; without parallelled; beyond comparison; beyond compare; sans pareil

content.content: 堅牢無比の戦艦
a battleship of matchless strength
我が国は世界無比の国体を有す
Our nationality has no equal in the world.
米穀の産額は世界無比である
Our production of rice is unparallelled in the world―without parallel in the world.
日本の風景は世界無比である
Nothing can surpass the beauty of Japan's scenery―There is nothing like Japan's scenery in the world.
海内無比の学校である
The school has no equal in all Japan.
彼は当代無比の文豪である
He is the greatest writer of the day.
日本は東洋無比の良港を有す
Japan has the finest harbours in the East.

content:
むび〔夢寐〕
〈名〉Sleep

content.content: 夢寐の間も忘れぬ
The idea forms part of myself.

むひつ〔無筆〕
〈名〉Illiteracy:(=の) illiterate; unlettered

content:
むびょうそくさい〔無病息災〕
〈形〉(A man) in sound health

content.content: 無病息災です
I am in the enjoyment of sound health.
老人は無病息災だ
The old man is hale and hearty.

むふうたい〔無風帯〕
〈名〉The horse latitudes; the doldrums

content:
むふんべつ〔無分別〕
〈名〉Indiscretion; imprudence:(=な) indiscreet (conduct); imprudent (step, etc.)

content.content: 無分別なことをする
to commit an indiscretion―commit an imprudence
無分別は若い時はありがちだ
Indiscretion is incidental to youth―Young people will be indiscreet.
深くなるほど無分別
Lovers will be indiscreet.
彼は無分別にも素性の賤しい者と結婚した
He was so imprudent as to―He had the imprudence to―marry beneath him.

content:
むへん〔無辺〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: こうだいむへん〔広大無辺〕

content:
むほう〔無法〕
〈形〉
1. (=不法)illegal; unlawful; lawless

content.content: 無法な社会
a lawless society
無法な処置
an illegal measure―an unlawful measure
この人は無法にもこちらでは何もせぬのに僕を打ちました
He has struck me without provocation―without justification―without sufficient cause.
無法も法の中
Fist-law is a sort of law.

content: 2. (=法外)immoderate; inordinate; exorbitant; unreasonable

content.content: 価が無法だ
The price is exorbitant―unreasonable.
無法に取る
They charge exorbitantly.
先方の要求が無法だ
Their demands are unreasonable.
彼は無法な望みを懐いている
He cherishes an immoderate ambition―inordinate desires.
無法なことを言うな
Don't talk such unreason!―Don't be so unreasonable!

content: 3. (=乱暴)outrageous; atrocious

content.content: 無法なことをする
to commit an outrage―commit an atrocity

content:
むぼう〔無謀〕
〈形〉Rash (deed); reckless (adventure); foolhardy (action); wild (scheme); mad (attempt, etc.)

content.content: 無謀なことをするな
Do not attempt anything rash!―Beware of rashness!
彼は好く言っても無謀だ
He is rash―reckless―foolhardy―to say the least of it.
無謀な策
a wild scheme―a mad scheme
不可能なことをしようとするのは無謀だ
It is madness to attempt the impossible.
彼を救わんとするのは無謀だ(不可能だ)
It is madness to try to save him.
無謀極まる
It is the height of rashness.
無謀な冒険をするな
Do not tempt Providence!―Do not fly in the face of Providence!
彼は無謀にも君に向かって弓を引いた
He had the hardihood to draw the sword against his lord.

content:
むほうしゅう〔無報酬〕
〈副〉Without recompense; free of charge; gratis; gratuitously; for nothing; for fame

content.content: 無報酬で書く人が多い
Many write for fame.
僕は無報酬で教えている
I am a free teacher.
彼らは無報酬で働いている
They work without recompense―Their services are free.

content:
むほうしん〔無方針〕
〈名〉Having no fixed policy

content.content: 当局者は無方針だ
The authorities have no fixed policy.
無方針では困る
One must have some fixed policy―One must pursue a definite line of policy.

むほうもの〔無法者〕
〈名〉An outrageous fellow; a ruffian

content:
むほん〔謀叛〕
〈名〉
1. A rebellion; a revolt; an insurrection; (high) treason; conspiracy; defection:(=する) to rebel; revolt; rise (against the government); to rise in arms, rise in revolt, rise in rebellion (against the government); to betray, turn traitor to (one's country); to fall from allegiance; to fall off

content.content: 謀叛を起こす
to raise a rebellion
謀叛を企てる
to plot a rebellion―plot against the government―conspire against the government
謀叛の旗を揚げる
to raise the standard of revolt
彼は自分の党派に謀叛をした
He has turned traitor to his cause.
謀叛をして死刑になった
He suffered for treason.
若い者はこれを見ると謀叛を起こす
The sight is a temptation to the young.
若い者に金をやると謀叛を起こす
To give money to the young is adding fuel to fire.
忙しいと謀叛を起こさない
Pressure of business keeps a man out of mischief.

content:
むほんしん〔謀叛心〕
〈名〉A rebellious spirit; rebellious designs

content.content: 彼は謀叛心を懐いている
He harbours rebellious designs.
若い者にこれを見せると謀叛心を起こす
The sight is a temptation to the young.
忙しいと謀叛心が起こらぬ
Pressure of business keeps a man out of mischief.

content:
むほんにん〔謀叛人〕
〈名〉A rebel; a traitor; an insurgent

content.content: 彼は我が党の謀叛人だ
He is a traitor to our cause.

むみ〔無味〕
〈形〉Tasteless; insipid; vapid; flat

むみかんそう〔無味乾燥〕
〈形〉Dry; as dry as dust

content:
むみょう〔無明〕
〈形〉Obscured by passion

content.content: 無明の闇に迷える人
a benighted heathen

content:
むめい〔無名〕
〈形〉
1. (=名称無き)nameless; unnamed

content.content: 無名の星はいくらもある
There are many nameless stars.

content: 2. (=名の顕われぬ)nameless (person) ; unknown (person) ; obscure (individual)

content.content: 無名の人だ
He is an obscure individual―a man unknown to fame.
無名の詩人
an obscure poet―a mute Milton

content: 3. (=無署名、匿名)unsigned (letter) ; anonymous (work) :(=で) anonymously

content.content: 無名の手紙
an unsigned letter―an anonymous letter
無名の作
an anonymous work
無名の作者
an anonymous writer
その本は無名の著者の作だ
The book is by an anonymous writer.
無名の投書
an anonymous contribution
無名で投書する
to be an anonymous contributor
無名氏
anonym―anon

content: 4. (=名分無き)unjustifiable, causeless, gratuitous, unwarranted (war, etc.)

content.content: 無名の師を起こす
to raise an unjustifiable war

content:
むめい〔無銘〕
〈形〉Unsigned; without the maker's name

content.content: この刀は無銘です
This sword has no name on it.
無銘の業物
a trenchant blade of unknown forge

むめいし〔無名指〕
〈名〉The ring-finger

むめいし〔無名氏〕
〈名〉Anonym; anon

content:
むめんきょ〔無免許〕
〈形〉Unlicensed (practitioner)

content.content: 無免許で医業を営む
to practise medicine without license

content:
むやちん〔無家賃〕
〈副〉Free of rent; rent-free

content.content: 彼らは無家賃で官舎に住んでいる
They live rent-free in government buildings.

content:
むやみに〔無闇に〕
〈副〉
1. (=無茶に) immoderately; inordinately; madly; to excess; like fury; like thunder; like hell; like blazes; like the devil; like one o'clock; like anything

content.content: 彼はむやみに子どもを可愛がる
He is immoderately fond of his children―He is inordinately fond of his children―He dotes upon his children.
そうむやみに急ぐことは無い
There is no occasion for such mad haste.
彼はむやみに食いむやみに飲む
He eats to excess―drinks to excess―commits excesses.
女が男にむやみに惚れている
She loves him to distraction.
彼はむやみに勉強する
He works like fury―like thunder―like hell―like the devil―like anything.
むやみに本を読む
He devours books―He is a voracious reader.

content: 2. (=無差別に)indiscriminately

content.content: そうむやみに人を入れては困る
You must not admit people so indiscriminately.
彼はむやみに人を賞める
He lavishes praise on everybody―He is lavish of his praise.
むやみに人をけなす
He condemns people in the gross.
むやみに人を信ずる
He will trust everybody.
むやみに人を疑う
He suspects everybody.
僕はむやみに人と交際しない
I am choice of my company.

content: 3. (=軽率に)rashly; recklessly

content.content: むやみに約束をするものでない
You should not make rash promises.
彼は人の言うことをむやみに信ずる
He is too ready to believe―too credulous.
彼はむやみに本を書く
He is a reckless writer.
むやみに馬を駆ける
He is a reckless rider.
あの人はむやみに口を利かない

A thousand thoughts throng on my mind.

On hearing the news, he was seized with thronging ambitions.
これをみてむらむらと懐郷の念が起こった
The sight made me feel an irresistible longing for home.

content:
むり〔無理〕
〈名〉
1. (=無理をするの無理)force; compulsion; violence; strain:(=な) forced(voice) ; violent (method) ; strained (imagination) ; impossible (work) :(=に) compulsorily; forcibly; by force ; by violence; too much:(いやなのを無理に)against one's will :(非と知りつつ無理に)against one's better judgment

content.content: 無理をする
to use force―use compulsion―do violence―attempt the impossible―(我が身なら)―force oneself―strain oneself
無理をすると身体に利く
The strain will tell on your constitution.
彼は無理をして身体をこわした
He has made himself ill by straining himself―The strain has told on him.
僕の身体は無理が利く
I can stand much strain.
若いうちは無理が利く
Young men can stand the strain of excesses―can stand excesses.
君は病気上がりだから無理をしてはいかん
You are convalescent and can not stand such strain.
この部屋に千人入れるのは無理だ
A thousand will strain the capacity of the room―It is impossible for this room to seat a thousand.
この仕事は僕には無理だ
The work is too much for me―too hard for me.
そんな無理をすると寿命を縮める
Such strain―Such violence―will shorten the natural term of your existence.
彼はどんな無理をしても目的を達する
He will go any length―go all lengths―move Heaven and earth―to gain his end―There are no lengths to which he will not go to gain his end.
自然に従うと無理がない
It is sweet to follow nature;
無理な言葉づかいをする
to do violence to grammar

content: 2. (=無理に何々する)to force; to strain

content.content: 無理に押し通る
to force one's way―force a passage
無理に押し入る
to force one's way in (to a house)
無理に押し出る
to force one's way out (of the house)
無理な声を出す
to force a voice
無理に笑う
to force a smile―force a laugh
花を無理に咲かせる
to force a flower
戸を無理に押し明ける
to force a door open
娘を無理に結婚さしたのだ
They forced her to marry―forced her into marriage.
議案を無理に通過させる
to force a bill through the House
無理に売りつける
to force the goods upon a person
(取らないという金を)無理に押しつける
to force the money upon a person
この仕事は無理に押しつけられたのだ
The work was forced upon me.
無理に白状させる
to force a confession out of one
無理に奪い取る
to force anything out of one's hands―wrest anything from one
僕に無理に証文を書かせたのだ
They made me sign a paper by force―They forced me to sign a paper.
いやだというのを無理に飲まされた
I was forced to drink against my will.
無理にやれば明日までに仕事ができます
If I force the work, I can have it ready by tomorrow.
無理無体に働かせる
He makes them work by force―He forces them to work.
無理な解釈をする
to put a force upon one's words―strain the meaning of a passage―stretch the sense of a passage―wrench the meaning of a passage―wrest the sense of a passage
無理に意味を取る
to force the meaning from a passage―extort the meaning from a passage
無理に算段する
to strain one's credit―stretch one's credit
無理に想像する
to strain one's imagination―stretch one's imagination
あの女を美人と見るには少し無理な想像を要する
It requires a stretch of imagination to take her for a beauty.
無理な勉強をする
to strain one's powers―stretch one's powers―make violent efforts
無理な勉強は止した方が好い
You had better not strain your powers―you ought to refrain from violent efforts.
無理な勉強は長く続かぬ
Violent efforts will not last long.
身体の続かないような無理をする
to burn the candle at both ends
法律を無理に曲げる
to strain the law―stretch the law
主義を無理に曲げる
to strain one's principles―do violence to one's principles
言葉を無理に使う
to do violence to grammar―torture a word
庭木を無理に曲げる
to torture a tree
何も(いやだというものを)無理にやることは無い
You need not make him go against his will.
何も無理に承諾することはない
You need not consent against your better judgement.

content: 3. (=無理をいうの無理)unreason; unreasonableness; unnaturalness; impossibility:(=な) unreasonable (demands); unnatural (English); unjust (condemnation); unjustifiable (conclusion) ; unfair (demands) ; impossible (expression) ; far-fetched(expression) ; wild (hopes or wishes) ; (such a success is) not to be expected:(=に) too much:(いやというのを無理に)against one's will:(非と知りつつ無理に)against one's better judgement

content.content: 無理を言う
to be unreasonable
そりゃ無理です
You are unreasonable.
お前は無理ばかり言っている
You are so unreasonable―You will not listen to reason.
無理な要求をする
to make unreasonable demands
そりゃ無理な註文だ
It is an unreasonable demand―an unfair demand―an impossible demand―requiring too much―asking too much―asking the impossible.
彼は全力を尽くしているのだからこの上望むのは無理だ
The poor fellow is doing his best. It is unreasonable to expect more―You can not, in reason, expect more.
僕のところへ無理難題を持ち込んでくる
They make unreasonable demands of me―demand too much of me―require too much of me―ask too much of me.
あのような身体の人にこの仕事は無理だ
It is unreasonable to set this task to a man of his constitution―The task is too much for a man of his constitution.
無理を主張する
to go beyond the bounds of reason
先方の主張もあながち無理ではない
The other party is not altogether unreasonable.
無理では無いように聞こえる
It sounds quite reasonable.
君がそう言うのは無理はない
You have good reason to say so―You may well say so―You are justified in saying so―Yours is a just remark―It is natural that you should say so―It is no wonder that you should say so.
彼が立腹するのも無理はない
He has good reason to be angry―He may well be angry―He is justified in his indignation―His indignation is just―It is quite natural that he should be angry―It is no wonder that he should be angry.
君がそう思うのも無理はない
You have good reason to think so―You may well think so―You may justly think so―It is natural that you should think so―Your thinking so is not without reason.
無理もない間違いだ
It is a natural mistake.
初学者にそんな本を読ませるのは無理だ
A beginner is not to be expected to read such books.
初学者にそんな問題を出すのは無理だ
A beginner can not be expected to solve such problems.
彼は英語を始めたばかりだから英語か話せると思うのは無理だ
He has only just begun his English, and can not be expected to speak it.
日本に来たての西洋人に英語を教えさせるのは無理だ
A foreigner new to Japan can not be expected to teach English well.
語学の初歩をも知らぬ者に文学は無理だ
One ignorant of the very elements of the language can not be expected to appreciate literature.
(どちらが道理か)どちらが無理か
(Which is in the right?) Which is in the wrong?
彼は自分の方が無理だと言って謝まった
He has acknowledged himself to be in the wrong.
先方の言うこともあながち無理ではない
The other party is not altogether in the wrong.
無理が通れば道理が引込む
Right must give way to might.
人に無理を頼む
to make a claim on one's friendship―make a draft on one's friendship―presume on one's friendship
ご無理をお願い申してすみません
I am sorry to make such a claim on your friendship―presume so far on your friendship.
こんな事をお願い申すのは無理だ
I have no claim on your friendship―I have no claim on you.
平生好くしておけば無理が利く
If I do well by him, I shall establish a claim on his friendship.
いやなお方の親切よりも好いたお方の無理が好い
I prefer the unkindness of the man I love to the kindness of the man I hate.
ご無理もごもっとも
You are always in the right―It is “very like a whale.”
ご無理ごもっともと言って聞き流しておけばよい
You have only to agree with him about everything he says.
無理な教育
unnatural education
無理な望み
wild hopes―wild wishes
無理な望みがかなった
My wildest hopes have been realized.
無理な言葉づかい
impossible expressions―far-fetched expressions

content:
むれ〔群〕
〈名〉A crowd (of people); a head (of deer); a flock (of sheep); a pack (of wolves); a swarm (of bees); a shoal, a school (of fish); a group (of islands); a cluster (of stars):(飛ぶものの群)a flight (of swallows or locusts)

content.content: 一群の人
a crowd of men―a throng of pleasure-seekers―a group of students―a troop of children―a bevy of girls―a gang of convicts―a horde of savages
一群の獣
a head of deer―a head of cattle―a head of wild horses―a flock of sheep―a drove of oxen―a park of wolves―a pack of hounds
一群の鳥
a flock of geese―a flight of swallows―a bevy of quails―a covey of partridges
一群の蜂や蚊
a swarm of bees―a swarm of mosquitoes
一群の魚
a shoal of herrings―a school of bonitoes
一群の島
a group of islands
一群の星
a cluster of stars
群を成す
Deer head together―Sheep flock together―Wolves pack―Bees swarm―Herrings shoal―Bonitoes school―Stars cluster.
獅子や虎は群を成さぬ
Lions and tigers do not head together.
三々五々群を成している
They stand in knots.
群を成して来る
(人なら)They come in crowds―(蛮人なら)―in hordes―(狼なら)―in packs―(飛鳥なら)―in flights―(蚊なら)―in swarms―(魚なら)―in shoals.
鯡は群を成して北海道の海岸に子を産みに来る

群を成す動物

content.content: パッチリした目

content: 《a》(目が)

content.content: 目が見える
I can see.
猫は暗闇で目が見える
The cat can see in the dark.
彼は目が見えぬ
He can not see―He is blind.
片方の目が見えぬ

どちらの目が見えないか
In which of his eyes is he blind?
右の目が見えぬ
He is blind in the right eye.
彼は目が見えなくなった
He has gone blind―lost his sight―lost his eyesight.
彼は年をとって目が見えなくなった
His eyesight fails (him) with age.
彼は美を見る目がある、美を見る目が無い
He has an eye for the picturesque―no eye for the picturesque.
目がさめる
to awake―wake up―(迷夢が覚めるの意味なら)―come to one's senses―(誤りをさとるの意味なら)―have one's eyes opened
僕は(起こされずに)独りで目がさめる
I awake of myself.
目がさめてみると見慣れぬ処に寝ておった
I awoke to find myself lying in a strange place.
放蕩息子はやっと目が覚めたとみえる
The prodigal son seems to have come to his senses.
君の話を聞いて目が覚めた
You have opened my eyes―My eyes are opened―The scales have fallen from my eyes.
目がさめるような色
a fresh colour
目がさめるような美人
a girl of conspicuous beauty
目がくらむ
to be blinded―be dazzled
痴情に目がくらむ
One is blinded with passion.
慾に目がくらむ
One is blinded by avarice.
彼は金に目がくらむような人でない
He is not the man to be blinded by love of money.
目がまわる
My head turns―My head swims―I feel dizzy―I feel giddy.
目がまわるような高い所
a dizzy height―a giddy height
見ると目がまわるようだ
The sight is bewildering.
目がまわるほど忙しい
I am in a whirl of business.
目がまわるような挙骨を喰った
I got a humming knock on the head.
目がかすむ
One's eyes dim―One's eyes mist.
今日は目がかすんでいる
My eyes are dim―My eyes are blurred―today.
目がうるむ
One's eyes water―One's eyes fill with tears―One's eyes swim with tears―One's eyes dim with tears.
目がちらつく
Things swim before one's eyes.
酔うと目がちらつく
Wine makes things swim before your eyes.
太陽に向かうと目がちらつく
One has the sun in one's eyes.
今夜は目が冴えて眠れぬ
I am wakeful tonight.
目がつぶれる
One loses one's eyesight.
こんな尊い物を見ると目がつぶれるぞ
The sight of the sacred document will dazzle your eyes―blast your eyes.
目が飛び出る
One's eyes start out of one's head.
彼は目が飛び出るほど驚いた
His eyes started out of his head for astonishment.
目が飛び出るような値段だ
It is an exorbitant price.
目が飛び出るような勘定書を出された
I was presented with a bouncing bill.
目が飛び出るほど取られた
I had to pay through the nose.
この子はいたずらでちょっとも目が離されぬ
I can not take my eyes off the boy for a moment, he is so mischievous.
君は目が早い
You have a quick eye.
目が鋭い
You have a sharp eye―You are lynx-eyed.
僕は目が好い、目が悪い
I have good eyes―bad eyes.
彼は目が上がっている
He has turned-up eyes―oblique eyes.
目が下がっている
He has turned-down eyes.
目が引込んでいる
He has deep-set eyes.
目が落ち込んでいる
He has sunken eyes―He is hollow-eyed.
目が痛い
I have sore eyes―My eyes hurt me.
彼は酔って目がどろんとしている
He has a drop in his eye.
君は目がこえている
You have a critical eye―You are a connoisseur.
お目が高い
You are a good judge―You have appreciation.
見物は目が高い
The audience have appreciation―They are an appreciative audience.
生徒は目が高い
The students are good judges of teachers.
彼は刀剣に目が利く
He is a judge of swords.
彼は書画を見る目がある
He has an eye for paintings.
あの人は酒に目が無い
He has no will before wine.
女に目が無い
He has no will before woman.
はたの目がうるさい
People will pry.

content: 《b》(目で)

content.content: 目で知らせる
to wink at one
目で感謝する
to thank with one's eyes―look one's thanks
彼は口で言えない礼を目で言った
He looked the thanks he could not express.
美人は目で殺す
A beauty's eyes do execution.
男を殺す目
a killing eye―a killing glance
人は本当のことを言っているか嘘を言っているか目でわかる
One can tell by his eye whether a man is telling the truth or a lie.
長い目で見ている
Time will show.

content: 《c》(目から)

content.content: 目から火が出た
I saw stars―It struck sparks out of my eyes.
目から火の出るような挙骨を喰った
I got a humming knock on the head.
目から火を放つ
His eyes flash fire.
目から鼻へ抜けるような男だ
He is a sharp fellow―He is a cute chap―He has a subtle mind.
法律の目から見れば人はみな平等だ
All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
彼の目から見れば我々は赤ん坊だ
We are babies in his eyes.
親の目から見れば彼はまだ子どもだ
He is still a child in his parents' eyes.
日本人の目から見れば美人じゃない
She is no beauty from the Japanese point of view.

content: 《d》(目も)

content.content: 目も当てられぬ
It is too dreadful to behold.
(人殺しの場などを形容して)目も当てられぬ光景だ
It is a gruesome sight.
目も当てられぬ病だ
It is a hideous disease―a horrible disease.
罹災者は目も当てられぬ惨状だ
The sufferers are in a dire plight.
彼は女には目もくれぬ
He does not look at a woman.
左右に目もくれずまっすぐに進んだ
He held on his course without looking right or left.
心配で夜の目も寝られぬ
I can not sleep o' nights for anxiety―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Anxiety keeps me awake o' nights.
彼女は夜の目も寝ずに介抱してくれた
She sat up with me all night.
目も口ほどにものを言う
“The eye is more eloquent than the mouth.”

content: 《e》(目に)

content.content: 目に見える
It is visible―(増減などなら)―perceptible.
目に見えぬ
It is invisible―(変化などなら)―imperceptible.
目に見える物
visible things
目に見えぬ神
the invisible God
数が目に見えるほどずつ増す、目に見えぬほどずつ増す
The number increases perceptibly―increases imperceptibly.
病人は目に見えて快くなる
The invalid improves perceptibly.
彼の将来が目に見えるようだ
I see his future greatness before my eyes.
その光景が今なお目に見えるようだ
I have a vivid recollection of the scene.
目に見えるような話
a graphic account―a glowing account
目に見えるように話す
to describe in glowing terms
目に付く
to catch the eye
その広告が目についた
The advertisement caught my eye.
目に立つ
to strike the eye―stand out―to be striking―conspicuous
あの建物は目に立つ
The building strikes the eye.
目に立つ人相だ
He has striking features.
彼女の支度が目に立つ
She is conspicuously dressed.
彼のやり方が目に立つ
His way of doing things is calculated for effect.
彼の姿が目に立たぬ、目に付かぬ
He presents an inconspicuous figure―an insignificant figure.
目に止まる
to attract one's notice―draw one's attention
あの女がお目に止まりましたか
Has she attracted your notice?―Have you noticed her?
この作が世間の目に止まった
The work attracted the notice of the public.
僕の目に止まった事実がある
A fact has come under my observation―come under my notice―come under my eyes.
その事実は僕に目に止まらなかった
The fact escaped my notice―escaped my observation.
刀を抜くのも鞘に納めるのも目に止まらぬほど早い
He draws and sheathes his sword with lightning speed.
目に触れる
One's eyes fall on something―One's eyes rest on something.
甲板に出てみると妙な物が目に触れた
When I went on deck, my eyes fell on a curious object.
(日本に接近すると)第一に目に触れるものは富士山だ
The first object that greets the eyes is Mt. Fuji.
目にさわる
to offend the eye
あの建物が目にさわる
That building is offensive to the eye―an eyesore.
何か目に入った
Something has got into my eye―There is something in my eye.
目に入っても痛くない
You might put it in your eye and not feel it.
あの子は目に入れたいほど可愛い
She is the apple of my eye.
目に映ずる
to strike one―impress one
あの人は君の目にいかに映じたか
How does he strike you?―How has he impressed you?
日本は外国人の目にはいかに映ずるか
How does Japan strike foreigners?
日本は外国人の目には美しい国に見える
Japan strikes foreigners as a beautiful country.
望遠鏡や顕微鏡を目に合わせる
to adjust a telescope or a microscope to the eye―set a telescope―set a microscope
どんな目に逢う
to have an experience
ひどい目に逢った
I had a woeful experience―I had a hard time of it―It went hard with me.
見つかるとひどい目に逢うぞ
It will go hard with you if you are caught.
そんなことをするとひどい目に逢わしてやるぞ(目に物見せん)
You shall smart for it―pay dearly for it.
君にはひどい目に逢わせられた
You have dealt harshly by me.
君はこんなひどい目に逢わせられようとは思わなかった
I did not expect such treatment at your hands.
(これだけ働いて何の報酬も無いとは)ひどい目に逢うものだ
I am ill used.
(競技の相手などを)ひどい目に逢わせる
to punish a competitor
辛い目に逢った
I had a trying experience―had a bitter experience―had a hard time of it.
怖い目に逢った
I had a dreadful experience―had a fright―got a horrid scare.
危い目にあった
I was exposed to danger―I had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
踏んだり蹴ったりの目に逢う
to suffer wrongs and contumelies
踏んだり蹴ったりの目に逢わせる
to add insult to injury
彼女の面影がいつも目にちらついている
Her face is ever present to my senses.
その恐ろしい光景がまだ目にちらついている
The dreadful sight still haunts my eyes.
敵は目に余る大軍なり
We must fight a vast army―a mighty host.
目に角立てる
to glare
彼は目に角立てて僕に向かって来た
He turned upon me with glaring eyes.
それを聞いて目に涙
The tears came into my eyes at the news―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The news brought tears into my eyes.
彼は目に涙をたたえておった
He had tears in his eyes.
目に涙をたたえて物語った
He told his story with tears in his eyes.
鬼の目に涙
to wring tears from the hardest heart
お目にかかる
to have the pleasure of seeing one
貴君には前にお目にかかったことがあります
I have had the pleasure of seeing you before.
またお目にかかります
I hope I shall see more of you.
あの方にはよくお目にかかります
I see much of him.
ちぃともお目にかかりません
I see nothing of him.
お初にお目にかかります
I am glad to meet you―I am glad to make your acquaintance.
好い所でお目にかかりました
I am glad to have met you.
何でもお目にかけます
I will show you anything―submit anything to your inspection.
何をお目にかけましょうか
What shall I show you?―What shall I submit to your inspection?
お目にかけるような品はありません
We have nothing to show you―nothing worthy of your inspection.
薄暗がりで読書するのは目に悪い
Reading in the twilight is bad for the eyes.
目に保養(正月)をさせる
to feast one's eye's on wonders
今日は目に正月をさせました
I have feasted my eyes on wonders today.
こんな物を目にしたことが無い
I never saw its like―looked upon its like―set eyes on its like.
法律の目には貴賤上下無し
All men are equal in the eyes of the law.
彼の目には僕らは赤児に見えよう
We are babies in his eyes.
彼は親の目には、まだ子どもだ
He is still a child in his parents' eyes.
目に一丁字無し
He is illiterate.
目に一丁字無き野蛮人すら道徳の原理を心得ている
Even the untutored savages know the principles of morality.
あの人は目に険がある
He has dangerous eyes.

content: 《f》(目の)

content.content: 目の見える人
one who can see
目の見えない人
a blind man
目の薬
a sight for sore eyes
目の毒
an eyesore
薄暗がりの読書は目の毒だ
Reading in the twilight is bad for the eyes.
目の前で
under one's eyes―in one's presence
目の前で品物を改めさせた
I had the goods examined under my eyes.
しかも目の前で起こった出来事だ
The event happened under my very eyes.
彼は僕の目の前で弟を打った
He struck my brother in my presence―in my sight.
目の上のタンこぶ
a thorn in one's flesh―a nettle in one's side
目の高い見物
an appreciative audience
目の無い見物
an unappreciative audience
子には目の無き親心
“No father knows his own child.”
目の引込んだ人
a man with deep-set eyes
目の落ち込んだ人
a man with sunken eye―a hollow-eyed man
これこそ目のご馳走だ
This is indeed a feast for the eye.
日本料理は目のご馳走だ
Japanese cooking pleases the eye.
目のさめるような色
a fresh colour―a vivid colour
目のさめるような美人
a girl of conspicuous beauty
目のまわるような混雑
a bewildering confusion
目のまわるほど忙しい
I am in a whirl of business.
彼は目の色を変えて怒った
He was fearfully angry.
目の玉の抜けるような値段だ
It is an exorbitant price.
目の玉の抜けるような勘定書を出された
I was presented with a bouncing bill.
目の玉の抜けるほど取られた
I had to pay through the nose.
目のつけ処
One's views of things―a point of view.
専問家は目のつけ処が違う
A professional man takes a different view of things―You take a professional view of things―You see with a professional eye.
君は目のつけ処が違う
You look from a different point of view.
目の保養(正月)をする
to feast one's eyes on wonders―feed fat on wonders
目の明るいうちにきっと目的を遂げる
I will accomplish my purpose while I live.
俺の目の黒いうちは決してそんなことはさせぬ
They shall not do so as long as I am alive―while I have a drop left in my veins.
目の届く限り一面の火の海
All was fire as far as my eye could reach.
目の届く処には何事も無い
Nothing happened within my vision.
目の届かぬ処には何事があったか知らぬ
I do not know what happened beyond my vision.
目の寄る処に玉も寄る
“Birds of a feather flock together.”
主人は僕を目の仇敵にして小言を言う
My master finds fault with me whenever he sees me―He never sees me without finding fault with me.

content: 《g》(目を)

content.content: 目を開く、目を明く
to open ones eyes
目を開いている
I have my eyes open.
目を明いて眠る人がある
Some people sleep with their eyes open.
目を開いて見れば見馴れぬ所に寝ておった
I opened my eyes to find myself lying in a strange place.
目を閉じる、目をふさぐ
to shut one's eyes
(死んだ人の)目を閉ざす
to close one's eyes
僕は目をつぶって人のあらを見ない
I shut my eyes to others' faults―wink at others' faults.
目をこする
to rub one's eyes―dig one's fist into one's eyes
目をさます
to awake―wake up―(迷夢が覚めるの意味なら)―come to one's senses
子どもなどの目をさます
to awaken a child
びっくりして目をさました
I awoke in surprise.
(朝は起こされずに)独りで目をさます
I awake of myself.
目をさましてみると母が枕もとに泣いておった
I awoke to find my mother crying by my bedside.
彼は(寝苦しそうに)時々目をさました
He had a broken sleep.
ひと晩(眠らずに)目をさましておった
I kept awake all night.
放蕩息子はやっと目を覚ましたと見える
The prodigal son seems to have come to his senses.
(まだ目が覚めぬなら)俺が目を覚まさしてやる
I will bring him to his senses.
目を向ける
to turn one's eyes on a person or thing
皆その人の方へ目を注いだ
All eyes were turned upon him.
目を上げる
to raise one's eyes―look up
目を下げる
to lower one's eyes―look down
目をくらます
to dazzle the eye―blind the eye―(だましての意味なら)―hoodwink one―bamboozle one―throw dust in one's eye's―pull the wool over one's eyes
目をくらますばかりの輝き
The splendour is enough to dazzle the eye.
あれは人の目をくらます手段だ
It is only a blind―only a trick to throw dust in people's eye.
彼は人の目をくらまして悪いことをする
He does evil in secret―by stealth―on the sly.
目をまわす
(気絶するの意味なら)to faint―swoon―be stunned―fall senseless―(びっくりするの意味なら)―be bewildered―be dumfounded―be flabbergasted
彼は頭を打たれて目をまわした
He was stunned by a blow on the head.
大都会の雑沓には田舎者が目をまわす
The tumults of a great city bewilder a countryman.
目をまわすような混雑だ
There is a bewildering confusion.
その値を聞いてたいがいの人は目をまわす
Most people will be dumfounded―flabbergasted―at the price.
目をまわすような挙骨を喰った
I got a humming knock on the head.
目を通す
to look to―look over―look through―anything
主婦が(人任せにせずに)万事に自分で目を通す
The mistress looks to everything herself―sees to everything herself.
書類に(一々)目を通した
I have looked over the papers―looked through the papers.
さっと目を通した
I have run over the papers―run my eyes over the papers.
今一度目を通しておこう
I will go over them once more.
目を引く
to attract notice―draw attention
彼女の支度は目を引く
Her dress attracts attention.
東京の商人は人目を引くように店を飾ることが上手だ
The Tokyo tradesman knows how to decorate his shop so as to attract notice.
日本は世界の目を引いている
Japan is the cynosure of the world―the observed of all observers.
目を付ける
(警戒してなら)to keep an eye on one―have an eye on one―(野心があってなら)―have an eye to anything
あの男は挙動があやしいから目を付けろ
Keep an eye on that man―his movements are suspicious.
警察ではあの男に目を付けている
The police have an eye on that man.
彼は女の財産に目を付けている
He has an eye to her property―He has designs on her property.
この子はいたずらでちょっとも目を離すことができぬ
The boy is so mischievous that I can not take my eyes off him for a moment.
彼はそんな物には目を付けぬ
He does not look at such things―He flies at higher game.
目を止める
to fix one's eyes on anything
お目を止めてご覧なさい
Note well!
(四方に)目を配る
to look (sharp) about one―have all one's eyes about one
四方八方に目を配って敵を警戒している
We are on the alert for the enemy.
目を掛ける
to be kind to one―show one kindness
目を掛けておやりなさい
Be kind to her!
目をくれる
to look at―care for―attach importance to―anything
彼は女には目をくれぬ
He will not look at women.
彼は金銭には目もくれぬ
He does not care for money.
(金持ちだから)金銭問題には目をくれぬ
He attaches no importance to the question of expense―The consideration of expense does not weigh with him.
目を盗む
to elude observation
彼は人の目を盗んで悪いことをする
He does evil in secret―by stealth―on the sly―surreptitiously.
彼は久しく警察の目を盗んでいる奴だ
He has long eluded the police.
彼は親の目を盗んで遊びに行く
He visits gay quarters by eluding paternal vigilance―He takes surreptitious pleasure.
親の目を盗んで河へ泳ぎに行った
I went for a surreptitious swim in the river.
目を奪う
to dazzle one's eyes
目をさえぎる
to obstruct the view
目をさえぎる物
an obstruction to the view
目をつぶす
to put out one's eyes
目を泣きつぶす
to cry out one's eyes―cry oneself blind
あまりの悲しさに目を泣きつぶした
She cried herself blind in her sorrow.
女が目を泣きはらしていた
She was blubbered with crying.
目を怒らす
to glare
目を怒らして向かって来た
He turned on me with glaring eyes.
目を見張る
to strain one's eyes―dilate one's eyes
目を見張って
with strained eyes―with dilated eyes
目を皿のようにする
to open one's eyes wide
目をぎょろぎょろさせる
to roll one's eyes―goggle one's eyes
目をすえる
to set one's eyes
目をすえて
with set eyes
目を丸くして驚く
to stare
これはと目を丸くした
I stared in wonder―opened my eyes in wonder.
女に目を細くする
to cast sheep's eyes on a woman
目を引込ませて焼餅を焼いている
She is consumed with jealousy.
生き馬の目を抜く
to pull out one's eye-teeth
江戸っ子は生き馬の目を抜く
The Edokko is as sharp as a needle.
せっかく画いた虎に目を入れないよう
to stop short of the one thing needful
君は眠そうな目をしている
You have sleepy eyes―heavy eyes.

content:
《h》
〈その他〉

content.content: 目と鼻の間に
under your nose―under your very nose
目と目と見合わせた
Our eyes met―We exchanged glances.
目あれば京にに上る
“Who has a tongue can go to Rome.”
目はあっても節孔同然
He can not read―He is illiterate.
鵜の目鷹の目で(捜す)
to seek with eager eyes
鵜の目鷹の目の目で顔のあらを捜す
to scrutinize one's face

content: 2. (=賽の目)a pip:(碁盤の目) a square:(網の目) a mesh:(織物の目) texture:(木理の目) grain:(鋸の目) a tooth:(秤の目) graduation; scale-notches (of a steelyard)

content.content: 鋸の目を立てる
to set a saw
物差の目を盛る
to graduate a rule
目のつんだ織目
close texture
目の荒い織目
loose texture―coarse texture
(ばくち打のいわゆる)目が出ない
Luck goes against one.
目が出る
Luck turns in one's favour.

content: 3. (=目方)weight

content.content: 目が切れる
to be short weight
目を盗む
to give short weight
もんめ〔匁〕
百二十目
a pound

content:
め〔目〕
〈接尾詞〉

content.content: 三番目
the third (of a row)―(名簿なら)―the third on the list
五日目に
on the fifth day―(事があってからなら)―five days after the event
三年目
the third year
東京へ出て三年目に父が死んだ
Father died three years after we came to live in Tokyo.
英国では七年目七年目に畑を休ませる
In England, fields are allowed to lie fallow every seven years.
その家は三軒目です、四軒目です
The house is next-door but one―three doors off.
角から五軒目
It is four doors from the corner―the fifth door from the corner.
潮は今変わり目
The tide is on the turn.

めあかし〔目証〕
〈名〉(The former name for) a detective

content:
めあき〔目明き〕
〈名〉
1. (=目の見える者)one who has eyes; one who can see

content.content: 世の中は目明き千人盲千人
There are in the world as many who can see as who can not―The discerning and the undiscerning divide the world.

content:
2. (=文字を知る者)one who can read; a literate man
3. (=事理を解する者)one who has sense; a sensible man; a wise man

めあたらしい〔目新らしい〕
〈形〉Novel; new (to one); strange (to one)

content.content: 見るものはことごとく目新らしい
Every sight is strange to me―new to me.
目新らしくなくなった
It has ceased to be novel―The novelty has worn off.

content:
めあて〔目当て〕
〈名〉
1. (=目的)an aim; an end; an object

content.content: 何を目当てにする
to aim at anything―to be after something
彼らは学問が目当てではない
They do not aim at scholarship.
あの人の来るのは何が目当てだろう
I wonder what he is after.
何を目当てに働く
to work for something
たいがいの人は金を目当てに働く
Most people work for money.
僕は金を目当てに書くのではない
I do not write for money.
外国では持参金を目当てに結婚する人が多い
In foreign countries, most people marry for money.
僕は報酬が目当てではない
Emolument is no object with me.
目当てがはずれる
to miss one's aim―miss one's object―be disappointed of one's expectations

content: 2. (=案内)a guide

content.content: 星を目当てにする
to make a star one's guide
星を目当てにして航海する
to sail with a star as one's guide

content:
めあわす〔妻す〕
〈他動〉To marry (one's daughter to a man); to give (one's daughter) in marriage (to a man)

content.content: 彼は娘を貴人にめあわした
He has given his daughter in marriage to a nobleman.

content:
めい〔名〕
〈接頭詞〉Noted; famous; renowned; celebrated:(より)god; great

content.content: 名馬
a good steed―a Bucephalus
名判官
a great judge―a second Daniel―a second Ooka
名案
a good plan

content:
めい〔名〕
〈接尾助数詞〉Number of persons

content.content: 死者十名負傷者五十名
There were 10 killed and 50 wounded.
一学級の生徒数は五十名に制限されている
A class is restricted to 50 students.

content:
めい〔命〕
〈名〉
1. (=命令)a command; orders; directions; instructions; injunctions; one's wishes; the word; a commission

content.content: 命を発する、命を下す
to issue orders―give orders―give the word―say the word
出発の命が下った
Orders are given to depart―We are ordered to depart.
命に従う、命を守る、命を奉ずる
to obey orders
堅く命を守ります
I will obey your orders to the letter―Your word shall be law to me.
命を守れ
Mind the word!
命に従え
Obey me!
子どもは親の命に従うものだ
Children should obey their parents.
彼は命を奉じて英国へ赴いた
He proceeded to England in obedience to orders.
貴命に従い早速上京仕る可く侯
I shall come to town without delay in obedience to your wishes.
惟命是従う
I only obey orders―I am at his beck and call.
命に背く
to disobey orders―act contrary to one's wishes
お前は上官の命に背いたのが悪い
You have done wrong in disobeying your senior's orders.
彼は親の命に背いた
He has acted contrary to his father's wishes.
お前は僕の命に背いたね
You have acted against my wishes.
彼は親の命に背いて学校を止めた
He has left school against his gather's wishes.
親の命を重んずる
to have a regard for one's father's injunctions
彼は親の命を重んじて酒を飲まぬ
He abstains from wine with a regard for his father's injunctions.
彼は親の命を侮蔑した
He has set paternal authority at naught.
そのままそこに居れという命に接した
I have received orders―I have orders―My orders are―to stay where I am.
命を待つ
to await orders
弁護士は命を待って訴訟を起こすことになっている
My lawyer awaits my instructions to Institute a suit.
命を執行する
to execute one's orders―execute a commission
命に依り
by order
その筋の命に依り
by order of the authorities
知事の命に依ってしたことだ
It was done by order of the governor.
天皇陛下の命に依り
by command of the Emperor
彼らは命を聞いててきぱきと立働く
They act promptly at the word.
彼の命が行れる
His orders are obeyed―His word is law.

content: 2. (=命)life

content.content: 命危し
His life is in danger.
命は天に在り
Life and death are decreed by Heaven.
命旦夕に迫る
His days are numbered.
命は義に依りて軽し
I hold my life at nothing as compared with my cause.

content: 3. (=運命、天命)destiny; fate; the decree of fate; God's will

content.content: これ天の命なり
This is the decree of Heaven―Heaven's will.
天なり命なり、天なる哉命なる哉
God's will be done!―Thy will be done!
死生命あり
Life and death are decreed by Heaven.
天を楽しみ命を知る
to submit to Heaven's will

content:
めい〔明〕
〈名〉
1. (=光明)light; brightness; clearness
2. (=視力)eyesight

content.content: 明を失う
to lose one's sight―go blind

content: 3. (=眼識)discernment; penetration; an eye―(for something)

content.content: 彼は人を見るの明がある
He has an eye for character―He is a good reader of character.
先見の明がある
He has foresight―He is far-sighted.
誤りを見る明がある
He has a quick eye for errors.
悪計を看破するの明が無かった
He had not the eye to see through the design.

content:
めい〔銘〕
〈名〉
1. (=碑銘)an epitaph; a monumental inscription

content.content: 記念碑には銘がある
The monument bears an inscription.

content: 2. (=刀剣などの銘)(the maker's or author's) name, signature

content.content: 銘を打つ
to cut one's name (on a sword)―sign one's work
この刀に正宗という銘が打ってある
The sword bears Masamune's signature.
正宗と銘が打ってあっても本物は少ない
Few of the swords bearing Masamune's signature are genuine.

content: 3. (=警語)a precept; a motto

content.content: 座右の銘
a motto
もって座右の銘とすべし
It is a good motto.

content:
めいあん〔名案〕
〈名〉A good plan; a good idea; a capital idea; a happy idea; a bright idea; a brilliant idea; a splendid idea

content.content: 何か名案が無いか
Can't you think of some good plan?
名案が浮かんだ
I have thought of a good plan―I have hit upon a good idea―I am struck with a good idea―A good idea has struck me―A good idea has occurred to me.
そりゃ名案だ
A capital idea!―A happy idea!―A bright idea!―A splendid idea.
人智以上の名案だ
It is an inspiration!

めいあん〔明暗〕
〈名〉Light and darkness; light and shade:(書画)chiaroscuro

content:
めいい〔名医〕
〈名〉A famous doctor; a great doctor

content.content: 彼は名医として全国に有名だ
He is known as a great doctor throughout the land.
